Everyone scurried out of the class, some of the guys in the class glanced at Karen an Luke, smirking at the "couple".

As soon as everyone left, including Karen, Luke went up to Miss Scarlett, who was just getting ready for her next class.

"Miss Scarlett?"

Miss Scarlett looked up to see the Riolu looking back. "Yes, Luke? How may I help you?"

"Well, you know Karen, I'm going to make her something tonight, and I was wondering what I should do to make her happy. Because you're a girl I would be hoping you would know."

"Well Luke, You need to make her something she would really like. Do you know anything she likes the taste of?"

Luke thought for a moment before replying.

"Well she likes the taste of..."

Luke almost forgot about the Poochyena, but he looked down at his midsection and instantly remembered. He knew he had to get Karen to leave so he can spit the pooch out and not get him in trouble with Karen.

Luke rubs his belly and tries to think of a solution to get away. Suddenly one pops up into his head.

"Hey Karen, want to play a game?"

"I don't know... what game is it?"

Luke waits for Karen to decide. "I DID like how you tasted." Karen says with a purr. "I was afraid you were gonna say that..." Luke sighs. "Come here." the Lucario says. Luke reluctantly walks over, but then says to her, "I like the carrying plan better!" "Does it look like I want the carrying plan?" the Lucario replies. She grabs the shaking Riolu by the feet and holds him over her mouth. As he's being lowered, Luke swings up and grabs her paw. "Please? Can we NOT do this plan?" he pleads. "We're sticking with this plan." Karen replies with a growl. She puts her entire paw in her mouth, sucks the Riolu off, and pulls her paw out. She licks Luke all over as she savors him like a losenge before swallowing. Luke curls up inside her belly once again as the Lucario gives her belly a pat. "I'll never get tired of that." she sighs. The Riolu's eyes close as he curls up in the darkness. "better get comfortable." he mutters to himself as he relaxes.

Then...

1121312.content:
Luke began to scream, mindlessly shouting as he turned and fled down the hall. He had to get away! He had to flee! He didn't want to end up on either lucario's hips, and he couldn't take either of them on alone! He could hear the two jackals shouting at each other and the soft patter of their feet as they gave chase.
"Idiot! you let him get away!" Shouted the female.
"Screw that! it's your fault!" the male retorted. Both voices got louder and louder as the distance between them and Luke got smaller and smaller. In an act of desperation, Luke spotted an upcoming corner and skidded around it, into an adjacent hall. Unfortunately this hall was occupied; when Luke sped into the hallway he ran headfirst against he fat belly of a huge pokemon. with a yelp and a squeal, Luke bounced off the rotund gut and fell on his butt.
"Oof!" grunted the pokemon.
"Please help me!" He shouted in desperation. Luke didn't care who or what the pokemon was, so long as he could escape the stomachs of his lucario pursuers.

choices: "If by protection, you mean on the menu!" (vore)
11213121.content:
Luke looked up at his potential savior, taking in the massive bulk of a large, purple Nidoking who stood in his path. Everything about the pokemon was huge; he himself was several times taller than the riolu, his arms bulged with strength and muscle, his gut was round, but held a fair chunk of muscle, and his genitals seemed to exude their own gravitational force as they swayed mere inches from the ground. If Luke could convince him to help...
"Gotchya!" the lucario's shouted in unison as they rounded the corner. Luke sprang to his feet in fear, backing up and pressing himself against the Nidoking's bulk. the riolu shivered, eyes snapping between the gut's of both jackal pokemon, knowing what would happen if the Nidoking decided not to help. His aura nearly exploded with pure terror, antennae raising. He looked up at the Nidoking, their eyes met for a brief moment and Luke could have sworn he saw the huge pokemon nod.
"What's all the noise?" the poison-type grumbled as he turned his attention to the lucario's. both of the jackal's hesitated, not daring to take a step forward until they deduced the pokemon's alignment. the nidoking dwarfed the lucarios easily, if he wanted he could have knocked the two out with a swing of his mighty dick alone.
"Hall-sweeping Ryan, this kid doesn't have a hall pass and we were going to take him to the principals office." the female said. the Ryan scoffed.
"Yeah, cause that's worth screamin' 'bout." Ryan shook his head in disbelief.
"while we're here, Where's your hall pass?" The male lucario spoke up, taking a daring step forward.
"Don't need one, who's gunna stop me? you?" Ryan laughed and smacked his belly, which jiggled. "I'd like to see you try."
"They were going to eat me!" Luke squeaked, hugging himself close to the Nidoking's leg.
"Were not!" the male shouted.
"Oh shut up Chris. we all do it." Ryan snapped, taking a step forward. "In fact..." With a swift swing of his arm, the nidoking reached forward and grabbed the female lucario by the scruff of her neck, raising her into the air. She screamed loudly as a large, rough tongue slid across Ryan's lips. He opened his mouth wide, strands of drool spread and snapped between his teeth as he casually dropped the lucario into his jaws. his lips sealed around her waist, and her screams were immediately muffled by his cheeks. with a smooth motion of his tongue, Ryan slurped messily over the lucario's flailing legs and tucked them into his broad muzzle. With a smirk, he tilted his head back, and swallowed.
Both riolu and lucario stared in shock and fear as the muffled screaming, flailing bulge traveled down Ryan's throat, disappeared beneath his broad chest, and reappeared as a huge squirming lump in his already massive gut.
"This riolu here is under my protection, if you have any problems you can deal with my agent." Ryan smacked his stomach, eliciting a loud belch from his lips. "Uuurp!" Chris visibly shuddered at the belch, eyes glued to the struggling lucario within the nidoking. the lucario gave a very slight nod of acceptance before turning and dashing down the hall.
"Th-thanks." Luke whimpered, his own eyes staring at his ex-aggressor.
"No problem." Ryan grumbled. "S-so I'm under your protection?"
11213121.title: The Pokemon was a Nidoking

"Of course, there's not better protection than my gut!" the Nidoking said with a chuckle as he swiftly reached down and lifted the Riolu with a strong, iron grip. Luke screamed and shouted, kicking and flailing as he tried to escape his savior-turned-predator.
"But, you just ate!" Luke pleaded with wide, scared eyes. he looked down at Ryan's stomach, seeing it bulge and writhe beneath the layers of fat and muscle. The lucario chick must have still been alive, much to Luke's terror.
"I sure did, finally get to stop those two's griping." Ryan admitted with a happy pat of his gut. "and you'll make a delicious post-meal appetizer." the nidoking's mouth split into an ear-to-ear smile as his fat, rough tongue slipped out and ran itself over his lips in anticipation, wetting them with hot, smelly drool.
Luke let out a high pitched scream as the nidoking raised him over his head and split his gigantic maw. It was like a huge, fleshy cavern. the rough tongue lolled out over his bottom lip like a huge red carpet inviting the tiny riolu to follow it into the back of his gullet, that squelched and gulped to deal with the large pool of drool that was building up; Luke saw the gullet open up like a huge, terrible waterslide, then close as the drool slid all the way down.
"Please please please! I'll do anything! just don't eat me!" Luke cried. Ryan hesitated for a moment and considered the idea.

Luke's words fell on hungry ears unfortunately, and without another moment of thought Ryan dropped the riolu into his cavernous muzzle, snapping his jaws shut around the pokemon. If he could eat the Lucario in two gulps, fitting Luke into his mouth was more like sucking on an over sized hard candy. Luke cried out for mercy as his body was sloshed about and drool covered his form. Either Ryan didn't hear him, or more likely didn't care about the morsel in his mouth, because the only thing shouting managed to do was hurt Luke's voice. Desperately Luke held onto the massive tongue below him, hoping that if he could outlast the nidoking's desire to feed he would be let out. This proved useless however as the huge, squishy carpet of a tongue was both too huge to hold onto and too wet and slippery with drool to get a good grasp of. Instead the riolu's body was at mercy to whatever it was Ryan felt he wanted. Luke also tried standing in the beasts mouth and pushing the two parts of his jaws apart long enough to jump out and break for it, but that didn't work either since the constant movement of the squishy tongue below kept him completely off balance.
With a final attempt to part Ryan's muzzle, Luke slipped and his legs inadvertently fell into the hungry pokemon's gullet with a wet slurp. The tight tube suctioned to the riolu's legs, pulling him down into the deadly waterslide of flesh. Luke cried out and scrambled to get a hold on the surface of Ryan's tongue, but to no avail as the appendage lifted up to swallow him down.
sliding down the throat was hot, sticky, and surprisingly loud with thumping of Ryan's over sized heart. all around Luke he was squeezed until he felt he couldn't breath, then he would be released to drop down a bit further and gasp some air before the tightness would come back. It was terrible.
Soon the riolu finally dropped into the cavernous container that is the pokemon's gut, and he took a deep breath. The smell was horrid, rotten, and stale, but it was salvation to his lungs. It took Luke a moment to realize however, that he was not sitting on the same wet fleshy walls that surrounded most of the cavernous gut, but something fluffy, but still wet.
"Glad there's some justice in this guys hunger." spat out a rather rude voice from the darkness. It was the lucario, still alive within the tight gut of their captor. The gut began to shake and lurch to the rythm of lumbering footsteps.

Emma, who was only about a month younger than the eevee, was always seen as a younger sister. Having run far away from her abusive family, Emma wondered the region, stealing berries and pokeblocks in order to stay alive, but unfortunately her success rate was little and occasionally she would go days without food. After about a month of living on her own, she became ill, passing out on a rock near a creek during a storm. For once in her unfortunate life, faith shined down upon her, because moments later, just when the storm began to pick up, a young eevee with a bag full of wild, assorted berries around her neck, came running up along the bank of the creek just in time to spot Emma's nearly lifeless form before the flash flood got her. She was quickly dragged by the tail, onto the highest bank where they waited out the storm in a hollowed out red wood tree. If it were not for Rose's impeccable timing and plentiful berry bag full of oran, lum, and other assortment of wild berries, Emma's world would have came to a permanent end at the bottom of a creek bed. Ever since that day the two have been living alone together on their own, taking advantage of the free pokemon enrollment school and using it as a place for food, shelter, and knowledge.

Rose yawned, stretching out along the grass before get on her feet. "How you can get up this early and be full of energy is beyond me." She said in tired amusement as she watched the excited poochyena bouncing circles around her with both of their book bags in her mouth. It wasn't a moment later that she felt the sudden weight of her own book bag bring her wobbly stature back to the ground. "I hate mornings..."

"Whoops... Im soooo sorry! I guess I should have waited for you to wake up a little more before giving you your bag." Emma said, her tail between her legs. She always made these little mistakes no matter how hard she tried, but because of all her energy, she always had a hard time understanding the words of wisdom she has been told countless times. "Look before you leap."

"You didn't eat another citris berry for breakfast did you? You know how hyper you get when you eat those in the morning." Rose said as she stood up, once again adjusting her stance, but this time with a new load hanging around her neck. "Okay Im ready Emma... Time for another day of school." She said in a flat tone as the two friends started along the path to school. "Man I could really go for a citris berry right about now. Could you be sure to remind me to stop by the school garden along the way Emma, or else I might fall asleep." Rose said wobbling along side Emma.

"Certainly," She replied. "Although I am part Fairy-type, I am unaffected by any Poison-type attack due to my primary Steel-typing. Instead, I am more succeptable to Fire and Ground-types."

"Very good. Being able to identifying one's weakness is one thing, but being able to identifiy ones own is another," Mewtwo said as he turned back to the blackboard. "Knowing your own weakness can help you work towards improvement, even to the point where that weakness can no longer hold you back."

As class continued, Ember couldn't help but wonder if all the rumors about this school were real. About how only half the new students lasted the first year. About how so many pokemon dissapeared here. Before, she would've never thought those rumors were true. But now, after everything that has happened, Ember was a skeptic no more.

"And now I'd like to ask two students to come foward for a demonstration... How about... Ember and Koul."

"Go on," Tooaz encouraged upon seeing Ember's nervous expression. "No one would try anything here anyway."

Although still hesitant, Ember complied and proceeded to the front of the class. The other pokemon asked to participate, Koul, was a timid looking Cyndaquil.

"Alright Koul, I want you to try to hit Ember here with a Fire-type attack," Mewtwo said. Koul complied with a Flamethrower, but to Ember's surprise, it didn't do a thing. "As you can see, typings aren't everything. Abilities, such as Ember's Flash Fire in this case, can weaken, or even negate, other moves." With this statement the bell rang, signaling the day's end. "We'll go over Abilities tomorrow, and don't forget your homework."
131121112212211111.title: Type Matchups 101

1311211122122111111.content:
Ember arrived at school to see Topaz waiting at the front steps, alongside a Lopunny. While that seemed strange, what was stranger was that Topaz was still in her Mega-Evolved state.

"Good morning," Ember greeted as she joined the two. "Um... Might I ask who this is... and why you still look like that?"

"Oh, this is Salien," Topaz replied. "Turns out she was a Ditto all along, so from this day forth she's a Lopunny. As for why I still look like this... I... er... kinda 'swallowed' my mega stone yesterday..."

"It was my fault you had to do that, ma'am," the now Lopunny Salien said. "Please forg-"

"C'mon, don't start acting all humble like that. What happened happened. Lets just focus on the present, shall we?"

Ember was amazed to see how different her friend could be. One moment, shes kind and friendly, the next... "Well, shall we head inside?"
1311211122122111111.title: The next day

13112111221221111111.content:
"Shit. We've got P.E. today," Salien said unhappily.

"Is it really that bad?" Ember asked.

"Bad? It's like hell," Topaz said in a sour tone. "You'll see."

Upon entering the 'room' it was made plenty clear. The interior was roughly the size of four football stadiums from front to back and on either side. On top of that, 90% of the space was a literal jungle.

"Alright runts, line up!" the coach, a Conkeldurr with obvious military background yelled. Once everyone complied, he continued. "Today begins the hands down WORST three weeks of your puny lives. Yes, you all heard right. THREE WEEKS. You'll be living, sleeping, eating, and dying here."

"Uh... Coach," a young Riolu interrupted. "Isn't that... illegal?"

The coach was upon her in seconds. "Illegal?" he said in a icy tone. "Is it illegal, you ask? You maggot, listen up and listen good. These next three weeks will determine whose strong enough to survive and whose better off dead." He then stood up. "If you're not prepared to risk your life, too bad. You and your parents should've read the enrollment agreement more carefully. This class is all about survival. That's your only rule and only goal: Survive. Anything else goes."
13112111221221111111.title: Survival Class

131121112212211111111.content:
With that, the coach's assistant, a Gallade, entered the room with a trolley loaded with similar looking backpacks. "Each of these bags contain some basic essentials," he said calmly. "Rations, First-aid kit, some rope, three days worth of water, flashlight, knife, and compass. Other than that, you're on your own."

As everyone grabbed their bag, the coach looked over the students, as if appraising their chances. "Once everyones got their kit, my other assistant will randomly teleport you all into the course. No one is to begin until I fire this flare." He then held up the flaregun to emphasis his point. "When the three weeks are up, you'll know."

As soon as everyone had grabbed a bag, the Gallade left the room, only to be replaced by a Medicham.

"Once we start, try and find us," Topaz whispered into Ember's ear.

"Alright," the Vulpix replied nervously.

And with that, it begun.
131121112212211111111.title: Survival begins

1311211122122111111112.content:
As soon as she saw the flare, Ember took off. She ran aimlessly, going this way and that, until something struck out from the bushes and dragged her in.

"Shh," a semi-familiar voice whispered. "Don't move."

After a few moments, another pokemon could be seen. By the looks if it, the pokemon in question was a Granbull, who, after a few moments, took off in search of prey.

"Phew..." the voice exhaled, releasing Ember from its grip. "That was close."

"Thanks," Ember said as she turned around, seeing the same Riolu from earlier.

"Riyu," she said, extending a paw.

"Ember," the Vulpix said, accepting the gesture.

"So who were those two you were with earlier?" Riyu asked curiously.

"My friends, Topaz and Salien," Ember replied. "They said to look for them as soon as possible."

-----

"That should do it," Topaz said as she tightened the strip of gauze. "Feeling better?"

"Y-yeah... thanks," the injured Umbreon said nervously.

"Damn," Topaz muttered to herself. "This is gonna be a lot harder than I thought." Without much warning, Topaz began coughing. Worried, the Umbreon rushed over, only to see a small, round stone land on the ground.

"What was that!" the Umbreon exclaimed.

"That," Topaz said, now back to her normal form. "Is my mega stone." Picking up the sphere, she removed a metal band from her bag and placed the stone in a recess within the band. Once done, she slipped it on her wrist and replaced the bag. "So, shall we get going?"
1311211122122111111112.title: Lost in the woodworks

13112111221221111111121.content:
Three hours had passed since the start if the Three Week Survival, and so far, everyone was still ok.

"Thanks for earlier," Tsuki said.

"No problem," Topaz replied. "It's not your fault you were teleported into a tree."

The two had been walking for roughly an hour and a half. After resting for a bit, they decided to find a good spot for camp. After about twenty minutes, they found a nice spot under the roots of a tree. Choosing not to start a fire, they settled in for the night. It was during this time that a loud rustling came from some nearby bushes. Now alert, the two stood ready for whatever may jump out, but nothing came.

"I'll keep watch for now," Topaz said, keeping her eyes fixed on the brush. "I'll wake you when it's your turn."

-----

"I-its so d-dark," Riyu whimpered.

"We'll be fine," Ember said, trying to comfort the scared Riolu. "I just hope they are..."

The two young pokemon had stayed awake nearly two hours after nightfall before passing out, unaware of something watching them from the treetops.

"huh... what's that? Riyu muttered sleepily. It was still dark, but she had heard something jump from the branches above her. "Whos there..."

Suddenly, she found herself being grabbed and pulled deeper into the brush. All of a sudden, she felt something soft and warm against her back. Looking up, she saw the eeire red black eyes of a Lopunny staring into the dark. Turning slightly, she saw Ember had also been grabbed, except the Vulpix was still asleep.

"Clear," the Lopunny said after a while. She then looked down and saw that Riyu was awake. "Damn. Thought both of you were still out..."

"W-who are-" Riyu began to ask before finding finding her head shoved inside the Lopunny's sex.

"I'll be able to move faster without having to keep track of you two," She said as Riyu dissapeared into her body.

Riyu found herself being forced foward by constricting muscles until being deposited into a different space. A few moments later, Ember also entered the fleshy chamber. Once the Vulpix was completely inside, Riyu felt everything shake as her captor began moving.

"Hey! Let us out!" Riyu screamed.

"Shut up, kid," came the reply. "You'd be dead right now if not for me, or did you not notice the Arbok lurking in the bushes?"

Riyu made as if to reply, but nothing came. -An Arbok was right there... We could've died...- Riyu slumped against the moist walls and looked to Ember, who had been woken up by all the motion.

"Hey... where are we?" The Vulpix asked groggily. "What happened?"

Riyu opened her mouth to respond, but the Lopunny beat her to it. "Morning sleepyhead. I'm sorry to have put you in there, but it's easier than losing track of you in all this jungle."

"Salien? Is that you?" Ember asked, perking up slightly.
13112111221221111111121.title: Lost and found?

131121112212211111111211.content:
Salien sat down against a tree, looking around to make sure she wasn't followed before relaxing. "Yeah, it's me," she said, rubbing the bump in her middle. "It's nice to see that you're alright."

The two spent some time talking, with occasional input from Riyu, before Salien stood up.

"Hang on you two," she said. "Gotta keep moving if we wanna find our friends."

----

"Hey Topaz," Tsuki asked as morning came. "Arn't you scared?"

"Scared? Of what?"

"Dying, of course. Arn't you afraid if dying?"

Topaz sighed before answering. "Everything dies eventually. I'm just determined to live." The two stayed silent for a while, then they heard something approaching. Ducking down, they waited for the entity to pass.

"Could it be that Ditto friend of yours?" Tsuki whispered.

"No, I told her to stay as a Lopunny," Topaz replied. "I wasn't kidding about her being my slave."

After a few more minutes a set of purple feet obstructed their view. Keeping quiet, the two waited for the Nidoking to pass. Eventually, he did.

"Phew," they both sighed in unision, only to hear more rustling. Waiting in silence, they watched as another pokemon entered their field of vision, this time a frantic looking Purrloin. Tsuki made as if to go help it, but Topaz held the injured Umbreon back. Shaking her head, the Mawile pointed over to some bushes near the Purrloin. Suddenly, a Serperior lunged out, engulfing the unfortunate feline in it's maw before slithering away.

"They were serious when they said this was survival of the fittest."

Topaz and Tsuki turned around to see a Gardevoir sitting on her knees behind them. She was in bad shape. Cuts and scrapes covered her arms, and her gown was tattered and torn with claw marks. Even in her condition, however, she put on a brave smile.
131121112212211111111211.title: All together again... Almost...

1311211122122111111112111.content:
"Hi. My names Phoebe. Mind if-" The badly injured Gardevoir was interrupted by Topaz's vice-like horn clamping down over her upper body.

"Topaz, what are you doing!" Tsuki exclaimed, but the Mawile wasn't listening.

"I don't know who you are, so until I have reason otherwise, I'm putting you away," Topaz said with a scowl, Phoebe's legs flailing about as she was consumed. Just before her feet dissapeared into Topaz's horn, someone spoke.

"Since when were you cruel to others?"

Topaz turned to see Salien inches away from her face, her peircing red eyes staring right into her own. Sighing, Salien spoke. "I found Ember last night," the Lopunny said as she backed up, a hand coming to rest upon her stomach. "Seems she made a new friend, too." Salien then returned her gaze to her master, Phoebe's feet still twitching outside her horn.

"Yeah... you're right," Topaz said with a sigh before releasing the Gardevoir. "Not like I'd be able to bring myself to kill her anyway." She then returned her attention to her slave. "Thanks for bringing them here."

A while later, everyone else was huddled around a small fire, courtesy of Ember. Topaz meanwhile took it upon herself to clean and treat Phoebe's wounds.

"You're lucky I'm a vegetarian," Topaz said as she cleaned Phoebe's gown. "I've only killed one other being, but that was an exception."

Phoebe pulled the blanket she was given tighter. "Who was it?" she asked shakily.

"A rapist Flygon," Topaz said, returning the slightly cleaner gown. "I've cleaned off all the twigs and debris, but I can't do much more here."

Phoebe accepted the garment with one arm before drawing it into the blanket. They sat in silence until Salien crawled over.

"Master, if I may, can I make a request?" Topaz nodded. Salien whispered something before the Mawile smiled.

"Not a bad idea," She said. "Go on ahead." Salien nodded before transforming into a Drilbur, then proceeded to dig into the soil. A few hours later, everyone sat on edge as a Charizard approached, sniffing the air in search of something.

"He's gonna find us," Riyu said shakily. They continued watching the dragon-like pokemon until Salien spoke up behind them.

"It's ready," she said, ducking back down into the tunnel. Looking towards one another, they followed into the hole.
1311211122122111111112111.title: United, we survive.

13112111221221111111121112.content:
The small group traversed the tunnel for what seemed like forever before emerging in a large space. Sprawled out before them was a spacious cavern carved into the earth. Glistening mossed lined one side, where a spring poured into the grotto. On the other was a large cushion of grass and leaves. At the far end was another tunnel, at the end of which appeared to be a door.

"I actually stumbled upon this area," Salien said. "It appears someone else had a similar idea before."

Thanks to this discover, they were able to enjoy the remaining two weeks of survival, spending the rest of the first week gathering fruits and berries. On the last day, they packed up and left their sanctuary.

"Who do you think made that place?" Tsuki asked as they made their way out of the jungle.

"Who knows," Topaz replied before turning to Salien. "Maybe it's time I return your freedom."

"Hmm... To be free once more..." Salien mumbled. "Not sure much would change..."

"Thanks for not eating me," Phoebe said.

"I could still eat you," Topaz teased. "But I'd just make you a slave instead."

"Who would've thought we'd make friends during this mess," Ember chuckled. "I wonder how many others made it."
13112111221221111111121112.title: Surviving in style.

131121112212211111111211122.content:
Upon exiting the literal jungle, the group of six discovered that two thirds of the class had lived through the ordeal.

"Well, isn't this a surprise," the coach said. "I expected nerely half of you lot to fail, but you kids blew my expectations away." The coach whistled in appreciation. "Go on and head home now. The schools giving you all a few days off. Consider it a reward."

----

"Hey Topaz," Phoebe said nervously as they traversed the halls. "You were just kidding about earlier.... right?"

As if to answer her question, Topaz's iron horn clamped down over the Gardevoir once more. Phoebe struggled to get free as Topaz's secondary tongue slid across her face. "Who said anything about joking," Topaz said as she continued walking, unimpeded by Phoebe's flailing legs. As Topaz continued down the hall, more and more of Phoebe dissapeared into her iro jaw. By the time she left the building, she had on had resting on her now restless stomach. "Maybe it's time I quit the vegetarian thing," she shrugged. "Eh, I'll start with the next one. You're too cute to be used for mere food."
131121112212211111111211122.title: The challenge ends

1311211122122111111112111221.content:
Upon arriving at her house, Topaz had Salien prepare a bath, then she released Phoebe. Before the dazed Gardevoir could say anything, Topaz slipped a metal band around her forearm. "There, now you're officially mine," the Mawile said before heading to the bathroom, leaving the Gardevoir to process what just happened.

"Oh, I was just about to-" Salien was cut short as Topaz clamped a similar metal band around the Lopunny's forearm. "What's this fore?"

"Simple. It show's that you're mine, and prevents you from using your abilities," Topaz said matter-of-factly. "It's time to change a few things, and as my first order-" she then suddely tackled the Lopunny into the tub. "-I want you to take me in, IN THE BATH."

Salien was stunned, but did as she was told. After getting comfortable, she guided her master's head towards her sex before forcing it in, moaning in both pain and pleasure. -I never knew it could feel this good- She thought to herself. Up until today, she would use her ability to rearrange her molecular structure anytime she forced someone into her body. Now, without access to that skill, it was different. By now her master's horn and shoulders were making their way into her body, causing her to moan out even louder. Breathing heavily, Salien opened her eyes slightly. She could feel her master pressing against her cervix. It felt strange, but yet it felt wonderful. Attempting to get more comfortable, she tried sitting up. Just as she did, she hit her climax. Moaning loudly, she kept herself up as the rest of Topaz entered her womb.

As the wave of pleasure subsided, she carefully got out of the tub. "That felt great..." she said as she looked into the now half empty tub. Patting her stomach, she heard a clearb swoshing sound. "I wonder how much water is in there..."

-WATER!!-

Now frantic, Salien began pacing as a barrage of questions poured into her mind. -What if she drowns in there? What if she's already dead? Is she alright?-
1311211122122111111112111221.title: Time for change

13112111221221111111121112211.content:
Salien's worries were soon eased as she felt a hand press against her from the inside, as if reassuring her. -She's ok- Salien thought. "Just tap three times when you're ready to come out."

Suddenly exhausted, Salien made her way to her room. While not as large as her master's, it was more than enough for her liking. Careful not to move too much, she lied down in bed and fell asleep.

----

-Sounds like Salien's asleep- Topaz thought within the Lopunny's flooded womb. -Now the test- Carefully repositioning herself, as to not awaken her slave, she activated her mega stone. Normally, this would create a powerful burst effect, but, with Salien's womb filled with water, this burst was essentially negate. Confirming that it worked, she then settled in for the night as well, eager to see her slave's reaction.

Salien was awoken to what felt like tapping. -Guess she wants out- Groggily, she got herself out of bed and headed to the bathroom. Once there, she stood in the bathtub and relaxed. Once her cervix opened, Topaz, aided by all the water, slipped near effortlessly of Salien's womb.

"Surpri-" Topaz said, but stopped upon noticing her slave sleeping while standing. "Well.. that failed," she grumbled. Grabbing the Lopunny, she dragged her slave to the couch and tossed her there, the proceeded to her own room. -Ugh.. what to do for the next few days-
13112111221221111111121112211.title: All part of the plan

131121112212211111111211122111.content:
-Back at school- Topaz thought to herself. -Things are gonna different...- Over the extended weekend, the Mawile had recieved a letter from her friend Ember. Apparently, her family decided to move to the Kalos region, the safest region as it currently stood. -I'll miss her... though at least she'll be safe- She looked at her schedule, reading "Berries and Related Treats." Memorizing the room number, she procceded to class, her newest slave, Phoebe, accompanying her.

Topaz entered the room to se a Mew hovering over a laptop, working on preparations for today's lesson. "Hello?" she said, grabbing the Mew's attention.

"Huh? Oh... great... another one" the Mew mumbled under his breath, then looking over to see the Gardevoir. "New students?"

"Kinda..." Topaz said. "Anywhere for us to sit?"

"Two available seats in the back," the Mew said, returning to work. Topaz and Phoebe proceededto their seats and waited for class to begin. Looking around, Phoebe took notice of another pair of students entering the room. One was a clearly well endowed Blaziken, the other was, somewhat surprisingly, a Mawile.

"Please try not to fall asleep in class again, Stella," the Mew said without looking up. Ok, Mew kinda looked up, but only at the seemingly self concious Blaziken.

"No promises, dear," Stella replied, pouring a generous amount of charm into the statement. The second Mawile proceeded to her seat, but stopped short when she noticed who was looking at her. "Hello there, darling. Mind telling me your name?" Stella said as she leaned onto Phoebe's desk. The Gardevoir glanced behind her before answering. "Phoebe"

"Phoebe...," Stella repeated to herself. "What a lovely name! I do hope-"

"I'd advise you leave my slave alone," Topaz spoke up, glaring at the other Mawile. Stella looked back in false forgiveness. "Oh, Sorry dear," she said with honey covered words.

"Alright students, take your seats," Mew announced as the bell rang. "For those of you who don't know, my name is Napoleon. No, there's no relation to either Bonaparte or Dynamite, so save the jokes for after class. Today well be going over the effects of damage-reduction berries, such as the Keiba, which weakens Poison, and the Rindo, which weakens Grass."

As the class progressed, Topaz noticed the other Mawile, Stella, gazing at Phoebe. Wether it was in lust ir hunger wasn't clear, but it seemed a mix of both. Making sure her mega stone was still on it's band, she focused on Stella's every movement. -Go ahead and try it- she thought.

"Now we'll begin the presentation," Napoleon said as he turned off the lights. Returning to the laptop, he started up the projector and initiated his PowerPoint. Clearly, (almost) everyone looked forawd to this, because as soon as the lights went off everyone went quiet.

-I dare you slut, make your move- Topaz thought. Sure enough, she spotted Stella's plate iron jaw creeping towards Phoebe's desk. -You're dead now- Topaz thought, nudging Phoebe's chair just slightly. Phoebe then felt her powers return. Seeing this as a signal, she then teleported the four to...
131121112212211111111211122111.title: Another one?

1311211122122111111112111221111.content:
"Isn't this a surprise," Topaz said, glaring down at Stella. "I even warned you to leave her alone." The two Mawiles stared at each other. "Now... what to do-"

"Sorry, hun," Stella said as her plate jaw clamped down over the other Mawile. "No hard feelings." Topaz, however, expected something like this. In one second, Stella found two identical plate jaws, easily larger than her own, seemingly glaring at her.

"Didn't expect that, did ya?" Topaz said as she easily removed the rival Mawile's plate jaw from her head. "Though I actually kind like you... Oh well."

Stella was now afraid. -H..how'd she do that...- she thought. All she could do was back away as Topaz approached. Stella's escape was cut short when she backed into a wall. Shaking, she whimpered as Topaz kneeled down in front of her.

"Aw, how cute," Topaz taunted. "You're trembling! You look so adorable, I could just EAT you up..." Stella was crying at this point. "But I won't." Stella was dumbstruck by this. She stayed confused until Topaz sat herself upon the smaller Mawile's lap, her breasts at level with Stella's face. The smaller Mawile looked up amd down Topaz's body as the latter removed her 'cloths' "Most pokemon don't wear clothing," Topaz said seductivly. "But I feel it's necessary for... certain reasons." Topaz gave the smaller Mawile a lustful smile before gently forcing her head between her legs. "Go ahead," Topaz said, and Stella was happy to comply.

----

"How'd I get here?" Burna said aloud, franticly looking around. "Was it that Gardevoir?"

-Yes- a calm voice replied in her mind.

"Then why?" Burna called out.

-Because my master order me to- The soothing voice replied.

"Ordered you to?" Burna felt like she was going crazy. -ordered her to do what?-

"To have some 'fun' with you," came the sudden vocal reply. Burna spun around to see Phoebe standing there. "What do you say? Would you like to have some fun with me?" Burna was hesitant. She'd heard that question before, and it didn't end well, not one bit. However, the Gardevoir's voice was so... relaxing. Burna felt her mind numbing, taking note of the Gardevoir's build. While she was still smaller than her, Phoebe's build was thicker than the usual 'twig thin' common in a Gardevoir. Phoebe smiled and pulled Burna into a warm embrace. "You seem tired. Would you like to take a nap?" Burna nodded, drifting off to sleep just as her beak pressed against the Gardevoir's sex.
1311211122122111111112111221111.title: The Berry Gardens

13112111221221111111121112211111.content:
Topaz gently stroked Stella's head as the latter continued to explore her depths. "Even if I wanted to, I couldn't bring myself to kill you," Topaz said, her face red with bliss. "You remind me alot of myself, ironic as it may sound, even if you do act like a gluttonous slut." She then began gentle pushing on the back of Stella's head, slowly forcing the smaller Mawile into herself. "I really do like you."

Stella found herself being pushed deeper into the larger Mawile's body. She started to struggle in an attempt to free herself, but Topaz's gentle touch soothed any fear within the smaller Mawile. -This is so strange- Stella thought as her shoulders were pulled in. -She's being so careful... but why?-

Topaz intentionally kept her progress slow and steady. She wanted the smaller Mawile to feel comfortable, to trust her. "Just relax," Topaz said soothingly. "You'll be just fine." It was strange. Just moments earlier, Topaz was ready to swallow Stella alive, and yet now she felt some strange, almost motherly, attatchment to the smaller Mawile. She began stroking her stomach softly as it filled out with Stella's body, now already halfway inside her womb. -I knew things would change, but I would've never guessed this much- Topaz thought as her cervix closed behind the last if Stella. "Sleep well," she whispered as she got up.

---

Phoebe emerged from the bushes just as her master stood, a hand placed atop her swollen stomach. "I take it you had fun?" Topaz asked her servant.

"I sure did," Phoebe said, patting her still flat midsection. Taking advantage of her returned abilities, Phoebe created a small distortion field inside her body to hide the Blaziken inside her with. "Shall we return to class now, master?"
13112111221221111111121112211111.title: The Berry Garden (part 2)

131121112212211111111211122111111.content:
"Sure, lets go," Topaz said softly. Phoebe nodded and teleported then back to their seats, just as Napoleon turned around. "Burna. Name two berries that would be most beneficiant to a pure Fairy-type."
Luckily, the lights were still off, so Phoebe was easily able to teleport the Blaziken back into her seat, now awake. The Blaziken looked around nervously as a voice spoke in her mind. -Keiba and Babiri- it said. "Uh... Keiba and Babiri?" Burna said, slightly confused.

"Yes, very good," Napoleon said, returning to his presentation. "Now can anyone else tell me what berry heals you if struck by a weakness?"

Burna looked around before locking eyes with Phoebe. -You're welcome- The Gardevoir said telepathically. -Meet us in the locker room after class- Burna nodded before turning to face the front of the class, only to notice Stella had vanished. Quickly turning back around, she was caught off guard by the Mawile seated behind Phoebe. It wasn't the two horns that caught her attention, it was the warm smile upon her face as she softly rubbed her stomach. Burna turned back to Phoebe, who gave her a knowing smile in return.

"Alright class, don't forget any of your belonings as you pack up," Napoleon said as the bell rang. As instructed, Burna headed straight for the girls locker room. Having left the classroom last meant she didn't know if they were there or not. Pushing the door open, she found the two were waiting for her. -I hope this isn't a trap- She thought.
131121112212211111111211122111111.title: Back to Class

1311211122122111111112111221111111.content:
"I uderstand Stella here us rather fond of you," Topaz said as she approached the Blaziken, a hand resting on her stomach. "I can see why..." In an instant, Topaz was upon her, pinning the Blaziken to the ground. "They ARE rather imoressive," Topaz said as she groped Burna's bust, using her two plate jaws to keep the Blaziken's arms bound. Burna tried to fight back, but it was futile. "They're amazing," Topaz commented as her groping relented. "Though I am curious as to their taste." Topaz lowered herself onto the Blaziken's form, her mouth inches away from Burna's breasts.

Phoebe merely sat by and watched as her master drank from the Blaziken's J-cups, unfazed by the scene. "Delicious," Topaz remarked after drinking her fill. Burna was now in tears, something which Topaz took notice of. The Mawile leaned over further until the two were staring eye to eye. "Ah... I see," Topaz said sadly as she withdrew, her iron clad grip on Burna relaxing. The Mawile stood up before offering the broken fire-type a hand. "So you've been raped before, haven't you?"

Burna looked at the Mawile, a mixture of fear, shame, amd confusion on her face. "H-how d-did you k-know?" the Blaziken asked in a shaky voice. Tooaz sighed and sat down, motioning for Burna to do the same. "I was raped on my first day here," She said. "Damn Flygon used me up and tossed me aside. Heh, then about a month ago, he tried it again with a Vulpix. He failed, and I swallowed him whole." Topaz then turned to face the Blaziken. After grabbing anything worthwhile from the Froslass's locker, Topaz proceeded to her classes until the lunchbell rang. She wasn't really interested in the food that much, but she did grab quite a few of the snacks. Stuffing the Poffins, Ragecandy Bars, and Lava Cookies into her backpack, she sat down to a cup of refreshing Berry Juice.

"Hey, runt," a gruff voice said from behind her. Topaz leaned her head back to look at the owner of the voice. "Yeah, you," the voice's owener, a grumpy looking Lucario, said. "Why the hell are you in my seat?"

Topaz took another carefree sip of Berry Juice before responding. "Your seat? I'm pretty sure I checked every in of this chair for any names..."

This just made the Lucario pissed. "What was that, you damn smartalek?" He said, tossing his food on the ground. "You really wanna get you brains bashed in, don't ya?"

Topaz was unfazed by his meager threats. -Ten minutes. Tops. Then he's lunch.- "Huh.. last time I check, I wasn't a zombie," she said nonchalantly, taking another sip of Berry Juice. "You sure you're all there?" She pointed at her head to emphasis the statement.

Now he was livid. "You think this is funny?" He screamed, smacking the Berry Juice out of her hand. "Get up bitch, I'm gonna kick you ass, then fuck it just because you asked for it."

Topaz sighed as she got up. "Meatheads... Its always the meatheads..." Hearing this, the Lucario rushed at her, only to recieve a kick to the face, sending him sprawling. "You sure you're a Fighting-type?" She asked as he got up and charged again. "Dumbass..." Topaz muttered as she hit him with a roundhouse kick. "Talk tough and get trashed... Why do you even bother?" The Lucario made a lunge for her throat, only to be caught by her iron plate jaw.

"Oh. look at that. Ten minutes exact," Topaz said as the Lucario thrashed within her ironclad horn. Acting as if nothing happened, Topaz bought herself another Berry Juice and sat down again. "Looks like I was right... Ten minutes exact, and now you're lunch." Topaz spent the rest of lunch finishing off the Lucario and her cup of juice, then proceeded to her next class.

"Everyone take you seats," the teacher, a Kecleon, said. "My name is Arnold. If anyone has any jokes related to the Terminator movies or Predator, leave now." He waited a bit before continuing. "Today, we'll be going over the Poke Doll."

Topaz felt bordem begin to take hold. -I still don't really see how that thing even works- She thought. It was strange how a meager Clefairy shaped doll could allow anyone to escape. Curious, she raised her hand once Arnold asked for questions.

"Yes Topaz, what is your question?"

"How does that simple toy even work?" she asked in a serious tone. "All it is is a Clefairy doll, yet everyone says it can help you escape from any battle."

"Um..well..." Arnold stammered. "I'm not too sure myself, to be honest." He looked over the doll as he continued. "Maybe it releases a chemical that reacts to the aggressor's pheremones, I don't know." Arnold seemed genuinly confused as he examined the plush.

---

"If anyone can figure out if these things really work AND bring video proof, I'll pass you for the year," Arnold stated as the class came to a close.

Topaz was glad that the day was nearly over -Thank the deities we only have P.E. once for the whole time here...- she thought as she closed her locker.

"Gotcha!" someone cried out behind her. Just as she was about to turn around, she felt one hand grab her breast, and the other one being shoved down her pants. Petrified by the sudden contact, Topaz was powerless as her assaulter groped at her chest, while simultaneously fingering her clit. "You feel real good," her assaulter whispered in her ear. "I'm gonna have some fun with you."
131121112212211111111211122111111111222.title: Battle Items: How they can save your ass.

1311211122122111111112111221111111112221.content:
Topaz tried to turn to face her assailant, but found she couldn't move. "Surprised?" he asked. "Of course you are. What do you think about that special little poison, hmm?"

-P...poison!- Topaz thought. Opening her mouth to yell at the individual, she found herself unable to speak. "What's wrong, cat got your tongue?" he said, cracking into laughter. "Wonderful little stuff, isn't it? Prevents you from moving, stops you from speaking, and brings you body's functions to a halt. Though, of course you're still alive," he said, licking her neck. "It wouldn't be any fun torturing a corpse!"

-Torture?!- she thought as her attacker broke into a cackle. "I've been keeping tabs on you..." he whispered. "Darach, the Flygon you killed. That cute little Vulpix you befriended, Ember. The Ditto you forced into servitude, Salien. That adorable little Riolu and her Umbreon friend. Oh, and let's not forget that life you stole away for yourself." He broke into laughter once again. "Oh yes, I'll be having a lot of fun breaking you..." Then, everything went dark...

----

Topaz awoke shackled to a metal frame. The base of each chain rooted within two steel beams. Within her field of vision was a bench covered with assorted items. Knifes, syringes, a cattle prod, and a whip among other things. Leaning against the bench were a few wooden paddles. Next to these stood a Zoroark, a phychotic grin spread across his face. "Goood morning," he saud gleefully. "How do you like my torture chamber? What's that? I'm a bastard? Silly girl, I know I am," he mocked as he broke into another fit of laughter. Walking to the bench, he began looking over his options.

"I'm not like the others. You see, while small prey I'm fine with simply eating, large game... I enjoy breaking them," he said as he turned around, holding up the leather lash for her to see. "I plan on tearing down your will and crushing your spirit, exciting isn't it?" Leaping through the chains, he positioned himself behind her, then swung the whip. Topaz screamed out in agony as the lash tore through her skin. "Wonderful!" the Zoroark exclaimed as he continued striking her. "Your screams are like music, sweet, yet heartwretching." Upon striking her back a seventh time, he leapt through the chains once more to stand in front of her. "It'll just elevates the amount of fun, without those meager rags you so choose to wear!" he cried out as he tore the cloths off her before squealing in delight. "Ah yes, that's more like it. I still find it strange, how the majority prefer to go about without those wretched rags, and yet, there are those who do." The Zoroark returned to his tool bench.

"Oh, and you don't have to worry about that little life you stole away," he said, glancing at her stomach. "After all, it hasn't even begun to develop yet." He then grabbed the cattle prod and jabbed it between her breasts, sending a strong electric charge through her body. "A simple spark isn't enough," he said, enjoying her agony. "So I modified this to make it so much stronger." Upon revoming the instrument, he grabbed Topaz by the chin, forcing her to look at him. "Aw... how cute! So much anger and hate. You really want to kill me, huh?" The Zoroark then struck her face with it's clawed hand. "Oh I'm gonna have so much fun with you!"

The Zoroark walked over to the wall and pulled a switch. In response, the metal beams keeping Topaz restrained rotated ninty degrees. Simultaneously, a concrete table rose from it's recess in the floor. A few moments later, the metal beams lowered, forcing Topaz onto the cold stone.

"I'd wager you're feeling quite uncomfortable," the Zoroark mused as he approached. "Well, I don't really care." He then lept upon the stone table, leaning over his bound victim. "Oh how that burning glare fills me with joy," he cried out. "If we had met earlier, but alas, our paths diverged before we met." He glared at her before jumping off the stone. "Maybe you should try relaxing a bit," he said as he retrieved the cattle prod, ajusting it's setting before plunging it into her sex. "Here, I'll help!" Zoroark screamed sadistically as he switched the device on, eliciting screames of pain mixed with moans of pleasure from the bound Mawile. "Yes, relax," Zoroark said with a cheshire grin. "Until you break, you're mine."

----

"Goood morning," Zoroark said as Topaz awoke the next day. "Ohhh, that fire is still there! Fantastic!" Tied up in front of him were three smaller pokemon, a Vulpix, a Riolu, and a Umbreon. "I decided to take the liberty of hunting down these three. Don't they look just like your friends?" Zoroark squealed as he approached. "I'll be nice and let you pick one," he said, jabbing a syringe into her arm. "You one, and then send the other two on a one way trip to your stomach. Yes yes, I know I'm a sick, deranged, sadistic psychopath, but I don't mind. I enjoy it!"

-You goddamn fucking insane sociopath- Topaz thought, glaring at his smiling face.
1311211122122111111112111221111111112221.title: Turn of Dark

"Take your time, but don't take too long," Zoroark stated with a impish grin. Topaz knew she had to pick, but that just made it more difficult. Seeing her hesitation, Zoroark grined as an idea struck. "Maybe this will help," he said as he walked around the table, holding a blindfold and flask out plain as day. With practiced skill, he tied the strip of cloth around her eyes before pouring the contents of the flask down her throat. -Alchohol!- her mind registered. -He's getting me drunk?!- With the flask now empty, Zoroark returned to the matter at hand. "Now you pick one..."

Now dizzy as a result of the booze, Topaz struggled to keep her mind straight, something made clearly futile as she heard Zoroark squeal out. "Oh, how lovely! Even in your state, you pick the little Vulpix here over the other two. How cuute!" With his 'guest' unable to see, Zoroark picked up the small fox and cruelly tossed her against the wall before retrieving the other two. "Now open wide..." Perhaps it was the booze, or maybe her willpower wearing down, either way, Topaz found herself complying, much to her displeasure. "First will be this adorable little Umbreon," Zoroark said as he lowered the cloth-bound Dark type into her mouth, watching her tongue dance across it's fur, the muscles in her throat working to drag it's body down her gullet. He even took notice of the tears streaming down her face as she was forced to do this. -She's breaking down- He thought with a big grin. -I'd better call Hecate so she can have her turn-

By the time you're done with these two, there'll litirally be nothing left!" Zoroark exclaimed as he danced a bit, spinning at the end. -Bastard really is enjoying this- Topaz thought spitefully. -I really hope he gets his someday... if I don't get to him first...- Seeing the last trace buldges of the Umbreon pass into her stomach, Zoroark proceeded to force the tearful Riolu in as well. "If it's any consulation to you," he said as the Fighting-type's head dissapeared into her gullet. "I made sure these three had no relation to you. Not that it matters to me anyway."

Yes, she's already wearing down. Tommorow will be great! Alright. Cya then." Hanging up the reciever, Zoroark sighed. "I'll was hoping to beat her a bit with those paddles... Oh well," he shrugged. "I guess it can't be helped."

----

"Morning, I hope you slept well." Topaz opened her eyes to see a Gothitelle standing in front of her. "I'm sorry about my friend," she said. "He can be quite... unpredictable..." -Gee... you think Einstein? I thought he was just another average Joe- Topaz thought. "Oh, don't flatter me," the Gothitelle replied with a slight giggle. "I can be just as bad as him sometimes." She then locked her eyes with those of the Mawile immobilized in front of her, delving into her memories and conciousness.

"C-cold..." a much younger Topaz stuttered. It was the middle of winter, and yet she was alone, having been abandoned by her parents. "I-it's s-so c-c-cold..." -Being all alone can be rough when you're young- Hecate's voice rang out, echoing across the white expanse. -But having to suffer alone is brutal, isn't it?-

"I-I have f-friends..." the young Topaz muttered, as if trying to comvince herself. -Do you? Then tell me, where are your friends now, as you're suffering here. hmmm? Why'd you have to enslave Salien and Phoebe?- Hecate asked, as phantoms of the two appeared in the winter's snow. -Why'd you have to steal little Stella's life, taking it for yourself?- Yet another phantasm materialized. -Face it: You're all alone, and in an attempt to fill that void, you conviced yourself that they were your friends- spectral versions of Ember, Riyu, and Tsuki now appeared as well. -made Salien and Phoebe slaves, and turned Stella into your-soon-to be child- All at once, the phantom's faces fell off, revealing black voids, lit by round yellow eyes and large, false grins -Accept the truth. You're alone, and that's how it'll always be-

1311211122122111111112111221111111112221.content:
-Isn't that why you hunted down that power? The ability to surpass your normal limits- Hecate continued, determined to destroy what little self-esteem Topaz had left. "I...i'm alone," she muttered quietly. -Louder! Admit your hollowness to the skies!- Hecate pressured. "I'm alone!" Topaz screamed in defeat, her eyes red, tears streaming off her face.


Zoroark watched as the mental struggle concluded, his victim now hanging limp in defeat. "To think, someone so strong was in actuality so weak," Zoroark mused. "Such strength can only act as a facade for so long."

"Indeed," Hecate stated as the two left.

(Three Months Later...)

"Excuse me," a Ninetails said, approaching the school secretary, a unassuming Meloetta. "Do you know where I can find Room 113? I just transfered back and feel a bit lost..."

The Meloetta looked up from her book. "Let's see... Room 113 should be down the hall, take a left, and it should be the first door on the right. Look for the large clock printed on the door."

"Alright, thanks!" the Nintails replied as she headed down the hall. As she rounded the corner, she crashed into another student. "Ow... Sorry about that," She said as she got up. "You alrig- Is that you, Topaz?"

"Ugh... I'm ok..," the Mawile said. "Uh.. Do I know you?"

"Silly. It's me, Ember," the Ninetails said giggling. -Is she... nah. Can't be- Ember thought upon noticing the slight bulge in her midsection.

"Ember?" Topaz repeated in a confused tone before suddenly snapping. "Please, just leave me alone." she said, running off to her next class.

-I guess a lot has changed- Ember thought. -But still, something doesn't seem right...-


"Alright kids, take your seats," a energetic Celebii said as the bell rang. "Today we'll start our coverage on the War of Unova, so open your books to page 227."

-What happened after I left?- Ember wondered. She glanced back to see her strangly behaving friend looking out the window. She seemed quite depressed. In fact, she seemed like a completely different person, so to speak. -I'll have to ask her about it later- Ember thought as she returned to the days lesson.

After the bell rang, Ember decided to trail her friend. As she pursued, Topaz glanced back before suddenly making a beeline for the bathroom. -Now's my chance!- Ember thought as she followed. "Hey Topaz," she called out as she pushed the door open. After waiting a few moments, she heard the sound of someone hurling coming from the far stall. -Found you- "You ok in there?" she inquired as she approached the stall. Pushing the door open, she found Topaz bent over the toilet bowl, groaning.

"Ugh... my stomach..," Topaz groaned before hurling again. "This sucks..."

"Maybe you shouldn't eat anything that struggles," Ember joked. "Want me to-" She was caught off guard as one of Topaz's iron horns clamped down over her front half. "What are you doing?!" Ember screamed.

"My stomach hurts..," Topaz grumbled, dragging more of the Ninetails into her iron grip.

"Stop it Topaz, this isn't funny!" Ember screamed out, afraid of what her friend was now doing.

"Be honest with me," Topaz said, no longer groaning. "Are you really my friend?"

"Of course I am!" Ember cried back in panic. "Now stop fooling around!"

"Really?" Topaz asked in a melancholy tone. "Heh, after what that monster did to me, its so hard to tell..."

-monster?- Ember thought, halting her struggles in the damp interior for a moment, noticing that she wasn't being sucked in any further. -So she's not trying to eat me?- "What happened to you?" Ember yelped as she felt herself lowering, but not forward, backwards.

"Maybe they were wrong after all," Topaz muttered as she looked up at the ceiling, rubbing her stomach absentmindedly. "Tell me Ember, do you think everyone deserves a second chance at happiness?"

Ember thought for a moment. "Everyone desreves to be happy in life," she said. "Even if they have to struggle for it, it just makes that happiness that much better once it's found." Ember yelped again as she went sliding backwards, landing on the tiled floor of the bathroom.

"Thanks... I think I needed that," Topaz said as she stood up, her tone sounding more upbeat. "I just wish I could undo my mistakes..."

Ember could tell her friend still wasn't 100%, but at least she seemed a bit happier now -I wonder who this 'monster' is...-
1311211122122111111112111221111111112221.title: Acceptence before Renewal

choices: Zoroark reveals his true, dereanged colors.
1311211122122111111112111221111111112221.content:
"So Topaz, mind if I ask why you were acting so strangly earlier?" Ember asked as the two sat down for lunch.

"Well... I-"

"Or maybe why you were puking your brains out in the bathroom?" Ember continued. "Come to think of it, that's a lot of food..."

"A lot?" Topaz said skeptically, seeing as how her lunch consisted of a steak & potatos. "How is this a lot?"

"I've never seen you eat much more than few snacks is all," Ember said casually. "Anyway, why were you acting so strange?" The Ninetails paused as if in thought. "I've got it!" she said with a wicked grin. "You're pregnant." Topaz remained silent as Ember laughed at her joke before realizing her friend wasn't laughing. "Really? You're pregnant?" Ember exclaimed in disbelief.

"...yes," Topaz replied, feeling ashamed of herself -Why'd I go through with it? Stupid! Stupid! Stupid!- She thought, mentally smacking herself. -How would she respond if I told her the truth?-

"Take that, Dad!" Ember suddenly exclaimed, standing on her hind legs... before falling over, that is.

"You ok there?" Topaz asked in concern.

"I knew that pokemon don't really hatch from eggs! I knew it!" Ember said with a smug grin as she straightened herself out. "And he thought I'd never find out, pfft. Well, that explains your weird behavior though. You thought I wouldn't be your friend anymore if I knew, didn't you?"

"Uh... Y-yeah," Topaz lied. -If only she knew the truth...- "I-I was just worried was all... S-sorry about that..."

"Relax, everyone makes mistakes right?"

"Y-yeah..." -except this wasn't a mistake- Topaz thought regretfully -I erased two lives just to fill my selfish desires...-

"Now that that's done and over with, wanna hang out later?" Ember asked. "I heard a few of the school's clubs are accepting new members. Wanna go check it out?"

"I'm not sure... I guess I can tag along," Topaz said uncertainly.

"Great! Why don't we check out the Drama Club then," Ember exclaimed cheerfully. "I'll bet you'll love it!"

----

"Why'd I let you drag me along..." Topaz complained as she and Ember made their way through the woods behind the school.

"I didn't force you, did I?" Ember replied. "Besides, we're neatly there!"

The Drama Club held weekly meetings every Tuesday and Thursday at a theater built within the woods. This is where the two were heading at the current time.

"Here we are!" Ember exclaimed. "Such a nice area."

"And lo, a graceful flower doth stand before me," a voice said from behind them. "It's mere precense enough to drive oneself mad. If thou allow it, I shall glady escourt thee to thoust seats."

Ember and Topaz turned to see a Zoroark (yes, THAT Zoroark) bowing to them, and while Ember was filled with amazement, Topaz was brimming with malice. "YOU," she hissed.

"No need to be wary, my dear madams," Zoroark said with a cheerful grin. "I shall ensure your safety: wether thou wish to stay, or depart."

"You two-faced bastard," Topaz growled. "I'm gonna make you pay." She then lunged at Zoroark's throat, only to be sidestepped and grabbed out of the air.

"Oh my, that's no way to behave in your condition," Zoroark said as he pulled her in close. "I see you've regained that spark of yours," he whispered into her ear. "Though please, do be more careful. It was all just an act, after all."

"An ACT!" Topaz snarled, attempting to clamp onto his head.

"Please, excuse us a moment," Zoroark said, leaving Ember very confused. Stepping into a small workshed, he was forced to bind Topaz's hands and feet before speaking. "I knew we should've put you in the loop," he said, exhasperated. "Everything that happened during those 'three days' was all just one of my illusions."

"LIAR!" Topaz screamed as she fought against her restraints.

Zoroark rose and grabbed Topaz by her head, forcing her to look him in the eye. "I'M NOT LYING," he said with absolution. Releasing his grip, he returned to his chair. "Lewis, the head of the Drama Club, thought it'd be a good idea to keep you out if it. Otherwise, and I quote: 'We won't get the raw emotion we're looking for.' Didn't you wonder why you woke up without any bruises, marks, scrapes, or cuts?"

-He's got me there...- Topaz thought. "Then what about Phoebe? What about Salien?"

Zoroark sighed as he answered. "Phoebe was indeed predated on by a Lilligant, that was true. Salien, unfortunate, was consumed by a former member of our club. He was subsequently removed quite efficently for his actions."

"And you expect me to believe this?" Topaz demanded. She had calmed quite a bit, but was still unready to trust him.

"I see you're unconvinced." As he said this, a Beedrill suddenly burst through the door.
1311211122122111111112111221111111112221.title: Time for lunch

1311211122122111111112111221111111112221.content:

1452112211211211.content:
Charizard had managed to get back in the building after he had eaten Carnivine, and was being shown to his next class by Leafeon, who was gladly showing off some of the perks to her school, even going as far to mention typical routes she'd take to get to each class. During the trip to… whatever class Charizard was being led to, he didn't really remember, he told Leafeon about how he was kicked out of his last school. While it may have been a hard pill to swallow, Leafeon didn't really mind, saying that both she wasn't there to witness it and the Fire-type had only done good for her since they met. Nonetheless Charizard was happy to suddenly be walking with someone he'd have otherwise eaten.


“So, I'm just going to take a guess and say your first class is Pokémon Evolution 3?” Leafeon asked the dragon, who had been staring blankly at the classroom doors and names for the first time since he was a Charmander. The memory of him speaking to a rather impressive looking Gardevoir who was sitting in an office flooded back into his mind. Charizard put a claw to his chin.


“I think I remember that one Gardevoir lady saying something like that,” Charizard hesitated, “I don't remember her name but I'm sure she was a teacher or something.”


“Mrs. Gardevoir? Only female counselor, she's not a teacher, you know.” Leafeon corrected him. They were walking down the hallway at a quicker than normal pace because there was a bit of a hurry to be had thanks to the Carnivine. Charizard shot her an exasperated look.


“I don't know! I thought the the only Pokémon who wasn't a teacher was the Principal- or the janitors or something- anyways, where's Evolution 3?” Charizard huffed. Leafeon glanced back at him with a mix of fear and annoyance in spite before it gradually changed back to her normal one. Leafeon was quite outdone in size after all, as she was only up to Charizard’s legs in height, about a foot and a half, while he towered at at least seven feet tall, if not more. (Not to mention type differences).


“Over there, to the right,” Leafeon directed, Charizard raised his neck above the other students to look, “the class with the ‘Z’ on the door.” Ahead, slightly obscured by the crowd of nearly late students, was a peculiar door that stood out from the others, in a sense that if you looked at it you'd realize it was the only door in the entire hallway that didn't pop out with exciting colors or highly detailed art made to represent the class or teacher. It was a simple door with a ‘Z’ etched roughly into the wood of the outside, scratchy and straight up pale in comparison to everything else. Charizard snorted.


“What's with this class?” Charizard said derisively, being much at home with his dominant side, he made it an effort to spot out the strong from the weak, and for some reason, one he couldn't figure out, this door was special. “Who teaches this one?”


“Professor Zangoose,” Leafeon answered, Charizard flinched, the Grass type’s ear flicked in response, she looked up at him, “what?”


Charizard felt a knot in his stomach immediately, this must have been it, a professor. They both stood outside the door. Normally he wouldn't have a care in the world if it weren't so rare a Zangoose becomes a professor. He knew one at the previous school… but surely all the Pokémon were dead. This couldn’t be same Zangoose he knew! Not the same- it couldn’t be- there was no way!
