14521122112112111.content:
“What is it?” Leafeon had stopped after Charizard appeared frozen. She squinted, scanning his eyes to see what was wrong, quickly she frowned. “Hey, we need to get to class, we've only got two minutes,” Leafeon consoled him, Charizard closed his eyes and proceeded to rapidly shake his head to clear his mind, which grabbed the attention of some passersby who didn't look on for too long before continuing, Leafeon huffed as Charizard stopped and approached her, “if you're worried about failing at least don't start having a seizure in the middle of the hallway!” She grunted. Her cheeks were a bit flushed, mostly because some of the Pokémon who passed by turned her way too.


“I'm not worried about the class! Psht- the class should be worried about me!” Charizard smirked in an attempt to hide his own feelings, however, Leafeon stared at him with her cheeks becoming redder and redder, and her face still in a twisted annoyance.


“That doesn't even- that's not-” she scoffed, unable to form a full sentence, “oh just come on!” Leafeon turned on the spot before entering with her face hidden. Charizard frowned and the knot in his stomach swelled to the size of a beach ball. He knew he had said something wrong as she disappeared around the wall, presumably to find a seat, it dawned on him that he should probably get inside too, but that shameful sensation of embarrassing his friend in the hallway overwhelmed him as he cautiously walked into class.


For the first time in his life Charizard was self-conscious about his sex, as it was massive and let loose. Little did it really matter, as all Pokémon were generally nude, some with natural covers and some without, yet in a weird way Charizard was filled with shyness. Never before had he been so aware of his large shaft and enormous sack. Especially because the classroom was large enough for him to fly up and around without touching a single thing. (Imagine a large college room, for reference :) ).


Charizard stood in the frame of the door anyways and scanned the classroom; He stands in place, blocking the view of the hallway. From left to right he saw Pokémon chatting with each other and saw those who had just gotten inside, and by the second most had turned to see the massive rarity that was Charizard. He gritted his teeth as he looked on to the professor…


The white furred creature was still, at his desk, his focus on the classroom, sitting in his seat seemingly with a disregard to any social cues the class may be giving off, but with the sternest face of them all. Charizard gulped. The room was icy, the hall’s busy, cheerful vibe was fading away, the last few voices were dying down, and even Leafeon’s attention had been shifted from her fluster to a stiff expression.


Students were staring down the classroom, their elevated seats and steps, their desks and books and classmates, of all mixed types, and all eyes were on Charizard, whose eyes themselves laid upon the sitting Zangoose, legs crossed, hands folded together as the red-striped Pokémon was altogether unmoving. Zangoose inhaled and Leafeon watched closely, trying to determine what was going down, though nothing had happened yet. Professor Zangoose closed his eyes and sighed, leaning back in his seat, which was oddly in the shape of a human’s seat, but fit just for his build, which itself was also a mystery under that thick, white fur.


“You should be sitting down soon,” Zangoose’s voice echoed around the spacious classroom, there was a pause… “you’re going to be late.” the professor gritted under his breath, but just barely enough for those in the back to perk up their ears.


Charizard stepped forward slowly, allowing the door to close behind him, sweat seemingly formed on his forehead. No one was moving, no one was talking, if it weren’t for their chests moving you’d also believe no one was breathing. The anticipation that dreaded through the seats and bottoms of those who were in the risers, suppressed, and the expectation of a confrontation, unsubdued. Eyes flickered between Charizard and the professor.


Leafeon shut her mouth, lips clenched, her hopeful eyes on Charizard before--


Riiing!



Students jumped, some flinched, some gasped, but most importantly was it that Zangoose remained unfazed. Charizard quickly vanished from his position and found the first seat he could… granted at the expense of a much smaller Zigzagoon, who batted at Charizard’s wings to be able to see. The others looked down at the teacher now, after all was settled.


Charizard was panting silently, his body in shock, even though he could keep a superficial composure he was nervous for the first time in a long time. Today was a lot of firsts for him. Charizard’s mind raced with thoughts. That Zangoose, his normal appearance, his nerving aura, his… everything. This was the very professor he knew, the only one who survived the old school, other than Charizard himself of course, but now here as if nothing had ever happened. How was he here? How did he survive? The class’s attitude was back in full force, a silent chatter rising until the teacher takes action.


Professor Zangoose was the big man on campus, secretly the head of a school gang, with emphasis on predators, if there was something he wanted done it would be so. Outside of school he still had a massive influence on student actions, even going as far as to get other teachers down a gullet if he wished. Charizard had been his second, seeing that he’d be granted his lusts and meals, with the twenty thousand or so Pokémon students, when Zangoose was his old boss. Before the school had burst to flames, Zangoose and him were at odds, Charizard had disobeyed him and it cost Zangoose a large sum of money.


“Hey, get outta my face!” the Zigzagoon snarled, Charizard snapped back into reality and quickly moved his wing, folding them behind his back, the small raccoon rose a brow before smirking, “Not so tough huh? Did I scare you?” He chuckled, believing he had found a target. Charizard huffed and looked down at the Zigzagoon.


Charizard’s face became a nasty stare, his teeth baring, scaring the Zigzagoon’s former demeanor to fearful before the raccoon turned his attention to the board in hopes that the Charizard doesn’t continue. “That’s what I thought, now pay attention.” Charizard grunted. Zigzagoon nodded furiously, almost whimpering as he watched the Zangoose.


The brief intervention from the raccoon was thankfully what Charizard needed to focus. Zangoose rose, and without hesitation silence fell on the room again.


“Now, since we’re all here, and I’ve taken attendance…” Zangoose gestured towards his desk, “we can start the class. I am Professor Zangoose, and will be teaching you on the subject of evolutions and how they work, but I’m sure that you know all about it already-” he glanced at Charizard, then to another equally evolved Pokémon, “so I guess I’ll be repeating the same, agonizing lectures like every other Evolution teacher, right?” Zangoose asked the room, standing in place in front of the board. Students glanced left and right for someone else to answer, hopefully.


“Wrong!” Zangoose shouted, multiple Pokémon were taken aback, “You know absolutely nothing about Evolution, and there is no one in here but me who can say otherwise! Pokémon don’t just evolve, they change, and they always do, take it from me, and until the end of the year I will hear no whining or complaining about how your answer is right, because it will be wrong!” Zangoose ranted, “Now, listen closely, or you will fail. Everything you thought you knew about evolution is going to be questioned, and I will make sure none of you leave this year unless you know every- single- miniscule- undeniable detail about it!”


The class was shaken, even Charizard. Leafeon glanced towards Charizard, who was to her far right and below her a couple of seats. Zangoose raised a brow before reaching behind him and grabbing a whiteboard marker. He opened his mouth to speak.


“Let’s start on what really happens when a Pokémon evolves.”
14521122112112111.title: Evolution 3 (Pt.2)

145211221121121112.content:
“Why are these classes so spread out?” Charizard huffed. Leafeon smirked.

“What, you don't like walking?” She giggled. Charizard let out a puff of smoke from his nostrils.

“No,” each hallway was separated, and each classroom much more so because of their ridiculously massive spaces “I don't like bumping into Pokémon who walk under me.” Leafeon glanced up in thought for a moment.

“How often does that happen?” She asked. They rounded a corner, she was not going to be with him in this class, she had a different one some hallways down.

Charizard rolled his eyes. “Too much.”

“Well, here's your classroom. I've got to get to mine now,” Leafeon grinned. Charizard was about to say thanks but Leafeon interrupted him. “Like— it's really far and I don't have a lot of time— after this class just stay here and I'll come get you.”

“I'm not a—” but Leafeon had already ran off opposite to the direction they walked in “pfft, ‘come and get you,’ I wasn't fresh out of the egg yesterday,” he scoffed to himself, his eyes trailing the grass-type as she disappeared. He turned around amidst the students to see the title card for the class. He raised a brow, it read ‘Dr. Garchomp, Eggs’. “What do you know?”

This time around he was sure to fit through the door. In fact, two other students of relatively medium sizes walked in along with him. Past the door, Charizard’s eyes met the classroom counters first. There were eggs everywhere, save for any student seats. Charizard, having seen many eggs himself, knew immediately that they were all fake. Some painted even, with cheery words directed for the teacher, some with the year of previous graduation dates.

“Come in, come in!” A Garchomp beckoned, he was standing behind a desk. The room reminded Charizard of a Pokémon nursery. “We've got loads of time, so find a seat wherever you like, and wait for instructions.”

Charizard trailed other students to the smaller columns and rows that were centered towards the middle desk where Dr. Garchomp was standing. He settled on one of the more secluded desks as he needed more physical space. Once Charizard sat down, he realized this was the closest he had gotten today at being relaxed. The room may have been more official for where the eggs rested, but everything was decorated in a deep blue and bright turquoise paint mesh, with glitter. Charizard found it weird that a Garchomp would even bother with such decorations. Student papers and posters lined a single wall, the left wall, where upon inspection Charizard realized there were no windows, but a luminescent glare resonating from… somewhere. He squinted. The dragon did not trust this random, weird glow. He scanned it up and down, and every surface of the room, until the bell rang.

Students had settled down mostly in the first few rows, Charizard sat in the back. Not the farthest back, because there were still rows behind him, but enough to be considered the back of the class. There were hardly too many students here, maybe… Charizard counted with his claws, then ran out of claws, and gave up. He decided there were less than twenty including himself.

The teacher had already been talking for a second, Charizard put his attention forward, Dr. Garchomp was beside an egg, barely a quarter of his size. “… know that this is probably your easiest class this year. Most of your seniors know this already so they've taken up eggs a fourth time.”

Four times?! Charizard gawked, he had not been in a single class for more than just a semester. Why would someone take a single class four times? As far as he knew, classes always ended and you were moved up at the end of a year.

“You may already know everything about eggs already, but since the school requires us to teach it, I do it anyway. Eggs are fascinating, you know? Here, just look, ever wondered what a shell is made of? Ever tried figuring out what Pokémon is in an egg? Unless you already know, of course, hehe.” Despite the farfetched joke, nobody laughed. The egg next to Dr. Garchomp was teetering close to the edge of the awkwardly placed stool. A stool—?! Charizard leaned forward and held his breath in realization. He noticed other students were just as tense while Dr. Garchomp was talking. The teacher kept pausing his words, it looked like he was forcing himself to stay composed.

“Yes it will be a bit of a sex-ed, but the difference is that it's about eggs, and we have one right here,” Dr. Garchomp smiled. His smile was toothy, as per usual for a Garchomp. The teacher raised his singular claw and embraced the egg on the stool. Everyone seemed to flinch as his fin swept dangerously close to the stool egg. Other Pokémon sitting in front of Charizard were visibly uncomfortable. “I see you're all excited about it. Don't worry about it being on a stool, kids,” students still flinched when his extended arm kept waving around the egg. “I of all people know entirely that it's a terrible spot. However this is for showcasing purposes, and—”

There was a collective gasp when the egg wobbled forward. Dr. Garchomp instinctively grabbed it, and set it right. The terrified faces of the other students were washed over with relief, Charizard wiped a bead of sweat off of his forehead. “Whoo! That was scary. If that's one thing you all can learn, never place your eggs in a sketchy place! That is your first lesson.”

Finally the teacher turned around, his tail swinging along. Students jerked forward in their seat in an attempt to stop him, because his tail was going to collide with the egg! Charizard jumped up, making multiple desks scoot over violently.

Smack!
Gasp!

The egg smashed into the floor… revealing the styrofoam that it was made out of. With an ecstatic grin already formed across his face, Dr. Garchomp turned and burst out laughing. With much disgruntlement students eventually sat back down. The only two people who were laughing besides the teacher were a Prinplup and a Braixen, the former raising a brow at the latter for her exaggerated booming.

“I'll be honest, I almost botched the plan— when it wobbled. This class is attentive, for one thing, “ he thought aloud “haha… anyways, time for the actual lesson. Let it be known that this is a good lesson to learn overall, always pay attention to the egg in the room.”

Charizard huffed, and began to set the desks straight. A couple of students glanced to see the creaking noise coming from the desks. Charizard’s face turned redder than it had previously been. To his surprise, the Braixen, who had been laughing outrageously louder than necessary, spoke up. “Look at that huh? Fooled by the egg? You didn't need to knock all of those desks down you know, it was fake, ha!”

The Prinplup, Charizard noticed, gave a disapproving look towards the psychic fox. Charizard had been very taken aback, his face turned even more rose, but more in annoyance than embarrassment. He was going to speak his mind, but simultaneously Dr. Garchomp started teaching and the snarky girl spun back in her seat.

The dragon grunted angrily, but went back to fixing the desks. No one but the counselors and some teachers used paper; All of the tests were oral exams to combat the lack of opposable thumbs in the school, so there was no paper on the floor Charizard had to pick up at least. Can I even pick up paper? Charizard thought. He inspected his claws while sat.

Charizard stepped out of IV class and into the open hallway, students of all shapes and sizes were bursting out of their classrooms, ready for lunch time.

“Careful with that! No- don't- hey that's fragile-! Slow down!” The Serperior teacher’s voice was drowned out by the tidal wave of students who were more than ecstatic to leave his class. Admittedly Charizard was too but he understood the teacher’s worries considering the raw amount of delicate items in the snake’s room. “Fine! Fine leave! Go- out, out!”

Charizard’s first priority was to find Leafeon. She mentioned she’d be at the spot where they met for the first time, earlier that day, so Charizard started in that direction. It was the Garden, it's full of berries, and his favorite too, from what he could remember. He passed hundreds of miscellaneous Pokémon in the hallway, turning past packed corridors and clean stretches of floor. Having learnt there to be at least five thousand students at this school, Charizard was expecting the Garden to be packed to the brim.

On the contrary, when he arrived, it was empty. Devoid of life. There weren't even sounds of other students here, just… silence. This area of the school was apparently abandoned, except for the gym, which was close by, but it was obvious there was a lack of care for this small, peaceful place. The plants took care of themselves though. Weird how a teacher's permission was needed to eat the berries but no one’s even here, Charizard thought...

“Hiya! Ready to go to lunch?” Leafeon’s voice appeared from behind Charizard. The dragon jerked his body around to face her.

“You almost gave me a heart-attack!” Charizard huffed, placing a claw on his head. Leafeon’s smile broadened with a devious satisfaction. She didn't exactly understand that Charizard would have severely hurt her on accident had he not been careful and chose to restrain himself.

“Haha! Sure, and I'm a Ghost-type, now let's go!”

--

Large, open doors were the first thing that caught Charizard’s eyes as Leafeon led him around a corner, one full of students. The other areas in this school were what you'd expect- normal- but this door stood out, as students ran in.

“So is this th-”

“Yes- yes- shh! I want you to see it, it's so cool!” Leafeon interrupted him. Charizard huffed a small complaint, but it disappeared just as quick when he and Leafeon rounded a final turn...

The cafeteria was bustling with life! There had to be at least a thousand Pokémon here! Leafeon and Charizard were just past the entrance hall as the dragon was awestruck. In his previous school, they didn't have half of the wonderous things in here: type-attuned tables, a large lunch variety, massive amounts of space, and color, color, color! Large pillars supported a roof that was so far high that Flying type Pokémon appeared about half their size when at the top. Seats and chairs were placed in spots where it was undeniable about what type sat where, though that didn't stop Pokémon from sitting next to their friends, and it all looked so polished and clean! There was so much to take in that it took Charizard a nip to the thigh from Leafeon to snap him out of his trance.

“Fine.” Charizard relented. Immediately Leafeon walked back towards the line, Charizard following. Leafeon spun around lightning fast.

“I meant follow me after!” Leafeon hissed crossly, still under her breath, Charizard’s stomach dropped and Leafeon went back towards the line. Charizard turned and walked a small distance away before going back to look at Growlithe.

Leafeon was constantly looking around, her face filled with worry. There were a lot of Pokémon in this place, and to lure someone out would be tough, so how was she going to do it? Although he was really trying to give up the bully act, Charizard still had that feeling, that dominant feeling, and he couldn’t help but want to punish Growlithe…

Gay joke but Archie didn't seem to mind. "Not bad. He uses his psych powers to make me feel the simulation of a Pokemon struggling as we made love. Always turn me on so hard. We sometimes cockvore each other's cocks. It feels like if we had a pussy, that would be it."

I'm not one for vengeance but they should be taught a lesson."

They sat there for hours. Neither one of them has anywhere to be and is a beautiful scene. A great place to feel the sun shining strong and forget about your worries. As it got darker, Archie finely got the "courage" to ask this sensitive question. "Hey, Stella. Have you seen your mother around?"

Stella didn't say anything for a bit. Then she snapped at him. "She is not my god damn mother!! Why does everyone keep referring to her that she is my MOTHER???!!!!!" She yelled at him.

Archie put his paws up defensively. "Stella! I know its hard but you know why! Topaz unbirthed you. Had you in her womb for week. After that, your genes changed from who you were to be hers. You no longer have any blood connection other then to her. And, I know you do, but lost all that motherly affection from your first mom and now it's directed to Topaz. Stop fighting that truth."

The day quickly turn to night and Stella's heart sank with the sun. There was no way she could get to her room with some Pokemon wanting to eat her. Especially at night. 145332121121.content: Now, which gender do you want the Lucario to be?
145332121121.title: Lucario

1453321211212.content:
“Can’t believe this” A Lucario thought to herself in an almost empty bathroom as she used the tap water and a towel to clean her saliva covered legs. “How do I always let this happen? They always get close to me before I can take em down, run or… or someone saves me.” She coughed in her exhaustion. Her heart was still beating fast along with her breaths because of the near death experience. “…And yet I’m still not used to it, though I really expected better from such a grand school...” As the Lucario cleaned herself, she slowly worked her way up her leg, and quickly noticed that the saliva had almost reached her precious virginity. She hadn’t noticed what his tongue was working its way towards because she was panicking and was fighting her way out of the throat. Luckily it seems he didn’t make it.

“Pervert” she spoke under her breath as she diverted her stare to the unconscious Aggron who, until a few moments ago, was about to be her predator. Once she had used a wet towel to get rid of the saliva, she took a fresh one to dry herself. She then stood up, soaked the wet towel in water to get rid of the saliva, then while limping slightly she walked towards the beast she had almost lost to.
“Choose smaller prey next time” she said angrily, throwing the wet towel at him then proceeding to leave the deserted bathroom. She had already known that he was unconscious, but for a reason that was probably pride, she couldn’t help it.

“I hate to admit it, but for a typical predator, he actually got me good… I won’t be able to fight for a while with the busted arm and leg.” She sighed “Damn weak body” She didn’t want to think about it any longer, so she continued to walk through the corridors with a map in hand.
After a tiring experience, her hunger had increased. The Lucario wasn’t the type to eat a pokemon whenever she was feeling hungry, especially if they were a fellow class mate. Sure she had the space to do it and in emergencies she was actually guilty of doing so, but that was rarely ever the case. She could control her hunger for the most part. Though she did sometimes hunt in the wild when she wanted something different, but that was on rare occasions. With the slightly embarrassing sound of her rumbling stomach, the thought of making a stop to the cafeteria was in her mind, not for carnivorous reasons of course. Besides, she was early anyway, so why not?

Then again, with so many areas in the school she should probably get accustomed to it for now or at least meet her teacher early so that she can make a good impression. Her tomboyish nature meant that she didn’t really care much about the latter, but since she’s new to the school there was no harm in it.
1453321211212.title: Frail Fighter

choices: She had arrived at the cafeteria
14533212112121.content:
"...Oh screw it I'm hungry!" she said happily and out loud. "besides... I deserve a treat after a hard earned victory..." she spoke softly this time. She looked back at for a moment as she pondered on whether to report her "challenger" in the bathroom, but in the end, decided not to and calmly left. Now that she knew his attack pattern, she was confident that she could take him down next time.

She keeps her attention fixed on the school map in her paws and proceeded down the hallway. She looked away from the map for one moment to make sure she had taken the right turns and...
14533212112121.title: Breakfast time

145332121121211.content:
The Lucario felt someone bump into her which made her drop her map "Hey! Watch where you're going!"She spent no time looking at the figure, instead she went straight on her knees to pick up the map.
"Tried. But being a larger pokemon makes it hard not to bump into anyone in a corridor, especially if someone is standing in the middle of it". She hated to admit it, but he had a point. She sighed, she was in the wrong so she had to apologise. She took in a heavy and notably odd smelling breath as she reluctantly raised her head to apologise to the pokemon.
"I'm so.......rry..." her answer was slowed because of the familiar pokemon that towered over her. There was no mistaking it, his powerful gaze, magestic wings, sharp claws and the warm and bright flame at the end of his tail that was thicker than her arms. The name was on the tip of her tongue... Why couldn't she remember his name?
"You can do more than just kneel by it if you're really that amazed, but I'd rather it be somewhere more.... private." He said sarcastically, though she felt a hint of truth on... whatever he meant.
"Huh?" The Lucario questioned innocently before her gaze was diverted to his other enormous body part resting between his large thighs that was directly in front of her, and, with one small half-a-step forward, the tip was directly touching her nose.
After a split second of feeling the warm meat, she leaped back, preparing to call him a pervert, but somehow her words changed involuntarily.

"Singe!" she shouted at him angrily. Her yell captured the attention of the orange dragon as well as some of the students passing through for a short moment. The Lucario seemed oddly happy after remembering his name.
"...And who are you?"
"Oh..uh-umm... I-I'm Delilah" Singe turned his head slightly. Seems like he didn't recognise her . "A-ah umm you helped me once in our old w-when I was a Riolu and you were a charmeleon.." There was still no reaction. She hated these akward situations, she was never any good at them. She calmed down and thought about what she was going to say, then opened her mouth again "I was one of the students in your class. I sometimes asked you for help since you were one of the smart ones and I was a lot more shy being a newcomer... not to mention you saved me from that bully once."
"...I.. vaguely remember someone like that" He replied, discouraging her. "Yeah, we didn't talk much, but I always trusted you even though you didn't seem to get close to many students, but you had a reputation of helping the minors and was kind hearted...... Well until the fire......"
"Humph.... Well I'll be on my way, don't want to keep the corridor crowded..." He quickly replied, then walked around her.
"B-but for the record, I don't think it was you." Singe stopped before leaving. "Even though all my friends died in that fire, I still never thought it was you....." She turned to the leaving beast "I never understood why they did anyway, there was clearly someone who was more suspicious."

That seemed to get his attention. "You wanna discuss this somewhere else? Somewhere quieter? Like... the roof"

Delilah thought for a moment. She trusted him, but did she really want to follow a pokemon with a complete type advantage to her, while in an injured and weak state? Not to mention hights really wasn't her thing, she'd be at a complete disadvantage in case she turns out to be wrong about the dragon. Not to mention she herself was hungry. If she postpones it 'till later though, she might loose some valuable information or a valuable ally into finding the murderer of her friends.
145332121121211.title: The incident and a familiar face

choices: They begin to discuss the fire
1453321211212111.content:
After some thought, the Lucario nods and allows the Charizard to lead the way.

The soothing breeze that brushed against Delilah’s fur was an indicator that they had finally arrived. Singe moved out of her way and behind her so she could see the sight before her. The “roof” was not literally the roof, but an open area that was on one of the highest buildings of the school. It was grand but quiet and desolate, the only noises were the conversations of the Pokémon on the outer area of the school, and they were too high up for it to be anything more than quiet noises.
“I got a tip from a friend that this area is usually empty in the mornings” Sing saidshe looked around at the wide but oddly empty space
“Why only the mornings?” she questioned as she turned her head.
“From what I heard this is a pretty popular predator hangout area. It’s empty since apparently the Pokémon that are here usually come in late and hang around here during and after lessons. None of the younger or generally smaller students go here in the morning because they don’t wanna test their luck and find a hungry predator”.
“A friend told you all that?”
“Heh. Yeah she was pretty helpful” The Lucario couldn’t help but feel her trust fade at least a little as the Charizard scratched his full looking stomach with an uncomfortable smile.
"S-so wait... if this a predator area... Then why did you bring me here!?"
"Oh? You don't trust me?"
"O-of couse I do!... But-"
"Please" Singe chuckled "I've never faced a Pokémon larger or stronger than myself. I can protect you"

Delilah blushed at his arrogant yet caring remark, but then quickly tried to regain her composure.
"I can fight for myself now. I'm not as weak as I used to be!"
"Not in your condition"
"I'm fine!"
"I saw you limping" he chuckled again "Got in trouble on the morning of your first day in this school huh?"
"Ugh" She couldn't deny it so she kept quiet, though her angered and annoyed expression spoke for itself. She hated herself for showing weakness. She needed to change the subject now.

“So umm…. About the reason we came here….” She began fidgeting because of the sensitive subject. For the first time in a long time she suddenly felt incredibly shy. “Where do I start……”
1453321211212111.title: Trust him

14533212112121111.content:
The Lucario took a deep breathe, collecting her thoughts of what she was about to say. "That fire was the scariest thing that's ever happened to me. It haunted my dreams for a few days, but I've been told that's normal." She began pacing left and right in front of Singe. She couldn't bring herself to look directly at him as she expressed her feelings and her weakness. "I got over it a lot quicker than any of the other smaller Pokemon involved did, well, the living ones. Everyone commended me for how brave I was, especially since it was normally so shy... though I wasn't exactly proud of why I got over it so quickly. I'd never tell anyone why that incident didn't scar me as much as the others, I was afraid others would judge me for it... but I guess a carnivorous Pokemon such as yourself couldn't really look down on me". She stopped walking and turned her head slightly to look at him for just a second, giving him an awkward smile. Singe didn't reply.

She brought her arm out in front of her and watched as the aura emanated from it. The azure aura rose gently from her furry palm, the shape resembling a fire. There was something mesmerising about it. Focusing on the flow of the aura calmed her emotions. "The fire was the best thing that ever happened to me. There was no point in denying it, the thought of all those who hated me burning in flames or being devoured by other predators filled me with a corrupted sense of joy and excitement. Everyone there was an idiot. The teachers, the students everyone. There were 2 students that I appreciated though. I had respect for you, which was for helping me at one point, and there was Cheryl."
"That green Teddiursa?" Singe replied at last. Delilah nodded in response.
"Her rare colour made her popular among some pokemon, as well as despised with jealousy. She had many other friends, though she was always more open with me, and I was more open with her too. She was the only friend I had.... and she died that day." She closed her palm slowly. "That day was a real wake up call. I finally toughened up and decided that I didn't want to be a fragile little thing that I was. So that's what I did, and once I was confident in my abilities I decided to track down Cheryl's killer"
"You wanted revenge?"
"It sounds kinda corny I know" she blushed slightly. "..But she was the only reason I actually have good memories of being a young Riolu. The least I could do is ensure that her soul can properly rest, and the only way to do that is to track the one that killed her. So ever since then, I've been taking down the handful of large Pokemon that made it out. One by one" The Lucario felt a surge of confidence within herself. She now began to look at Singe straight in the eye.
"And where would I be on that list of vengeance?" Singe replied. He clearly wasn't serious about the situation at all, in fact, he only seemed amused by it.
"You aren't on it"
"Oh?" Now he seemed surprised."And why's that? You clearly think that I'm a ruthless predator. What makes you think I wouldn't devour her like I do for the rest?"
"The Charmeleon that turned down many mate requests to stick with one Teddiursa, turns around and eats her without a second thought when turning into a Charizard?" She folded her arms and smiled at him confidently. "I don't buy it"
"You're surprisingly logical about it, not to mention well informed."
"Well I didn't have a choice. She never stopped talking about you... But hey, if it makes you feel any better, you're on the top of my list for who I think burned down the school"
"So you lied earlier." He chuckled "I gotta admit, you had me going there."
"Well I've changed a lot. Enough time thinking about the old days though, I need your help"
"I'm listening, but make it quick" The dragon seemed tired of all the talking, but the Lucario was determined to persuade him.

"There's only one Pokemon left on my list, and it's a Magmortar. I've had the luck of not facing Pokemon that were disadvantageous to my type, but this guy is going to provide me with some obvious difficulties."
"Get to the point in which I benefit from this" He replied while yawning. He didn't waste any time in lying down while listening to her, but the Lucario wouldn't give up.
"He's a fire Pokemon, beating him down will be the first step in getting others to trust you again."
"How so?"
"Well I'm trusted for being a victim from that incident in our previous school. If you help me take him down then we can blame the fire on him. I don't have any evidence, but they're bound to believe me, and word spreads pretty fast"
"Hmmm" The Charizard seemed interested in her proposition. Without warning, Singe wrapped his tail around her leg. The Lucario gasped in surprise as he calmly lay on his back, the slowly brought her above his stomach. He quickly unwrapped his tail, allowing her to fall onto his gigantic gut. Upon landing, Delilah instantly felt poking from inside, as if his previous victims were in great agony and begging for help. He chose to devour them alive, and apparently he loved the struggle of his helpless victims. The Lucario felt a shiver down her spine as she lay on his stomach, feeling the constant poking from inside. "You know what kind on Pokemon I am... but, are you really comfortable with that?" The Lucario's confidence was quickly fading, but she made it this far, she had to be persistent. Without another thought, she brought herself to her knees, and rubbed the beast's stomach. She looked up at him while gathering all the confidence she could muster.

"No problem."
14533212112121111.title: They begin to discuss the fire

choices: She gets to know her classmates
145332121121211111.content:
The dragon reacted by widely opening his maw. Delilah's hairs stood on end with horror, she was sure she was done for, but he made no move to devour her. The only thing that touched her was the hot steam that he released. His tongue relaxed outside of his jaw, his eyes were closed, and small flares spewed from each nostril. Apparently he was enjoying this much more than the Lucario thought he would. Hoping for his approval, she continued please the beast, at least until his meal had passed out. Singe tried to keep his meal living for as long as possible by breathing in clean air for his victim to breathe, but his strong stomach acids prevented the moment to go on. Before long, Delilah didn't feel his meal kicking any more, but not before an agonizing cry from what sounded like a Wigglytuff. The Charizard had kept her alive throughout the entire digestion process but at least the pain didn't last her too long.
"You actually helped bring a slow death to an innocent Pokemon. How very.... sadistic." He thought quietly
"Pardon?"
"It's nothing. I'm just... expressing my appreciation for the new you."
"So wait, you'll help me out?"
"Oh I'll gladly help you" His arrogant tone was slightly unnerving, but she was relieved that he was agreeing to help her. "So why were you so confident in thinking that I was carnivorous?"
"Well besides being pretty obvious that someone of your size wouldn't eat just berries. I witnessed you actually doing it" She said. She felt much more at ease when speaking now that she had what she wanted.
"The Slowpoke?"
"Yeah, good memory. I guess you wouldn't forget your first. Anyway, I happen to my bag after class ended, so I sneaked in to get it. I hid in a book closet when I heard you two coming inside. The slowpoke teacher was yelling at you for what you had said to him that day. You actually surprised me that lesson. You weren't the type to insult a teacher like that and humiliate him in front of the class... uh.. well in your early Charmeleon years anyway."
"I.. don't remember much about that"
"You made fun of him for being in the first stage of evolution. He kept you behind and yelled at you about he had to be lucky to get a shelder to bite his tail, and in response, you bit his tail.... but then you didn't stop there, and swallowed his whole body whole...." She paused "It was... a little scary at first honestly, seeing you so content with taking another pokemon's life away to satisfy your hunger. The more I thought about it though... the less bothered I was. In fact, I was actually happy with the fact that I'd never have to see that idiot again." The Lucario stopped speaking once the bell rang.
"Well enough reminiscing" The Charizard said. Delilah simply nodded in response then checked her bag to see what lesson she had. "Any chance we have the same lesson?"
"P.E" She read.
"Well I guess it was too much to hope that we'd be in the same class." Singe turned to leave to his class.
"Wait!" She called out. "Where will we meet up"
"What's wrong with here?"
"You said it yourself, it's a hotspot for larger Pokemon."
"Well they won't be feasting on you if you're with me"
"At least let me write down your lessons so I can meet up with you" Singe sighed, but let her see his lessons. It didn't take her long to note them down. "All right I'll meet up with you after the lesson's over".
"I'm not waiting for you, so just go back here if you don't find me". The Lucario couldn't seem to convince him, so she didn't disagree with him and they headed their separate ways.

Delilah arrived at the gym, and was in awe at it's size. There were plenty of machines, each suited for different sizes of Pokemon. The main focus was the middle, which had four large mats with the same design for the battle arenas that humans used with Pokemon fights. The mats weren't the same size as the arenas that trainers used, but if it was, there wouldn't be enough room for another three battles to take place in the same gym. Delilah's last school didn't even allow Pokemon to fight against one another, so just having a training area was a huge improvement.
"Well I'm glad to see you're impressed with your new gym!" Snapping out of her thoughts, Delilah turned to the Machamp behind her. He towered her with his large size. She was quite impressed with him. He seemed capable, both as a fighter and a teacher. With a kind smile, bulging muscles and bulging.... but enough of that, it was unlike her to think of such things. "Considering that that Lucarios are quite rare, I'd say your my new student."
"I believe I am". She responded. "Delilah. A pleasure to meet you" She wasn't always so sophisticated, but she couldn't help but want to make the right impression with every new person she met.
"Ha! Pleasure's all mine." With one pair of arms still crossed, he used the other to mark her off a checklist of students. "I look forward to seeing your skill. Like I said earlier, Lucarios are quite rare, and I'd like to see your fighting style."
"Uh... where do I go?"
"Huh? Oh right, almost forgot. The right side of the gym is being used by the males in the year below us, and a group of males in the same year who couldn't use the other gym because apparently there isn't enough space, even though we're clearly packed in here too! Usually they wouldn't mix different years and genders together, but I guess someone screwed up with the lesson plan." He shrugged "Whatever, I guess I'm still getting paid."
"So uh..."
"Oh right sorry. Just go ahead with the rest of the girls to the left side. We can only use two of the fighting mats instead of the regular four, so you'll have to wait your turn. You can work out on some of the machines at the side if you can't wait, otherwise just take a seat on the bench" The Lucario left without hearing another word. She sat on a bench since she didn't want to strain her leg. She wanted to fight, but she wasn't really in the condition to do so.
145332121121211111.title: Acceptance

1453321211212111111.content:
Delilah merely sat and waited for the lesson to be over. She felt as if she was being tormented. Fighting was something she loved. She didn't necessarily care for bloodshed, but the thrill of battle and her determination to grow stronger made battles addictive. Now that she was finally given a place to do that in school she should be glad, but her damned injury was stopping her from doing anything.
The Lucario looked for others to talk to, but none seemed to be the type that she'd be compatible with. They were all far too feminine. They discussed topics that she didn't care for and didn't seem to have any interest in sports whatsoever. The only one who seemed kind and easy to talk to was a calm and well spoken Chansey, although after what she had just experienced with a certain other Pokemon, she wasn't in the right mood to talk to someone big and pink. The tomboyish females looked interesting enough to interact with, but they were spending their valuable time battling or training. In her boredom, the Lucario looked over to the men's side of the gym.They seemed much more carefree and easy to talk, unlike her classmates.
Without intending to, her mind began to wonder on certain... qualities of the group of males in the same year. She didn’t regularly have these thoughts, but recently she just couldn’t help herself, and it let her guard down for what was to come.

As she continued to stare blankly at the males Pokemon while her imagination ran wild, she stopped as something dark and blue got in her way of vision. She looked up to see the face of one of the students she had been staring at in the group of males, or more specifically, a Machoke. He stood in front of Delilah, grinning and fully aware of his navy blue underwear being directly in front of her face.
“What the hell are-?!” The Machoke quickly put his right foot on the bench, grabbed the back of her head and pressed it against his crotch.
“Heh, you like that, huh?” he interrupted, and for a moment, she did. She enjoyed the feeling of it touching her face as she imagined the large and sweaty meat that rested behind the bulge. All the girls at the bench watched, some giggling as they expected them to do it right there and then under the teacher’s nose. It was only a small moment, but a moment nonetheless, and one that she quickly snapped out of. With her palm filled with aura, she stood up and shoved him away.
“How dare you?!” She yelled at him enraged and embarrassed. Her anger echoed in the gym, catching the attention of all its occupants. The Machoke looked behind him, as all the students awaited his reply. He couldn’t back down now, he would never do such a thing once he had grabbed everyone’s attention, and he had no intention of leaving with what he wanted.
“Don’t hide it. You want me.”
“Want you? You’re joking. Why would I want to even look at someone as pathetic as you.”
“You won’t be saying that once I’m done with you”
“You’re challenging me?”
“You’re damn right I am.”This was the exact opportunity she wanted. It was the perfect chance to test out her skills. His arrogance reminded her of a certain dragon that she was acquainted with, only much more stupid and without the intimidating power that comes with being more than double her size. With both of those gone, this should be a cakewalk. Still, she was injured from this morning, so fighting now may not be the best thing to do.
1453321211212111111.title: Unexpected challenge

choices: Skip the rest of the lesson to find Singe
Stay in the bathroom for a little longer
14533212112121111112.content:
Her palms began to resonate with the power of the aura as her eyes narrowed. Her blood was boiling and ready for a fight, however the teacher saw fit to intervene. With all four of his arms, he separated the combatants before the brawl had begun. Night turned to day, beams of warm light filtering through the glass windows that surrounded the large doors leading in to the school, illuminating the empty central hallway that ran all the way from one end of the building to the other. A bell soon rang, announcing the start of the day. Pokémon of all sizes began to emerge from the side hallways that led off to the dormitories, while the main entrance doors flew open to admit those students who lived elsewhere. The initial flood soon died down as Pokémon made their ways to their classes, leaving behind a stunned, nervous looking Zorua standing in the doorway of the main entrance. Her tail was lowered to the ground and flicked nervously as her eyes stared down the long, main corridor.

“Be brave, my child...” The voice drifted to the Zorua's mind, the voice of her mother. “Be strong. I believe in you, dear Nocturne...”

Images of her mom flashed before the Zorua named Nocturne. Her mom... She was a strong, mature Zoroark, loving and adoring of her child, and now Nocturne was on her own. Almost.

An Eevee, about the same size as Nocturne but wearing a small bag around her neck, walked up from behind the Zorua and stopped by her side. The Eevee's large tail wagged in the air as she tilted her head to look at her friend. “I thought you were the one so enthusiastic about this, Nox...”

Nox. It was a nickname the Eevee had given to Nocturne, and by now the Zorua rather preferred it than her full name. She shook her head as she turned to look at the Eevee, her friend smiling at her. “Did you see that? There were a lot of other Pokémon... Many larger than us...” Nox spoke.

The Eevee continued to smile as she shook her head. “It's just culture shock. You've never been around so many other Pokémon before.”

“I didn't grow up in a large village like you, Stella...” Nox muttered. “I've lived alone with my mom my entire life, at least until I met you, and even then...”

“Come on, don't worry about that okay?” Stella, the Eevee, said to try to calm her friend down. “We were told to go see the principal, so let's not stand around all day. You don't want to still be wandering around when first class gets out, do you?”

“Uh... Good point...” Nox quickly realized that until she actually understood her way around this place, getting stranded and possibly trampled in a sea of other Pokémon didn't sound like such a good idea. “Do you have the map we were given?”

Stella nodded and shrugged off her bag, sitting down as she opened it up and pulled out a folded piece of paper. Spreading it open on the floor, she pointed out where they were with a paw. “We're here...” She then looked around some before pointing out a room labeled as the principal's office. “And that's where we need to go. Unless you want to stop somewhere first?”

Nox frowned as she thought about it. They weren't in that much of a hurry, they didn't actually need to go to classes today after all, but perhaps it would just be best to head straight to their destination now until they had a better understanding of their new school.
14533212112222222112.title: Female

choices: Yeah...  Mind if we step into the bathroom?  I won't be long...
145332121122222221121.content:
“We'll have plenty of time to check out the school later. For now, it's probably best just to do as told until we get a better grasp of how this place works,” Nox reasoned.

Stella nodded in agreement, it was a rather sensible idea after all. As she began to fold up the map and tuck it back in her bag, she said, “Okay then, we'll just head to the principal's office now.”

After Stella had pulled the bag back over her head the two friends set out, stepping fully into the school's large foyer before pushing the door closed behind them. The main foyer was rather large and high, with stairs rising upwards to the second level of the building on either side. The corridor that led out of the foyer was little different, being equally as large: the school had to allow for Pokémon much bigger than the Zorua and Eevee after all.

The friends glanced to either side of themselves as they wandered through the empty hallway. Doors led off to classrooms on each side, fogged windows allowing them to glance into some and look at the classes in session. Some of the classes seemed recognizable enough: math, history, art... Others were less recognizable, such as a darkened room in which the two friends could barely make out the shapes of two Pokémon. They seemed to be rubbing against each other oddly and faint moans could be heard through the door; perhaps some sort of dance practice? Nox shrugged and turned to walk back down the hallway, Stella pausing a moment and laughing to herself before quickly following.

About halfway down the length of the school, the friends reached an intersection of sorts where another hallway ran perpendicular to the main corridor. Glancing down it to either side, Nox faintly recalled that the gym was off in one direction while the cafeteria could be reached the other way. Keeping straight would take them to more classrooms and ultimately, at the end of the hall, the stairway that led to the administrative offices: principal's included.

At the intersection, Nox noticed something else though. Doors with bathroom signs on them were positioned in two of the intersection's corners, one adorned with a male symbol and the other with a female symbol. Nox paused and tilted her head as she looked at the bathroom doors, thinking for a moment. Stella soon also stopped in her tracks, partway through the intersection, as she realized that the Zorua was no longer beside her.

“Something up?” the Eevee asked.
145332121122222221121.title: Yeah, let's just go straight to the princip...

choices: A male Buizel stands behind Stella, eying her hungrily...
1453321211222222211212.content:
“I... I think I need to use the bathroom quickly...” Nox blushed as she said it, slightly embarrassed, and looked to the side. “It won't take long...”

Stella laughed lightly and shook her head, rather amused by her friend's behavior. “Oh, it's fine. I'm sure it won't take you the half hour or whatever we have left until class gets out.”

“Thanks...” Nox sighed as she walked over to the bathroom door, nudging it open and walking through into the room beyond.

The wood floor outside transitioned to tile in the bathroom, Nox relieved to find that everything looked rather clean. Sinks of various heights lined one wall beneath a long mirror, ranging from those sitting directly on the ground for small Pokémon such as Nox and Stella to tall pedestals that towered over the two friends, for use by the much larger Pokémon. Stalls lined the other wall, the doors and wall panels reaching down to just a few inches above the floor to maintain privacy even with small Pokémon about. Walking into one of those stalls, Nox found the toilet positioned on the floor, easily accessibly to anyone.

Stella didn't have to use the bathroom unlike her friend, but followed her into it anyway to check it out. As Nox walked into the stall and shut the door behind her, the Eevee walked over to one of the sinks on the ground, tapping a button with her paw to turn the water on. She ran her paws under the water, getting them wet and then rubbing the water into her face before it automatically shut off. Looking up at the mirror behind the sinks, the Eevee's heart almost leapt out of her chest as she found someone standing behind her.
1453321211222222211212.title: Yeah...  Mind if we step into the bathroom?  I ...

14533212112222222112121.content:
Standing right behind Stella, visible in the mirror, a Buizel stood over the small Eevee. Stella quickly turned around to face the new arrival, her eyes growing wide as she noticed the slight bulge of a sheath in the otter Pokemon's crotch.

“Who are you?” Stella asked the male Buizel. “Where'd you come from? Why are you in here?”

The Buizel smirked as he crossed his arms across his chest. “Who am I? I could ask you much the same, newbie. I've never seen you around before.”

Stella waited a moment to see if he would answer the other questions. When he didn't, she went on to ask, “Is it common for boys to use the girl's bathroom here, than?”

The Buizel raised an eyebrow. “Depends on what your definition of 'use' is.”

“Well what's your definition?” Stella asked. “Why are you here?”

“I was waiting for someone to show up,” the Buizel flatly explained. “You'll do...”

Before Stella could respond, the Buizel suddenly shot a paw forward, grasping the Eevee around her throat and pushing her against the floor. Stella screamed as she found herself firmly held in the Buizel's powerful grip, kicking her legs and waving her fluffy tail about futility, both actions not doing a thing to deter the Buizel.

“Stella? What's going on?!” Nox shouted from her stall, but her friend was in no position to answer. The Eevee could only choke and gasp as the Buizel's paw held her throat tightly, his mouth opening slightly as his tongue slipped out between his fangs.

“Yes, you will be perfect,” the Buizel muttered, quietly enough so that Nox couldn't hear. “You know what I'm going to do to you? I'll tell you...”
14533212112222222112121.title: A male Buizel stands behind Stella, eying her h...

choices: I'm just going to swallow you whole!
145332121122222221121211.content:
“I'm going to eat you,” the Buizel growled with a sick grin, Stella's eyes growing wide and her paws and tail drooping at those words. She was too stunned to try to escape now, but still the Buizel held her down tightly as he continued, “I'm going to gobble you down into my waiting gullet you tasty little Eevee, you tasty little snack...”

Then he leaned down, his tongue dragging across her chest fur and leaving behind a trail of drool-slicked fur that cut across her chest. Stella lowered her ears down as the Buizel picked his tongue up, skipped over his paw holding her down, and then did much the same to her face, drawing a wet line of drool through her fur straight across her muzzle.

“Oh yes, you are a tasty Eevee indeed...” the Buizel murmured as he pulled back slightly, his tongue still hanging out and letting drops of drool drip down to Stella's chest below. “I just want to eat you all up... But how...?”
145332121122222221121211.title: I'm going to eat you.

choices: Nox charges forward to attack the Buizel!
1453321211222222211212111.content:
A grin spread across the Buizel's face again as he silently knelt down, wrapping his tongue around one of Stella's ears and lovingly licking at it as she winced, trying to pull back. Slowly and quietly he spoke right into her ear: “I'm gonna swallow you down whole, dear. You'll make a lovely bulge in my throat and belly.”

Stella's eyes shot wide as the Buizel pulled his head back again, giving his lips one final lick before he suddenly spread them open, wider than the Eevee had ever thought possible. Tears welled up in her eyes as she was forced to stare into the back of his wet, drool-filled maw. Before she could so much as utter a whimper, however, the Buizel suddenly lunged down, spreading his wide maw completely around Stella's muzzle, then her entire head, until the Eevee found herself staring rather closely at that dark entrance to the Buizel's gullet.

“Say goodbye~” the Buizel said, the last words he spoke to her before he took the first abrupt swallow. At the same time he was forced to lift the paw off her throat, allowing the Eevee to finally give one sharp, shrill, bathroom-filling scream just as she found her head pulled into the Buizel's tight gullet, muffling her rather effectively.

“Stella?!” Nox yelled out in worry as she heard the scream. Quickly she tried to wrap her business up, finishing in the stall. Little did she know that outside her friend was being devoured surprisingly quickly by the Buizel, he stuffing her furry mane and shoulders into his already bulging throat. Then Stella's front paws vanished as well, the Buizel taking a loud gulp as they slipped into his maw and down his gullet.

Nox leaped forward and slammed the stall door open, shooting out of the stall and immediately stopping in her tracks, eyes wide with surprise as she stared at the sight in front of her. The Buizel stood there, fully half of Stella shoved down his throat, her rear paws and bushy tail wagging about crazily in midair. “W... What?” she gasped, unbelieving what she was seeing: her friend actually being eaten whole and alive by another Pokémon who was only about twice as large as the Eevee herself was! The Buizel eyed the Zorua curiously, but not worriedly as he took another gulp, a muffled “Veeee!” sounding from the squirming bulge in his throat as Stella's rear paws disappeared into the Buizel's maw. There wasn't long now, if Nox was going to save her friend she had to act fast!
1453321211222222211212111.title: I'm just going to swallow you whole!

choices: The Buizel knocks Nox off of him.
Nox and Stella kill the Buizel.
14533212112222222112121111.content: Nox charges ahead in anger at the Buizel who was swallowing her friend. She tackles the Buizel and he was shocked at this. She jumps on his jump repeatedly until the Buizel is forced to cough Stella up. Nox yanked Stella out of the Buizel by the tail with her teeth. The Buizel was unable to move as this was happening. Once her Eevee friend was free, Nox scratched the Buizel's face until he was bleeding onto the floor. "How dare you!" Nox yelled.
14533212112222222112121111.title: Stella!

145332121122222221121211112.content: Nox gestures Stella. The Eevee rips off the Buizel's leg with her teeth and starts chewing. It tasted so delicious that Nox got curious. She licked the Buizel's fur, taking in the taste...
145332121122222221121211112.title: Nox and Stella kill the Buizel.

1453321211222222211212111121.content:
"Mmmmm!" Nox cried. "This actually tastes really good"

Nox smiled, biting down on the dead Buizel's leg, ripping out another chunk of flesh.

The Buizels blood soaks her muzzle as Nox laps up the salty red liquid

Where will Nox eat next?
1453321211222222211212111121.title: Tastes good.

14533212112222222112121111211.content:
Eh, I'll just stay with the leg, decided Nox

Nox bites off another chunk of the Buizel's thigh, smiling as more of the Buizel's meat slides into her belly. Soon all that's left of the Buizel's leg is bone.
14533212112222222112121111211.title: Stay with the leg?

14533212112222222112121112.content:
Just as Nox was about to attack the Buizel in the hope of freeing Stella she suddenly finds herself knocked to the ground, letting out an oomph as the wind was forced out of her lungs. When she tried to stand up a sudden blast of heat seared her back and sent her falling down again with a scream of pain. Tears in her eyes, the Zorua twisted her head to try to see what was attacking her. Standing over the sprawled Zorua, appearing out of a shadowed corner of the bathroom, was a Quilava standing on two legs, arms crossed over his chest as he observed the Zorua with a smirk.

“My buddy Miles here doesn't much appreciate being disturbed while he eats,” the Quilava said. “Come now, let us watch him finish your friend off.” As if to indicate what would happen were Nox to try standing up again, flames suddenly shot out of the incendiary spots on the Quilava's head and rear. Nox whimpered as she rolled her head about to look at the Buizel, Miles, again.

The potential interruption dealt with, Miles paused for a moment as he reached a paw up to his throat, rubbing the bulge the Eevee made in it. It squirmed underneath his touch, trying to pull away, but there wasn't much anywhere to go inside the tight gullet. Stella was entirely surrounded by the fleshy tunnel, it squeezing against her body and pulsating oddly, dragging her down ever deeper. Her ears were folded flat against her head, her paws squeezed up against her chest and into her mane of fur. She cried as she stared into the absolute darkness, unable to see anything nor hear much at all. The only sensations available to her was the feeling of being trapped in the fleshy gullet and a vile, dank smell from deeper down.

With only Stella's tail exposed outside now, Miles suddenly spread his maw wide, lowering it so Nox could see quite clearly as he took one more, final swallow. That bushy tail, the remainder of Nox's closest friend, slipped down into the Buizel's gullet and vanished between the folds of his throat. The Eevee, Stella, Nox's best friend... She vanished for good, forever. Miles closed his mouth and took a few more quiet gulps as the bulge moved down his throat and dropped into his now sagging belly which he rubbed his paws over fondly, feeling the Eevee squirming uselessly inside him. She certainly wasn't getting free any time soon.

“Your friend was a tasty snack indeed, little Zorua,” Miles said as she smacked and licked his lips fondly, Stella's taste lingering in his maw. “I'm sure you will be too, for my friend here.”

“Wh... What?” Nox stuttered, still trying to process what was happening. Slowly she turned her head to look at the Quilava that had attacked her, finding him still looming over her but now licking his lips eagerly as well.

“Miles never told your friend and I guess it's too late now, but we love welcoming new students,” the Quilava said. “Your kind always taste so delicious, so fresh... That new student taste!” Miles and the Quilava broke out in laughter at that, Nox suddenly seeing her chance to get away while they were distracted!
14533212112222222112121112.title: Someone else attacks Nox first!

choices: Think I'll swallow you whole just like your friend was.
145332121122222221121211122.content:
Seeing her chance while the bullies were distracted with laughing, Nox suddenly leapt to her feet. Almost immediately the Buizel and Quilava's laughter stopped, but Nox was already frantically scrambling for the door. If she could just reach it...!

“Oh no you don't!” the Quilava yelled out behind Nox, and the next thing the Zorua knew she was tumbling head over heels as an intense heat seemed to envelop her entire body. She fell to the floor, stunned and in pain as her soft black fur was left singed and charred, her very nerves seeming to be on fire. Moaning she rolled over on to her back, looking up to find the Quilava standing there above her again, a look of anger, but also amusement on his face. “Did you think I was about to let my treat get away? That just wouldn't be fair now would it! Suppose I have to eat you now before you think up some other scheme, huh? Hmm, now how do I want to enjoy you...”
145332121122222221121211122.title: Try to escape, but fail...

1453321211222222211212111221.content:
The Quilava grinned as he leaned down, sticking his slimy tongue out and lapping it all over Nox's exposed chest and coating her fur in his drool. “Mmm, you just taste so good I can't help it, I wanna swallow you down whole, feel you squirm in my belly just as Miles is enjoying your Eevee friend now...”

“P... Please... Just let me go...” Nox whimpered, shutting her eyes tightly closed as she felt that tongue running through her fur.

“No can do, dear, I'm hungry now! Come on, let's get started...” With that, the Quilava bent down, behind Nox, spreading his mouth wide open just as his friend Miles had. Grabbing at the Zorua's hips he went for a different tactic than the Buizel, taking a few licks at the Zorua's bushy tail first before cramming it and her foot paws into his mouth. Nox whimpered and twitched her paws as she felt them covered in slimy drool, but then just one gulp and the tip of her tail and paws slipped into the Quilava's ravenous gullet. The Quilava got to work on pulling his tasty treat into his throat, swallowing her down, her tail and paws slipping into his gullet as Nox found her rear now sitting in the Quilava's maw.

Just a few licks from him later and Nox felt herself moving again as the Quilava took a gulp and her rear vanished into that gullet too, it working on dragging her down into the depths of the Quilava. As she felt him licking again at her chest, his teeth pricking against her skin but not harming it, she slowly opened her eyes once more and stared down her chest at him. Noticing this, the Quilava spread his maw open even wider, allowing Nox to see all the way down into his maw where her own body was vanishing into his gullet. She whimpered and cried as she was jerked down with another gulp, weakly pawing at her captor, trying to get him to stop without avail.

There truly was no stopping the Quilava, however. Another gulp and Nox was pulled down even farther, tears streaking down the Zorua's cheeks as she was swallowed up to her shoulders. She wiggled her rear paws and tail about in that tight, fleshy throat, the Quilava reaching up with a paw to feel at them from the outside, rubbing the bulge back. Then he swallowed again, Nox yelping as she soon found her head resting inside the Quilava's maw. “P... Please... Why... I just want to live...” she fearfully begged.

“Too bad,” the Buizel, Miles, said as he walked over, reaching a paw out and stroking the tuft of fur on Nox's exposed head. She couldn't see him though and grimaced at the touch. “You don't get to live it turns out. What a shame, but I'm sure Shrike here quite enjoys you... Seeya!”

With that final word, Shrike the Quilava took one more gulp, Nox letting out a scream as her entire head was tugged into that awaiting gullet, terror filling her heart as she found her body entirely contained within the fleshy prison. She felt Shrike and Miles pawing at the bulge she made from the outside as she whimpered silently, her quiet pleas and prayers unheard as she slipped deeper and deeper, vanished from the world and soon falling into the Quilava's waiting, anxious belly. Curling up into a ball Nox continued to cry and moan, miserable, alone, and soon to be dead... Making matters worse, she knew that Stella was no better, her best, indeed only friend meeting much the same fate.

Shrike licked his lips as he rubbed his belly, feeling the Zorua's squirms die down as she succumbed to digestion and her death. Underneath his prodding the stomach gave a gurgle, eager to get to work on breaking down the Zorua into little more than nutrients. Looking over at his partner, Shrike saw that Miles was doing much the same, rubbing over and admiring his own Eevee-stuffed belly.

“Come on, let's get out of here before anyone else comes in,” Shrike said. “There'll be more newbies in the future, plenty of time to finish digesting these ones now. I'm sure they won't be missed.”

“Heh, yeah, they were cuties though,” Miles shrugged. “Ah well, yeah, let's go.”

The two partners turned to the shadowed corner Shrike had surprised Nox from, pulling aside a loose portion of the wall tiles and entering their secret passage. It allowed them to get into the girl's bathroom, and indeed many other places in the school, without being seen. Best of all, no one else knew about it, and few who were as predatory as Shrike and Miles could even fit in it! Closing the wall up behind them, the Buizel and Quilava vanished without leaving a single trace as to where the new Zorua and Eevee had gone, not like anyone would even realize the newbies were missing or even there in the first place. Their only remainder now were Shrike and Miles' bulging, rounded bellies.
1453321211222222211212111221.title: Think I'll swallow you whole just like your...

choices: How about I tear you apart, make you regret running!
Got something new to try, say hi to my cock now!
1453321211222222211212111222.title: [More choices]

14533212112222222112121112221.content:
The Quilava snickered and grinned, his smile spreading wide as Nox looked up at him in fear. Something about that smile wasn't right... The Quilava leaned down, baring his teeth as he licked across Nox's furry chest. Wordlessly, he suddenly bit down into the Zorua's chest, Nox letting out a shrill scream. Blood leaked out around his fangs as he slightly tore at her flesh before pulling back and licking at the wound, lapping up the blood and making it sting to Nox.

“I think, I want to taste some blood now...” the Quilava whispered. “You got me angry, and I have this thirst when I'm angry... Sorry dear, I won't lie, this will hurt. A lot.”

Nox's eyes went wide as he said that, she shaking in fear. Instead of biting into her chest again, however, the Quilava glanced to her paws laid sprawled out on the floor. Smiling, he bent down to one of her front paws, licking at it even as she tried to pull away from him. Quickly he closed his mouth around the entire paw, sucking on it and causing Nox to wince in disgust. The disgust soon turned to pain, however, as she suddenly felt the Quilava's fangs plunge down and into her arm. The fangs bit deep into her flesh, some blood spurting out around the fangs and both into the Quilava's mouth and on to the floor.

Nox screamed in pain as the Quilava bit down on her arm, only causing him to bite harder and harder, her screams growing ever louder. Then she heard the crunch of bone snapping, felt the Quilava tugging and pulling, flesh tearing and ripping, until finally it all just stopped. She no longer felt anything except a dull, throbbing, searing pain where she knew her arm was. Or at least, used to be. Tears dripped from her eyes as Nox rolled her head over only to see the Quilava standing there above her, her own limb paw held in his bloody jaws.

Miles couldn't help but snicker as he observed this scene, looking at the Zorua lying on the floor with blood pooling around her, her normally dark fur going pale. His Quilava partner stood over her with the limp paw in his jaws, though soon that paw disappeared as he tossed it into his mouth and chewed it up, the sickening sound of crunches filling the bathroom as the bone shattered and blood dribbled from his chin. Then he tilted his head back and swallowed, the entire paw, bone and all, slipping down into his stomach. The Zorua gasped and whimpered as she laid there withing in pain, now permanently crippled from the loss of a paw. The Quilava stood over her, baring his blood-stained fangs, eager for more.

The Quilava leaned down and began to lick at the stub where Nox's paw used to be, the Zorua whining and crying at the searing stings. Then he raised a paw, extended his claws, and teasingly raked them across Nox's exposed chest as he drew lines of blood through her fur. She whimpered and yelped, but the Quilava merely shushed in response. Leaning down over her head, he grabbed one of her ears in his mouth and again bit down hard, pulling and tugging and yanking until the ear was torn right off. He immediately spat it out to the side though, mutilating the Zorua for little more than his own sick amusement.

Blood dripped from the Quilava's fangs and chin as he leaned down over the Zorua, the crimson liquid dripping down onto the pale fur of the Zorua as more blood pooled out of her wounds. She whimpered and squirmed weakly, quickly losing any strength to fight as blood drained from her body. The Quilava stuck his tongue out again and once more licked at her bloody fur, distracting her just as he abruptly slammed a paw down on her bushy tail. He dug his claws into the core of the tail as it twitched under his touch before wrapping his paw around it. At the same time as he pulled with his paw, he bent down and bit hard into the tail's base, tearing savagely and ripping at flesh and fur, a crack and tear sounding as he managed to rip Nox's tail straight off. Again he tossed the limp clump of blood-stained fur and cartilage to the side as the Zorua sniffled sadly. The Quilava rather enjoyed torturing her like this.

He was getting hungry though and bent down to nudge at the foot paw on the same side of the Zorua as the paw he had torn off earlier. It recoiled slightly, but Nox was simply too weak now to do much of anything as the Quilava again opened his mouth and locked it closed around the paw. Some tearing and crunching later and Nox found herself down yet another paw, blood spurting out over the Quilava's face as he held the limp, severed paw up tauntingly over Nox before shoving it into his maw. He leaned down next to her remaining ear and began to chew up the paw, crunching the bone between his powerful, sharp fangs and ripping apart the still warm, fresh meat. Then he gulped the bloody mess down, Nox forced to hear every gulp and swallow as her second paw disappeared down the sadistic Quilava's gullet.

Then he did it again. Tearing off her third paw, chewing it up and gulping it down. Then, finally, one last time. He tore off Nox's last remaining paw, the bone snapping apart with a devastating crunch as it was forced from her body, her flesh tearing and ripping, so much blood leaking out of her now that there was little that could be done for the poor Zorua even were the Quilava to be stopped. As her fourth and final paw succumbed to the Quilava's fangs and gullet Nox was left a crippled stub, only able to faintly squirm without any paws or even her tail to move. The Zorua was simply a bloody mess now, broken bones and ragged flesh replacing all her limbs. She could barely even cry, her entire body numb from the pain. She felt faint, the world going fuzzy, her heart slowing down... She quietly whimpered, unable to even speak as she stared up at the Quilava standing over her, his own fur splattered with Nox's blood as he stared back down at her with those piercing, remorseless red eyes.
14533212112222222112121112221.title: How about I tear you apart, make you regret run...

145332121122222221121211122211.content:
Then the Quilava plunged his head down and sank his fangs into Nox's fleshy, furry chest. He knew that his prey wouldn't last much longer and the meat was always best when it was fresh, of course. Savagely, no longer caring for extending her pain, he ripped and bit, tearing open the Zorua's chest. Blood sprayed up in his face as he gulped down chunks of meat and flesh before his jaws closed around her ribs. With unbelievable strength he bit right through the ribs, the bones shattering between his jaws as he easily snapped them apart, tearing a hole straight into the dying Zorua's chest. She yelped and gasped as he went on at this, faintly watching as the Quilava eagerly stuck his muzzle down into that that hole, pulling his head back out with a bundle of her own guts in his jaws.

The Quilava tore and yanked at the guts, jerking Nox's body about as he gulped them down whole. Eventually he bit right through them, cutting them off and swallowing what he still held in his jaws before diving back into Nox's chest. He tore at her internal organs, ravaging them as he feasted upon her fresh, bloody meat, only quickening Nox's loss of blood and life. When next he pulled his head out of that bloody hole, Nox could only watch as he literally tore her own heart free, clutching the still slowly beating muscle in his jaws before he bit dawn hard, chewing her heart up into an unidentifiable mess of meat and blood he eagerly swallowed. As she watched the Quilava slowly gulp her own heart down into his belly the entire world finally went dark, Nox breathing her last breath as the broken, savaged Zorua finally died, passing on from the world.

The Buizel, Miles, sighed as he looked over the scene as the Quilava feasted some more on the Zorua's corpse. She was dead now, but the meat would at least still be warm and fresh for a little while still. The bathroom, and Miles' partner, were in rather terrible shape though. Blood covered most of the floor and was even splattered on the walls, all centered on the Zorua's pale, desecrated corpse. The Quilava himself was little better, Nox's blood covering almost every strand of his own fur over his face and belly, especially around his muzzle.

“Shrike,” Miles finally spoke up as he watched his friend eagerly digging into the corpse, tearing off chunks of meat around her now quite exposed, and quite broken, ribcage. The Quilava either ignored him or didn't hear Miles at first, continuing to feast and lick those bones clean. “Shrike!” Miles said again, louder and angrier now, this time finally getting his partner's attention as the Quilava turned to look at him, blood and gore dripping off his chin to the ground below.

“You went a little overboard there,” Miles pointed out as he rested a paw on his swollen belly, feeling the remnants of the now also dead Eevee slosh around within him. “Do you plan to clean this mess up, somehow?”

“Should we?” Shrike shrugged, giving the Zorua's corpse a light kick, its lifeless and still mostly intact head flopping to the side. “I say leave it, will give the students plenty to talk about.”

“Whatever...” Miles sighed. “Have you had enough yet? I'm getting nervous that someone else will come.”

“Yeah, sure.” Shrike reached up to his teeth with a claw, working on picking out some gore that had managed to wedge itself in there. Flicking it to the side, he walked closer to the Buizel and closed his eyes, begrudgingly saying,”Go ahead, blast me...”

“With pleasure.” With that approval, the Buizel let loose a stream of water from his mouth, the Quilava wincing as it hit him full force. Miles washed Shrike off as quickly as he could, the watered down blood trailing along the floor towards a drain. Finally, the Quilava was left completely soaked but at least clean, he shivering as he shook out his fur as best he could.
