If you give me your name I'll give you your schedule and you can be on your way." Mag gave his name and the clerk gave him his schedule and a map of the school.
As he steped out Mag decided to...
1453321221.title: Hot headed

choices: He is stopped after class is out.
14533221.content:
The rather small, shy, Quilava entered the class at the last second before the bell. Being new to this school, he dosn't know his way around to well and the fact that this is one of the biggest pokemon schools around dosn't help neather. Even after being here for over two weeks he still takes wrong turns while navigating the hallways, uselly ending up in another class or even another hallway he never knew exsisted. He was rather small for his species and most of the other student's towered over him, which also ment he was always alart, making sure not to get stepped on while getting to his classes.

The Quilava slid the small bag he had on his back onto the ground under his desk and sat at his desk with his back feet in his chair ( almost on his toe's) and his front legs on his desk to see. Just like any other day, he just sat there not paying attintion, just like all the other student's in the class. The only thing he liked about this class other than it being so easy, was the the cute female buizel that sat three disks ahead of him. He didn't care if she was a little bigger than him, or the fact that she has a major type advantge against him, for he was love struck the first day he came into this class. What he dosn't no is that she fells the same way towards him.
14533221.title: Male Quilava

choices: The Quilava freezes in fear as he comes face to face with an Arboc!
The Quilava quickly heads of to his next period.
145332211.content:
The bell rings. He quickly left the class in order to get to his locker and to his next class on time, seeing that he well probably make a few wrong turns onn the way there. He dodged through the crowed of pokemon, dashing between there legs and avoiding there massive paws as they hit the ground, sending what seems like small tremors to him, across the floor. He finally gets to his locker, where he proceed's to get what ever supplies he needs for his next class. After the Quilava gets all the supplies he needs, he takes off towards his next class, once again avoiding the steps of all the larger student's who were just carelessly walking through the halls.

The Quilava looks at the clock on the hall wall and sees that he has a little time to spare. He heads of towards the bathroom to take a quick restroom break before class starts. He sets his bag to the side near the door and goes to one of the small stalls which inside, had a small patch of grass that the non-bipedeal pokemon used. He wuickly shuts the door and goes about with his buisness. The little Quilava's ears twitched as he heard the bathroom door open. He didn't think much of it as he finished up and opened the stall door.
145332211.title: The bell rings.

1453322111.content:
Quilava glanced around as he stepped out of the stall. He didn't see anyone. Assuming that the sound of the door had simply been his imagination or some other Pokémon using the restroom, he picked up his bag and began walking to the door.

“Well well, what do we have here?”

The voice came from behind the Quilava. Hesitantly he turned around, only to see that one of the stall doors had been thrown open. Slithering out from inside it was a large snake, its body easily twice as thick as Quilava himself. The snake's body seemed to never end as it slid across the floor over to where Quilava stood, the much smaller Pokémon taking a few nervous steps backwards. Purple scales glinted in the light as the Pokemon raised the front portion of its body up off the ground, a pink tongue flicking in and out of its mouth to taste the air. Suddenly, loose folds around its neck flared out in a hood, exposing sinister eye-like patterns that literally paralyzed Quilava with fear.

“What'sss the matter?” the Arbok hissed, his face twisting into a sly grin.

“I... I just want to... To go to class...” Quilava stammered, his eyes fixated on the Arbok's read and yellow eye patterns. He was barely aware as the snake Pokémon' tail wrapped around his body, flicking away his book bag before binding his legs together.

“But then we have a conflict of interestsss...” Arbok slid closer to where Quilava stood, the snake's tail that bound the small Pokemon's legs preventing him from moving. Not as if he could anyway. Wracked with fear under the Arbok's sinister glare, Quilava could only shiver as the large Pokémon approached...
1453322111.title: The Quilava freezes in fear as he comes face to...

14533221112.content:
Slowly, Quilava became aware that the Arbok had him under a glare-induced paralysis. He tried to struggle, to break the snake's hold over him, but the Arbok proves too strong. All Quilava could do was look up, watching as the Arbok slithered closer.

“Thisss ssschool, it isss full of vermin,” Arbok hissed. “Vermin sssuch as you. Your kind are but food, and you are now my sssnack...”

Quilava could feel Arbok's tail wrapping around more of his body, the powerful coils pressing his arms against his chest and leaving him completely helpless, as if the paralysis wasn't enough. He tried to scream for help, but Quilava found himself wordless under the terrifying gaze of the Arbok. All he could hope for was that someone would happen upon the scene by chance.
14533221112.title: Fail to resist.

choices: Arbok decides to toy with Quilava first.
145332211121.content:
Unfortunately, a miracle did not happen. The bathroom door stayed closed, and as Quilava felt Arbok's coils tighten around his body hope began to dwindle. His head hovering right over Quilava's, drool dripped down from Arbok's mouth as his tongue flicked at the air some more. He could taste the fear of his prey, the scent making him all the more hungry.

Quilava didn't exactly share the same opinion, however, wincing as the Arbok's drool fell across his head and wet his fur. Tears slid from the corners of his eyes as he folded his ears back against his head. This was horrible. He had heard of all the cases of small Pokémon disappearing around the school, but this... He had never imagined this would happen to him. Shutting his eyes tightly, Quilava wished that Arbok would just end this all soon.
145332211121.title: No one comes...

choices: Arbok happens to be feeling a little horny...
1453322111212.content: Arbok suddenly pauses. He was hungry, yes, but here he was with the small Quilava at his mercy. He could go ahead and eat him quickly, but then again he could also have a little fun. But how?
1453322111212.title: Arbok decides to toy with Quilava first.

14533221112121.content:
The snake Pokémon snickers as he begins to tighten the coils around his prey's body. Already immobilized, the small Quilava was hopeless to resist as he felt the loops of snake constrict around him. At first it was merely a mild discomfort, but as Arbok tightened his grip discomfort turned to subtle pain. Noticing that the paralysis was starting to wear off, Quilava tried to struggle but to no avail. All he could do was yelp in pain as Arbok's body tightened ever more around him.

Over his yelps and whimpers, Quilava could hear some odd creaks. In horror he realized that they were his own bones, threatening to give out. If Arbok kept this up it was likely something would break. Dropping his head, Quilava sobbed and wondered why the snake couldn't just end this already.
14533221112121.title: Arbok constricts Quilava harder.

choices: Arbok has his tasty Quilava snack.
145332211121211.content:
Arbok frowned as he heard Quilava's bones creak. There was a time and a place for breaking a Pokémon before eating it, and this really wasn't one of them. There was too much pleasure to be had from simply eating a live, squirming Pokémon that it would be a waste to hurt the Quilava more.

Arbok let up slightly on the pressure, although still kept the Quilava constricted enough that he couldn't move. The paralysis seemed to be wearing off, which was good as it meant the Quilava could struggle all the way down, but at the same time bad as it meant he could escape. Arbok didn't want to take any chances there. The Quilava escaping would mean both the loss of a meal as well as the staff of the school finding out about his little habit. If he was expelled, how would he find such easy snacks?

Leaning down over the squirming Quilava, Arbok popped his jaws open, spreading his mouth apart as wide as he could. Quilava squealed in terror as he stared up straight into Arbok's waiting throat, drool dripping down onto the small weasel as the snake salivated in eager anticipation.
145332211121211.title: Arbok decides that's enough.

1453322111212111.content:
Quilava closed his eyes and whimpered as the snake lowered its head down over Quilava. Instantly a wave of heat hit the small Pokémon, followed by a near gag-inducing stench. It was too much to hope that Arbok would decide against this at the last moment, though, and soon enough Quilava found his head pressing up against Arbok's gullet. It was already near large enough to accommodate the small Pokémon, only needing to expand slightly as the tight flesh rolled over Quilava's head.

The feeling was unlike anything Quilava had experienced before. On one hand, the soft, moist flesh was almost pleasurable. On the other... He was being ingested by a large Arbok. This wasn't exactly Quilava's idea of fun. Any comfort derived from the experience was instantly overridden by the horror of the situation. Quilava tried screaming for help now that he could talk again, but his voice was muffled by the Arbok's thick body. Resorting to struggling, he tried to kick and punch his way free. Unfortunately what few hits he managed to land did little to dissuade Arbok.

Arbok was almost amused by Quilava's efforts, but they had to come to an end. As he began to uncoil himself from around the Quilava he took a large gulp and felt the small Pokémon begin its journey down through his body. Forcibly pulled into the Arbok's maw, Quilava's arms tried to grab on to something with little success. The powerful force of Arbok's swallows overpowered Quilava's meager grip on the corner of the snake's jaw, the paws disappearing into the throat alongside Quilava's upper chest.

The weasel Pokémon couldn't help but cry as he felt his arms bound against his chest by the tube of flesh. Trying to move them resulted in little success, certainly not anything that could free him. With just his rear hanging out of Arbok's mouth now, Quilava's hopes were quickly drifting away.
1453322111212111.title: Arbok has his tasty Quilava snack.

choices: This is one fast digesting Arbok!
14533221112121111.content:
Arbok smiled around his meal as he basked in the taste and feeling of it. He could feel Quilava pressing against his body from the inside out, the Pokémon's legs kicking about as they stuck out of his mouth. This was one of his favorite parts of the experience, but it had to come to an end.

Arbok threw his head back, spreading his mouth wide and taking one strong gulp. Inside his body, Quilava screamed as he felt the throat muscles pull him strongly down, his rear and legs quickly engulfed by Arbok's throat. Snapping his jaws shut, Arbok completely sealed Quilava off from the rest of the world, forever. The small weasel Pokémon now rested completely in his throat.

Quilava's eyes were wide with terror as he yelled and screamed stronger than he ever had before. The feeling of being completely enveloped by the fleshy folds of Arbok's throat sent him into a panic, but nothing he could do would affect the outcome now. He was as good as dead, reduced to live food for the Arbok.

The large snake slid over to a mirror on the wall, admiring the small bulge the Quilava made as it traveled on its path downward. He could see the bulge squirming some, sighing in pleasure. There was nothing quite like the feeling of having another Pokémon inside you, squirming about hopelessly.

Quilava slowly began to fall still as he gave in to the situation. Nothing he could do now mattered, there was no point in even trying. Horror and fright turning to acceptance, Quilava soon felt his head push through a tight opening into a somewhat more spacious place, the rest of his body soon following. Quilava found himself in the Arbok's stomach, the slightly looser flesh still completely surrounding him with no hope of escape. Still, he managed to roll onto his back, panting as he pawed at the “ceiling” of the stomach. It was almost surreal, being trapped inside the Arbok like this.

The Quilava's breaths grew shorter as he realized the air in the stomach was running out, and he knew that before long he would be dead either from asphyxiation or digestion. Not like either way mattered to him now, the paw he had been prodding his fleshy prison with dropping back down to his side. His life was over, the only question remaining being just how painful his end would be.
14533221112121111.title: Arbok finishes his meal.

choices: Continue as Arbok in his plot to eat the Buizel.
I refuse to do that!  That's sick!
145332211121211111.content:
As Quilava expected, digestion took a while. While he could feel some juices tingling at his back, they didn't amount to much. It would probably take Arbok hours to digest him, but he probably only had around a minute of air left to breathe.

Quilava's lungs began to burn from the thinning air. With nothing left to do now, Quilava closed his eyes and dropped limp. He had never quite believed it would happen, but sure enough images of his life began flashing through his mind. He saw his parents standing over him when he was still just a Cyndaquil, proud of every meager, childish accomplishment he made.

He saw the day he evolved, right in the middle of a class. It surprised everyone, especially himself. He could remember his first few seconds as a Quilava, learning to understand his new form. He also remembered the other kids making fun of him for how small he was, mocking him by saying he had actually shrunk. It wasn't true, but he hadn't grown much either. He remembered the teacher rushing him to the principal's office where he was sent home for the day. Again his parents were proud.

He remembered the day he had first been accepted into this new school. He was so excited, eager to learn more about battling than his old grade school could teach. The warnings from the staff about the disappearances of Pokémon were meaningless to him, all he cared about was the exciting possibilities. Maybe he should have paid more attention back then...

Then, he remembered the first time he saw this one particular female Buizel. She was in his class, and the moment he set eyes on her he knew he was in love. He was so shy though that he couldn't say anything, but swore he'd say something the next day. He kept on putting it off though, never finding the courage to say a word to her. Now he was going to die, and she would never know how he felt for her.

Tears streamed down Quilava's cheeks as he began coughing. He tried to breathe but his lungs were greeted by nothing in return. Feeling his body seizing up from the lack of oxygen, Quilava's mind slowly began to drift away into unconsciousness. Just before he passed out, the last thought that crossed his mind was if that Buizel would notice he was gone.

By now, Arbok had left the bathroom and was slithering down the hallways of the school. Aware that the Quilava would have died in some manner by now, he paused for a moment and glanced at the small lump in his body. Then noticing he was outside a classroom, he glanced through the window in the door at the students inside. Most looked like they could make excellent meals, but one Buizel in particular caught his eye. He just knew he had to eat her sometime, but not now. Traps take time to set...
145332211121211111.title: Asphyxiation gets to Quilava first.

1453322111212111112.content:
Well fine. Be like that. You know what? You're dead. Yep, you're dead. You just suffocated in the stomach of an Arbok and he's about to go eat your would-be girlfriend. Not taking that path won't mean it doesn't happen, you know.

...Oh look, there's the Buizel now. But you know what? You are dead, and this story is now over.
1453322111212111112.title: I refuse to do that!  That's sick!

145332211121211112.content:
Quilava was in for quite a surprise. While it was true that in most cases digestion took a few hours at least, Arbok was one of those Pokémon who could begin and finish the process much faster than most.

Quilava began to twitch nervously as he felt the Arbok's digestive fluids rising up around him. Still thinking that it would at least take a while for the acids to actually do their job, he quickly realized how wrong he was when his back began to burn. It felt like it was on fire, Quilava reaching behind him to feel what was happening.

Yelping in surprise, Quilava realized that the fur and flesh on his back was literally starting to liquefy. Panic again overtook Quilava as he began to thrash about, all the while struggling to keep his head above the rising liquid. The burning sensation spread from his back to all over his body, fur falling out in clumps and flesh liquefying into a disgusting mixture with the acid. Gasping in pain, Quilava could feel muscles now burning in spots where his flesh had completely disappeared, blood streaming into the vile mix of liquid that he now lay in.

As his muscles fell prey to the process of digestion, Quilava found himself unable to move or keep himself above the burning juices anymore. Wracked with pain, Quilava screamed as his head plunged into the liquid which instantly began work on digesting his head. His eyes literally melted out of their sockets in just a few seconds, leaving Quilava sightless—not like he had been able to see anything in the complete darkness of the stomach anyway. With the eyes gone, digestive juices flooded through their sockets and into Quilava's skull at the same time as holes burned through muscles allowed passage into his chest.

His body now being attacked essentially from everywhere at once, even from the inside out, Quilava knew he had little time left to live. With his brain itself melting away from the onslaught of gastric juice, Quilava was unable to even think for his last few moments of life, all of his sensations flickering away one by one as the acids ate through his brain. When he finally truly died, he wasn't even aware he had been alive to begin with.

The digestive acids continued their onslaught even after their victim had passed away, unrelenting in their quest to reduce the Pokémon to a nourishing soup of melted flesh, meat, and blood. Stripping away Quilava's skeleton of every ounce of nourishment, all that remained of the Pokémon now were his bleached bones. In a few hours Arbok would probably cough those up as they sometimes took days to digest and passing them out the normal way if they were taking too long was rather painful. Maybe he'd leave them someplace for the school staff to find, or terrorize the younger students with them. He'd decide that later. For now, Arbok was just glad that he had finally had such a nice meal.
145332211121211112.title: This is one fast digesting Arbok!

choices: Arbok finally moves on with his meal.
Arbok still isn't done with his fun.
145332211121212.content:
Snickers turned to sadistic laughter as Arbok kept up with the increasing pressure. He could see that the paralysis of his prey was almost completely gone now as the Quilava thrashed his head about, and he could feel some minor squirms from the Quilava's trapped body. Arbok could fix that.

Quilava's cries of pain turned to screams as Arbok squeezed even tighter, exerting pressure beyond what the weasel Pokémon had even thought possible. It felt like he was literally going to pop like a balloon, and sure enough it wasn't long until his body started to give out; a loud crack signaled the breakage of something. Quilava's screams intensified as he realized he could no longer feel his arms, but the Arbok didn't care. This was too fun for him, the pleasure the snake received from his pitiful prey almost as good as the final meal will be.

Another crack and Quilava's legs went motionless, the weak struggles stopping all together as Quilava was left crippled. His throat sore from screaming, all Quilava could manage was to pant and weakly whimper, uttering a few pleas for mercy that fell on deaf ears. Quilava couldn't help but wonder though if at this point it would just be better to die than be left a cripple for the rest of his life.
145332211121212.title: Arbok's not quite done yet.

choices: Oh who am I kidding; crush that weasel to death!
1453322111212122.content:
Sadism had fully overtaken Arbok by now. Laughter turned to sequels of glee, the snake's eyes shining with a sadistic light. Yes, he wanted to eat the Quilava, eventually; he was certainly hungry enough. But this! He hadn't enjoyed playing around with his prey this much in ages!

“More!” Arbok screamed as he ramped up the pressure, squeezing Quilava literally as hard as he could manage. “Harder! Harder! Haha!”

Quilava's pleas and whimpers turned to mere squeaks as he found himself unable to even breathe. The thrashing of his head stilling, he panted as he heard more cracks and pops signaling further breakage of his body. He wasn't even sure what breaking now, just that before long it wouldn't be the Arbok eating him he'd have to worry about. A loud series of cracks and Quilava felt his chest seemingly cave in, his ribcage fracturing into hundreds pieces. Without the support of his ribs Quilava could feel his organs begin to shift under the pressure. Suddenly gagging, he coughed up some blood from one of probably numerous internal ruptures, the red liquid splattering over Arbok's brilliantly purple scales.

This finally elicited a reaction from the snake, who frowned at the blood. Perhaps it was finally time to just finish this meal. There would always be other Pokémon to play with, after all.
1453322111212122.title: Arbok still isn't done with his fun.

14533221112121222.content:
Oh who was Arbok kidding, it's not like he couldn't eat the Quilava even after he was dead. Laughing manically, Arbok yelled out, “Thisss isss too fun to ssstop!”

Realizing that Arbok had no intention of letting him go, or even finishing him off in the manner he had originally expected, Quilava simply gave up. It was hopeless now. He tried to close his eyes so he couldn't see anything else, but found that oddly enough he couldn't. It took him a moment to realize that Arbok was squeezing him so tightly now that his eyes were literally bulging from their sockets, his eyelids unable to slide down over them like this. Forced to stare up at his murderer, Quilava gagged on some more blood which he barely managed to force up.

With most bones in his body broken, Quilava couldn't actually feel much of what was happening. Still, he recognized that by this point there was nothing to protect his vital innards from the pressure. Organs began to rupture and tear, Quilava's insides now a completely unrecoverable mess. If he hadn't already lost control of his eyes, they would have gone wide when Quilava literally felt his lungs break free of his trachea before being smashed into a meaty pulp. Only a moment after and Quilava suddenly realized he could no longer feel his heartbeat, the vital muscle reduced to a sticky red paste.

Quilava's life quickly fading away, the last thing he saw was the Arbok finally spreading his mouth wide, preparing to take in what would no longer be a live meal.
14533221112121222.title: Oh who am I kidding; crush that weasel to death!

145332211121212221.content:
Arbok let out a sad hiss as he saw Quilava finally give in, the small weasel Pokémon's head falling limp and lifeless. He had been expecting a live meal when this all started but at least it would still be warm if he was quick. Finally releasing the coils around the corpse, Arbok would have whistled if a snake was possible of such an action when he saw just how messed up Quilava's body was. Its flesh had been torn in places from the pressure and lack of internal support, most noticeably the chest. Through the hole there Arbok could see a chunky red paste composed of a mixture of blood and the remains of Quilava's vital organs. Sickening stuff to some he was sure, but it didn't bother him.

With the lack of bones holding the body together, Quilava's corpse flopped about oddly as Arbok bend down and grabbed the still relatively intact head in his mouth. This made devouring the carcass a rather different experience, but eventually Arbok managed to use his tail to push enough of it into his mouth that his throat muscles caught on to the dead Quilava's head. From there, all Arbok had to do was slide forward some as his throat worked on ingesting the lifeless body. Without struggles Arbok found the meal sort of lacking, but he supposed that the constriction leading up to it had been enjoyable enough.

With one last toss of Arbok's head, Quilava's dead and broken feet slipped into his maw only to soon be devoured by his gullet. For a moment Arbok basked in the feeling of the corpse making its way to his stomach, but again it wasn't quite as fulfilling as he had hoped when starting out. Oh well, that's what he got for killing it first.

Looking around at the floor and himself, Arbok saw that a fair bit of blood was smeared about the bathroom. Quickly slithering into a shower he washed off the blood on him but didn't bother with what was on the floor. Moving around it, Arbok pushed the door open and slithered out into the halls of the school. Some passing Pokémon would probably notice the bulge in his stomach, but even so most Pokémon would be too scared of him to tell the staff.

Slithering off down the hall, Arbok smiled as he thought about what to do next.
145332211121212221.title: Finally!

1453322111212122212.content:
Okay, you're still the Quilava. Great, you're a lifeless carcass slowly digesting in the stomach of a sadistic Arbok. Oh poor Quilava! We didn't even get to learn your name or backstory or any sort of character! Alas, poor nameless Quilava! We didn't know you well.

Needless to say, you are dead.
1453322111212122212.title: Don't

choices: The lucario he was talking about: Henry
145332211122.content:
When the door swung open Quilva felt his heart soar. his prayers had been answered. He didn't care who it was, he just knew he would be in debt to the pokemon. As soon as he heard it speak

"Hey. Put him down! We arn't allowed to eat other students!" It shouted. Quilva couldn't see it but he knew who the pokemon was, or at least he thought he knew. he had only spoken to him once or twice. Quila had caught him eyeing him a time or two. Oddly Quila hoped it was him. He could vaugly remember his name, he knew it started with a "H."
Henry? Harvey? He couldn't remember, but he knew it was a lucario. Before Quila knew it he was broken free from the Arbok's trance, and coils. The arbok lay on the florr passed out. When he turned around he saw the bright light shining around the pokemon that had saved his life. It had turned out to be. . .
145332211122.title: The shining light.

choices: He sets by the cute buizel.
The cute buizel comes to him!
1453322112.content:
The Quilava quickly slid his backpack on and took off out the door not even looking to see who entered the bathroom. He ran through the hallway which was now suprisingly empty compaired to what it was like earlyer, which means the bell was about to ring. He quickly ran thought the hall towards his class which was now in sight. As soon as he ran through the class entrance the bell rang, unfortunitly for him he couldn't stop himself and his own momentum caused him to run head first into the teachers desk. He could hear the classmates laughting under their breath about his stupid mistake, as he shook the stars from his head. He looked up at the teacher with a pitifull look on his face, kind of like the one you would see on a puppy after it was caught in the act of doing something it was not suposed to do. The teacher who was a female lucario just sighed and looked at him with a exprision of hoplessness, she then told him to get to his seat so they can begin class. The Quilava still, red with embarassment, walked to the back of the class, trying hard to ignore the chuckles coming from the student's around him. He quickly took a seat.

As useul, the Quilava just sat there and watched as the clock ticked away, watching the small hand get closer and closer to the 12. Soon his moment of relief came as the bell sounded, dismissing the student's from the class. This was his favorite time of the day. After navigating through the halls of this ridiculesly huge school for about for about 10min, he arrived to his favorite room in the school, the cafeteria. He waited in line to get food for about 12 minutes before before finally getting his useul. He started to head to the same spot he always sat at until he saw the cute buizal that sat three desk ahead of him in third period. He thought about going over and setting beside her, but he was abnormaly shy and had a hard time thinking of what to say, and the fact that he likes her just makes it harder.
1453322112.title: The Quilava quickly heads of to his next period.

14533221122.content:
The Quilava's heart rushed as the Buizel turned her head and looked directly at him. He quickly turned his head in embarrasment for getting caught stairing. The Quilava's started to beat faster as he saw the Buizel get up and start to walk in his direction. Beads of sweat started to form around his fore head and the lunch try he was carrying in his mouth seemed to get heavier as she got closer.

"Hello"

The Quilava who was now blushing terribly, turned around to see the Buizel, smiling and waveing her hand side to side as a gesture of hello. He couldn't beleive she was talking to him.He thought that the Buizel thought he was just another student, a knowbody, but the fact that she came up to him just to say hello proved that he was not a knowbody to her.

The Quilava felt weak at the knees and started to buckle.

"Are you okay?" The Buizel asked.

Her voice to him was like angle singing. His sweating became more noticeable, but the Buizel didn't need to see sweat to know he was nervious in the first place.

"Her let me get that for you." She said as she gentily took the tray he was holding in his mouth and held it for him.

"What is your name?" The Buizel asked as she started walking to a near by table.

Thou it was a simple question, It felt more like the million dollar question from a game show.

"fu...fli...Flint." The Quilava said with a horrible stutter.

The Buizel just chuckled.

"Your cute... My name is Serene" She said staring into his eye's.

Flint begain to blush twice as hard as the word "Your cute" rang throught his head.

"Come on you can set beside me." Serene said as she set Flint's tray on the table and scooted over, makeing room for him.

145332211221.content:
Things were going well for Flint. In the two weeks that had passed since Serene first talked to him, their relationship had gradually strengthened. While he was still shy and nervous to speak to her, with every day his courage grew stronger. Walking into school that day two weeks later, Flint knew what he had to do.

He waited until both the two of them were walking to the cafeteria for lunch. As he padded along beside her, he glanced over and smiled at Serene, noticing that she was wearing a cute pink ribbon tied into a bow on her head. When she smiled back, Flint stopped walking and stood up on his hind legs, scratching the back of his neck nervously.

Serene stopped as well, standing up and putting a paw on one of the small Quilava's shoulders. “Something up?” she asked.

Flint's eyes went wide at the touch. “N... No...” he stuttered. “I, I just... I was thinking we could go eat outside today...”

“Sure!” Serene smiled. “It's a nice day! Come on, let's go get some food first.”

“Actually...” Flint said, trying to keep his voice strong. “I... I brought something from home today... For both of us...”

“Aw, how nice of you.” Serene patted Flint's shoulder some before turning around, nodding her head in the direction of a door that led outside. “Well, you lead the way.”

“O... Okay...” Flint muttered, standing up to push the button that opened the door before hurrying through it, Serene following. Outside the sun was shining with few clouds in the sky, a slight breeze sending tree branches and bushes swaying. There was a certain spot Flint had found the other day: a small semicircular clearing surrounded by bushes and filled with small flowering plants. Nervously he lead Serene to it, the Buizel gasping as she saw the flowers.

“It's lovely...” she muttered, walking over to one of the flowers and sniffing at it. “Did you find this?” she asked, turning to Flint and smiling.

“Yeah...” the Quilava muttered as he walked over next to Serene, dropping his backpack off and into the grass. Pulling the bag open, he pulled out the small lunchbox he had been carrying around in it and set it on the ground, unclasping it and flipping the top open. “Here...” he said as he handed Serene a small sandwich and a handful of berries. He had been worrying the whole day that it would all end up squished together, but fortunately everything was still intact.

“Thank you!” Serene said sincerely as she sat down and popped one of the berries in her mouth. “These are good!” she exclaimed, Flint's eyes widening at the sign of approval.

“My mom grows them,” he said as he looked over his own sandwich. “Oh, I forgot to bring anything to drink...”

“Don't worry about it, I'm not thirsty,” Serene said as she continued eating. Flint, however, merely stared at his food without touching it. Butterflies seemed to be stirring around in his stomach as he struggled with how to say what he had been in his mind now for weeks.

Serene noticed Flint's odd behavior and stopped eating as well. “Now is something wrong?”

“Do you like it?” Serene asked, concerned about how the fire-type would feel about so much water.

“It's beautiful...” Flint muttered. Hesitantly he stuck a paw out and dipped it in the water, quickly withdrawing it and watching the water drip off his cream-colored fur. “Just... Don't expect me to swim.”

“Well, about that...” Serene smiled slyly, walking over to the water's edge next to Flint. Holding out a paw, she pointed to a small island visible off on the horizon. “You see that island? I was thinking we could go over there, stay for the evening...”

Every step made him wince and shiver, but he forced himself through it until he was close enough to the floating Buizel that he could pull himself up on to her back.

“Okay, hold on tight,” Serene said. She didn't really need to say it though, Flint having already wrapped his arms tightly around her neck. Before the Quilava could change his mind Serene set off, using her tail like a propeller to push her sleek body through the water and the fins on her arms to help steer.

Flint closed his eyes tightly, dropping his head down and burying it into Serene's floatation ring like it was a pillow. He didn't want to think about what he was doing, much less look at at the water that completely surrounded him, threatening to swallow him up if something were to happen and he fell off Serene. All he could hope was that the ride would go smoothly and be over soon.

14533221122112121.content:
“We're here.”

Flint slowly opened his eyes again as he felt Serene's paws touch against the sandy shore. Still clinging to Serene's back as she walked through the water, up the beach, Flint almost sleepily looked at the island before him. A single large rock rose up in the middle of the island, its top unseen from below and thus Flint couldn't tell if it was flat, rounded, indented, or so on. Around the large rock several trees grew, with a spacious beech separating the trees from the lake.

Serene suddenly shook her body, Flint yelping as he lost his grip and slipped off the Buizel's back. He moaned as he found himself laying on his back in merely a few inches of water, but as soon as he regained his senses he quickly scrambled to his feet and ran on to the dry beech. Serene laughed as she walked over next to him, continuing to shake her fur out and send water flying in all directions, including straight at Flint. The Quilava whimpered and flinched as the water droplets hit him, the short, course fur on his back already soaking wet.

“Come on, it's only water. It won't kill you,” Serene smiled, patting Flint's back with a wet paw.

“So you say...” the fire-type muttered. He was starting to realize that it may have been a bad idea to fall in love with a water-type of all Pokémon, but it wasn't as if he had a choice in the matter. “I need to dry off...”

“We can rest here some, if you want,” Serene shrugged.

Flint stood up and nodded, turning around so he could stare out at the sea before laying back down on his chest, exposing his wet back to the sun above. Serene did the same, although being able to shake out her fur meant she was already reasonably dry.

“So, where're you from?” Serene asked. It was one of the things she had never managed to get Flint to tell her.

“I grew up in the mountains, to the west,” Flint said, speaking slowly. “We moved to the forest around here when I was still young. I guess while I have fond memories of the mountains, it's the forest that I've known most of my life.”

“Really? So that's why you live off campus? Your family's that close?” Serene asked, always wanting to know more about Flint's personal life.

“Yeah. I don't know if I much like the thought of living with someone else...” Flint suddenly felt Serene's paw touching his, and he smiled as he grabbed it. “Someone that I don't know, at least.”

“I actually came from this lake, on an island like this one,” Serene said, feeling it was only right to provide her history as well.

“Your family?” Flint asked when Serene suddenly fell oddly quiet.

“Gone.”

“Oh...”

Silence passed between the two, Flint wishing he hadn't asked that. Then Serene shook her head, eyes closed. Flint could see she was sad, lost in her thoughts. Leaning over to her, Flint gave her a quick lick on the cheek before resting his head against hers.

Finally Serene composed herself again. “Don't worry about it. That was long ago,” she said. Flint could tell she was straining to keep her voice even, trying to put on an act of her usual cheerful self. Pulling away from Flint, she stood up while keeping her eyes on the horizon over the lake. “There's some berries that grow deeper in the trees. I'll go get some if you wait here.”

Serene turned and walked away from Flint, the Quilava's eyes following her as she left. He noticed that her tail was drooping low to the ground, practically scraping through the sand as she walked. Looking back at the water, Flint knew she wasn't just going to get berries. He could stay on the beach like she wanted, or he could follow her and see what was up.

“I told you to stay on the beach,” she said, her voice raspy as she choked back tears. Flint hadn't realized she was crying.

So long as you stay close to me...” Serene muttered, lifting herself to her feet again and stepping off the stone, Buizel and Quilava rubbing against each other as they walked into the cave, through the spacious emptiness, and over to the twisting tunnel that Flint assumed led down into Serene's true childhood home.

Flint's flames illuminated the bare stone tunnel as the Pokémon couple descended down into the Earth. Serene had fortunately stopped crying, although her cheeks still glistened from tears caught in her fur. After about a minute of walking, Flint and Serene finally stepped out of the tunnel and into a large cavern, Flint immediately gasping in awe.

The cavern seemed to be underneath almost the entire island, the ceiling curving up high above. The far wall was hard to see from where they stood, but not because of the limited reach of the light from Flint's flames. Indeed, his ambient light was unneeded in the cavern. Patches of bioluminescent fungi covered the floor and walls of the cavern, casting the entire chamber in a dim blue light. As awe-inspiring as the sheer size and natural lighting within the cavern was, perhaps the most amazing aspect of it was the large pool in the cavern's immediate center. Pristine, crystal clear water filled the pool, a rock spire rising out of its center up to meet the very peak of the curved ceiling above. As if the cavern wasn't large enough to fit an entire family on its own, Flint noticed other passages similar to the one he had come from leading off from the cavern, possibly to other side rooms Serene's family had slept in.

“<i>This</i> is where you lived?” Flint gasped. “This is... Beautiful...”

Serene walked over to the water's edge, staring into the pool at her reflection and nodding. “Not just my family, but several others.”

That certainly explained why the place was so big, but one question remained for Flint, “...Where'd everyone go?”

Serene slowly shook her head. “I... I don't want to talk about that...”

Flint walked over to Serene and place a paw on her shoulder. “That's okay. I don't need to know anyway.” Looking out at the pool and the beautiful cavern, Flint smiled and nodded in approval. “Whatever happened, you must have had a great life here.”

“I did...” As Serene's voice fell silent, Flint noticed that the glowing fungi that produced sufficient light in the cavern on their own were dimming. Alarmed that something was going on, Serene quickly reassured him, “They do that when night starts to fall.”

“Night...” Flint whispered to himself as he suddenly thought of something. “What was that for?” Serene asked.

“I love you...” the Quilava whispered as he closed his eyes and rested his head against the larger Buizel's chest. “I... Don't you think that, well...” Flint knew that he was stuttering again, but he couldn't help it, he was just nervous about asking what he wanted. “Well... Couldn't we, maybe, sleep together?”

Serene grinned slyly. “Is that <i>all</i> you want?”

“Well, ah, we could... As if also able to sense that she wasn't as alone with Flint as she thought she was, Serene suddenly woke up, her eyes snapping open only to see naught but Flint's still-slumbering face. Lifting his paw off her and setting it on the ground, Serene sat up and rubbed one of her own paws over Flint's head, smiling at how cute the Quilava looked while sleeping. Turning away from him, she quietly padded over to the edge of the pool, sitting down by its edge and staring into its depths. Despite the water's clarity, it wasn't possible for her to see all the way down to the pool's bottom, yet still she felt that something wasn't right. A sense of unease and dread filled her heart as she stared into the pool.

Then, a ripple spread across the otherwise smooth surface of the water.

Before Serene could react, what seemed to her at first to be some sort of tentacle shot out of the water right in front of her. Serene fell back in fright as the tentacle-like thing shot right at her, curling around her body and binding her paws against her side. Serene started to scream in hopes of waking Flint but was cut off as her head was bound by the creature as well, leaving only her split tail sticking out and waving madly, yet hopelessly. Against her will, Serene was dragged beneath the surface of the water, seeming to completely disappear into the depths of the pool, no sign remaining as to what had happened to her.

Serene was dragged deep to the bottom of the water, able to see only through a small crack between the coils that bound her. Being a water type she was able to breathe in water to an extent and could clearly see through it. Eventually, her captor came into view; a great serpentine Pokémon, curled up around the base of the spire at the bottom of the pool and staring at Serene with sharp red eyes. Small scales coated its slick body: cream-colored for its upper half, while red and blue for the lower half that formed the tail currently holding Serene. Large hair-like fins draped down from its head, Serene's eyes widening as she finally recognize the Pokémon before her as being a rather large and long Milotic.

”You return.” The voice seemed to pierce straight into Serene's mind, penetrating her thoughts. The Milotic's mouth was still though, her speech having been entirely telepathic.

Y... You... Serene meekly thought, recognizing this specific Milotic. She felt like she was going to faint but at that moment the Milotic slightly tightened her grip on the Buizel, shocking Serene back to consciousness.

”Indeed...” The Milotic seemed to be able to read Serene's thoughts. ”I thought you would have been smart enough to stay away, after I single-handedly killed the entire population of your pitiful people who had invaded upon my territory, except for you...”

When the Milotic had attacked her people back years ago, it had been from the sea. The thought that the monster would have moved into the underground cavern hadn't even occurred to Serene. If she had known...

”Do not be too hard on yourself,” the Milotic said with a bitter-sweet tone to her mental voice, a grin twisting across her beautiful face. ”You are only a naive child who wanted to revisit her youth with no heed to the dangers. And you brought with you another...”

The Milotic let out a laugh in Serene's mind, the serpent having already been well aware of this. ”Yes. Without you, your companion, your lover—he is named Flint, is he not? After just a moment, Milotic suddenly lunged straight at Serene, grabbing the Buizel's head with her tongue and pulling it straight back into her throat as she eased up on the coils that bound her prey. Serene's body slipped out of Milotic's coils as she was pulled right into Milotic's maw by the serpent's powerful tongue. Just as soon as her body was completely free from the coils of Milotic's tails, Serene found her head trapped within the monster's gullet.

Serene screamed as best she could and thrashed about as Milotic closed her maw around the small Buizel that was little more than a snack to the large Pokémon. Her prey's head now caught in her throat, Milotic only had to take one powerful gulp, Serene's weasel-like body sucked straight into the confines of Milotic's gullet. Serene cried and screamed as she thrashed about in her fleshy prison, but the pulsating, slick, and soft walls pressed in on her so tightly that she could do little more than lightly kick.

Milotic moaned in pleasure as she used her long fins to feel the bulge Serene made in her throat as she was swallowed down whole. The feel of the Buizel making its way deep down into Milotic's body was one of utmost pleasure, only intensified by the slight movements that indicated her prey was still alive. Serene kept this up all the down until she found herself squeezed out into the Milotic's stomach, her long journey through the monster at its end. Obviously, no sign now remained of all the Buizel and Floatzel the Milotic had devoured on that day years ago, but Serene still knew this was the place many of her family and friends had met their own ends, and where she would now join them in death. Serene slumped against the fleshy walls of her final resting place, depressed and defeated.

Why do you do this... Serene thought, knowing the Milotic would hear her.

“Because, my child,” the Milotic sure enough responded in the Buizel's mind. You are delicious.

Is that all? Serene was thoroughly miserable, and such a simple answer wasn't making her feel any better.

“Does one need more reason to eat other than hunger and enjoyment of the food?” Milotic replied. “Now, rest and digest away... Let your body be reduced to mere nutrients for my own...”
1453322112211212111112121.title: Milotic devours Serene whole.

14533221122112121111121211.content:
Serene realized at that moment that the water that had filled Milotic's stomach was slowly being replaced by a much more acidic liquid. She whimpered and curled up into a ball as she felt her fur tingling. As her fur began to melt away, the organic rubber that composed the floatation ring around her neck and the fins on her paws also began to liquify and melt, streams of yellow and blue rubber running down and mixing with the mess of her melted orange fur. Serene didn't see any of this, although she could keenly feel it. Her eyes were tightly shut, her mind filled with images of the time she had spend with Flint.

I love you... Serene thought as she pictured Flint, using his image to push out of her mind all thoughts of her current digestion and imminent death. Still, the pain was only growing, making it hard to completely ignore what was happening to her. The stomach acids were literally melting her; with all her fur now gone, the pink flesh beneath also began to soften and turn to mush. Her body now thoroughly compromised by the acids, the stomach itself began to get in on the job of digesting Serene. The fleshy sac compressed around the doomed Buizel, fitting to her shape before continuing to tighten and flex. Softened arm and legs bones snapped clean through, her spine broke apart in several places, and her rib cage completely fractured, caving inward and sending shards of bones flying through Serene's chest cavity, piercing into the vital organs that struggled even now to keep her alive. Serene jolted as a shard pierced straight into her heart, all images of Flint disappearing from her mind as she screamed in excruciating pain.

“Relax...” Milotic's voice was faint in Serene's fading mind as she fought to bring back the images of Flint, determined to die with her love in mind. She was having trouble thinking though, her heartbeats now irregular, her lungs collapsed. Her brain itself was starting to melt from exposure to the acids through a soft spot in her skull that had completely melted away, leaving a clear hole in the back of her head. “Your body will forever be one with mine...” Serene's flesh and much of her muscles had completely melted away into a pink goop, blood flowing free through the acid. She didn't realize it, but her eyes were also gone, her melted eyelids floating away from her skull as her liquified eyes slid out of their sockets. “Do not concern yourself with the Quilava, I will take good care of him...”

The last thing Serene heard from the Milotic was an evil laugh, fading away as if moving into the distance. At the mention of Quilava, one final image of Flint finally came back to Serene's mind. Unable to move due to all her muscles and nerves having melted away, Serene couldn't even whisper his name one final time but was at least content with having his image in mind as she mind finally gave in, her consciousness and life forever slipping away, leaving behind only a melted Buizel carcass and a Quilava who would perhaps never know what happened to his love. The liquified remains of Serene's brain slid out the hole in the back of her skull, while her melted organs sloshed around in the Buizel corpse's exposed chest cavity. Serene's melted remains began to drain into Milotic's intestines where they would be unceremoniously processed to extract as many nutrients from the Buizel's remains as possible. Left behind in Milotic's stomach was Serene's broken skeleton, the flexing of the stomach working to grind it up as much as possible, snapping apart and fracturing bones until no identifiable remnants of Serene remained.

Milotic felt Serene's psychic presence disappear as she died, and basked in the feeling of her death. The serpent chuckled to herself, turning her head upwards and staring at the distant surface. Up there, Flint remained sleeping, entirely unaware of the events that had occurred beneath the water, and of Serene's death. He was forever trapped on this island, for Milotic to play with as she pleased, and she was indeed already formulating several ways to toy with the unfortunate Quilava...
14533221122112121111121211.title: Serene is digested.

145332211221121212.content:
Flint decided it would be for the best to simply wait for Serene to return. It seemed like she wanted to be left alone for now and he wasn't one to intrude. Besides, his fur wasn't dry yet. So Flint remained on the beech, laying with his paws pulled underneath himself as he stared off into the distance. While he wasn't fond of actually being in the water, it was certainly beautiful to look at.

How long he lay there he didn't know, losing track of the time. The sun was starting to set though when he realized Serene still hadn't returned. He guessed that it had been an hour or so since she had left, Flint frowning as he tried to figure out what could be taking her so long. Maybe now would be a good time to try tracking her down.

Flint sighed as he got to his feet, brushing of the sand that clung to his fur. Serene has been gone for about an hour now and even though he knew that Serene probably knows this island like the back of her hand he could not help but feel a little worried about her wellbeing. Flint took one last good look at the waves as they gently threw them self onto the shore almost as if they were reaching for him, before he turned and started to head towards the same path that Serene had taken about an hour ago. Just before Flint could step onto the path his ear began to twitch. At first Flint had to strain himself to focuse on the mystrious sound, but soon the sound began to get closer and closer until eventully Flint could make out what almost sounded like someone or something singing further down the beach to his left.

14533221122112121212.content:
Flint knew no good would come to him if he started to getting curious on this unfamiliar island. He continued walking closer to Serenes trail, but all he could think about is the song that continued to ring in his head, beckoning him with it's mystrious beauty. Flint was just about to step onto the path Serene took until he thought of something that stopped him in his tracks, if he continues now he will never know the sorce of the inchanting melody and the thought of not knowing would knaw at his bones till the day he dies. Flints curiousity got the best of him as he turned aroung and started heading back to the waters edge, getting just close enougth to where it seemed like the water desperatly reached out to touch his paws only to fail by a mere inch or so before reziding back for another go at him. Flint started to scan the beautiful beach in an atempt to pinpoint the direction of the song. A massive boulder off in the distence to the right of him caught his attintion. Who ever it is singing must be hidden behind that boulder. Flint turned towards the direction of the boulder and began to run at a slow yet steady pace, enjoying the felling of sand in between his paws. The curious Quilava slowed to an almost complete stop and quietly moved in closer to the massive boulder. His heart rate began to increase, fearing the worst if he gets caught, but his curiosity would not let him stop what he was doing until he gets a glimps of the pokemon whos call cut beautifly through the lake air like resonating crystal.

The Quilava positions his small yet long body aginst the boulder, his heart beating faster as he quickly, but quietly scoots to the edge of the boulder. Being certain that the sorce of the beutiful cry is on the other side of the boulder, Flint slowly peeked his head around the corner, front paws up aginst the rock ready to push off into a mad run if he need to escape. What Flint saw amazed him. Beyond the big boulder lie a beautiful cove with a small waterfall which cascaded rather quietly into the crystal clear water which for some reason looked ten times cleaner than the main lake that it was connected to by a 10x12 foot (10 foot by 12 foot) channel. Flints eye's were wide with astonishment, dumbfounded and amased by the fact that something this beautiful was hidden completely out of view from where Serene had left him on the beach by a big ugly rock. Flint became so taken by the view that he completely forgot about the mysterious pokemon cry which once filled the air just moments ago. Unfortunitly Flint became so caught up into the view that he did not see the pokemon who's cries were moments ago filling the air with song, approching him from the far left side of the cove, instead Flint (who was practicaly standing out in the open now) just stood there looking at a rainbow that had been formed by the mist givin off by the waterfall.

Flint eventuly snapped out of his day dream of him and Serene having a picnic on the sandy shore by the waterfall, and started to walk along the shore of the lake cove toward the waterfall, still unaware of the pokemon that was practicly swimming beside him as he walked along the shore. It was not until Flint caught the movement of something large and blue out of the left corner of his left eye. Suddenly Flints train of thought came rushing back to him, causing him to remebmer the reason he had hid at first in the first place. Flint whipped towards his left, a small flame crackling in his mouth, ready to shoot out into a long stream of fire in a split second like a weak solar flare ingulfing what ever is in it's path, but that small little flame quickly sizziled down to nothing once Flint saw his opponent and realized that his flame would only piss it off. Flint's eyes widened in fear and slowly began backing away from what he beleived to be a young Lapras, a large seaturtle like pokemon that is both a water and ice type. Flint continued to back away until he bumped into the worn out bank which towered atleast two feet above him, which is to high for his small, uncoordinatedly long body to jump up on to and the brittle dirt made it imppossable to climb.

The young wild Lapras who's rather small for his species had a confused yet almost hurt look on it's face as it watched the Quilava desperatly looked for away to escape. The turtle like pokemon procced to beach it's self getting closer and closer towards the terrifide Quilava.

145332211221121212121.content:
Flint's heart felt like it would jump out of his chest any second, and it only got worse as the young Lapras go closer and closer. Flint felt like a cornerd animal and none of his attacks would hurt this Lapras. An Idea suddenly popped into Flints head. Without wasting a second, Flint opened his mouth towards the slowly approching Lapras and unleashed a smoke screen, he then procceded to make a run for it while he had the chance.

The Lapras was a little sad at about being looked at as if it were a monster, but after being choked badly from the heavy smoke, the Laprases sadness turned to anger. The Lapras quickly unleshed an icy wind clearing the smoke almost as quickly as it appeared. Lapras uses psycic to catch Flint and eat him, saveing him the suffering...
1453322112211212121212.content:
Flint ran as fast as his little legs would allow, not stopping to look back for a second. Just when Flint started to feel safe again, a strange yet mysteriously beautful tune meet his ears once again.

The young Quilava's pace slowed to a stop as he turned around to see the young Lapras with it's mouth open and it's eyes closed, swaying it's head gently back and forth almost as if it were trying to trance him with it's song and movements. Unfortunatly for the young Quilava, the Lapras did not have any intentions on trancing the quilava, only the intention to get revenge for being looked at and feared as if it were some kind of monster. The Lapras had only one thing running through it's mind now. "If that little rat sees me as some kind of monster, than a monster he well see." The Lapras slowly opened it's eyes and looked dead into the Quilava's eyes. An evil grin slowly grew across the Laprases face while it continued to feel the air with it's mysterious song.

Flint felt the Laprases cold stare bare down upon him. Feeling uneasy, Flint turned his back towards the Lapras and begins to run again, but he had already waited to long to escape. Before Flint could even run a yard he felt what felt like an icy finger tapping at his heart, tapping slower with each tap, each tap growing colder and colder. His heart seem to slow with each icy chill, yet it got louder and louder. What started out feeling like a panic attack soon started to turn into something more.

Flints five sences begin to act strange and all of his strength seemed to leave him completely. His sight began to blur; the thump of his body collapsing under his own weight muffled, and every sound that he once heard clearly seem to fade until only white noise and the sound of his slow beating heart roared painfully loud in his head. He screamed out in pain and fear, but his cries never lift his lips in reality no matter how hard he tried, they only added to the ever growing louder sound of white noise and thumping heart. Flint felt like he no longer had the ability to even twitch let alone move. He wasn't even sure if he was breathing. Flint was almost sure that he was exsperinceing the first level of hell.

A new almost unoticeable sound began slowly grow louder. Flint could not make out the sound at first over the roaring in his head, but eventully it grew louder and started beginning to sound like laprases song, but there was something defferint about it. The once beautiful and majistic song slowly began to turn into a omunious wail of extrem darkness and sadness, feeling Flints head with depressing memories of sarrow and regret. Flint never felt so sad and scared in his life. Memories he had forgoten along time ago and never wanted to remember bombarded him to the brink of tears, then suddenly everything went black. Only the sound of his now fast beating heart could be heard, sending icy chills of fear and regret through every fiber in his body with every ungodly loud thump of his heart. Yet amoung the loud noises and umbearibly sad memory's that he had once forgotten and wished he would have never remembered, came an ever familiar voice. Flint's inner connsionence spoke out load and clearly among his thoughts...

"Three..."

Flint painfully snaps back to reality, crying uncontrolibly from his painfull and down right terrifing exspereance with what he thought could be hell. He never knew this level of fear exggsisted and he would rather die than to exsperiance it again. Flint felt weak as he tried to get up, his face drinched in tears that almost ran down to his chest. Flint looked up towards the edge of the water and became petrifide with fear when he saw the pokemon who did this to him had beached it's self about 10 feet away from him.

The Lapras had watched Flint as he went through the hell that it threw him into, but the Laprases revenge on the little Quilava was to satisfying. Seeing the young little Quilava terrifide face made the Lapras regret what it had done, he did not take into consideration how young the poor Quilava was before useing perish song on him.

"Maybe I really am no better than a monster?" The Lapras thought to its self, felling horrible about the fate it has bestowed upon the young pokemon. The worst part is that the move still has 2 more counts, and they only get worse.

The Lapras felt bad for what it was about to do, but it is the only way to spare the young pokemon from the next two, even darker trials.

Choice 1: The Lapras uses ice beam on Flint, knocking him out and cancling perish songs other two phase. Revives him with a oran berry it found (just cuz it can)

Choice 2: The Lapras catchs Flint with psycic and eats him, putting an end to his misery quicker and saving Flint the pain of the other two perish song phases (Lapras can learn psycic through TM)

14533221122112121222.title: Someone unfamiliar...

choices: Vaporeon means no harm; she's just weird.
Flint suddenly finds his body slipping into the Vaporeon's.
145332211221121212221.content:
Before Flint could even stand up to go looking around for Serene, his attention was drawn back to the lake as ripples began to appear across its surface near the shore. As he watched, the water at the center of the ripples seemed to bulge out like a blob that formed into a shifting, liquid face. Smoothly, gracefully, more of the creature emerged from the lake, seeming to literally form out of the water itself. Walking along the beech with slender legs now, Flint watched as a long, fin-like tail slid out of the water before popping through the surface with not even a splash. As the liquid creature walked across the beach its body seemed to solidify, water changing to solid flesh while maintaining a lustrous shine.

“Hello, cutie,” the Vaporeon said as her head shifted from liquid to flesh, her newly formed eyes batting flirtatiously at Flint.

“Hi...” Flint muttered, unsure who this newcomer was. Perhaps a friend of Serene's? “Do I know you?”

“No,” the Vaporeon answered slyly, stopping in front of Flint. Wrapping her long tail around his small body, she smiled. “But you could.”

“Do you know Serene?” Flint asked, glancing at the Vaporeon's tail. Despite having just formed out of water it wasn't wet, although it did have an almost liquid shine to it, as if water still flowed about just beneath a tightly stretched surface. When the Vaporeon didn't answer, Flint clarified with, “A Buizel?”

“I know plenty of Pokémon around these parts,” the Vaporeon giggled, dropping down on her rear legs and placing her front paws on Flint's back. “You are new?”

“I'm just here with Serene...” Flint muttered, glancing away from Vaporeon. He was starting to feel uncomfortable.

“So you do not come from here?” Vaporeon stroked her paws along Flint's back, her touch oddly cold and making the Quilava shiver. Without care Vaporeon ran her paws across the red incendiary spots that lay on Flint's back, a touch that, even with his flames off, should have given her a burn. However she continued on as if she hadn't felt anything, the Quilava's radiant heat not seeming to bother her at all.

“No, no...” Flint violently shook his head. “I come from the mainland...”

“So you swam here?”

“No! Serene carried me over...”

“This Serene, you are friends, yes?” Vaporeon asked, her grin widening. “Yet she is not here?”

“She went off to find some berries, but hasn't returned...” Flint muttered. Oddly enough he found himself growing used to the Vaporeon's touch; it almost seemed soothing. When she grabbed his sides and pulled him up, pressing him against her chest, he didn't mind. Her body was cooler than he preferred, but it was almost comfortable as she held him against her soft belly.

“We could be friends too. Very close friends...” Vaporeon grinned, bending down and kissing the top of Flint's head.
145332211221121212221.title: A seductive female Vaporeon emerges from the lake.

choices: Vaporeon merely keeps Flint inside her, unharmed.
1453322112211212122212.content:
“I don't even know you...” Flint muttered as he rested his head against Vaporeon's soothing chest, feeling her arms embrace him tighter and her tail pull closer around his feet.

“That is not a problem,” Vaporeon whispered. “You will know me and I you, soon enough...”

Flint smiled as he snuggled against Vaporeon, completely lost in the grip her mind seemed to have over his. He had almost forgotten about Serene, the Vaporeon's embrace seeming to be all he ever wanted. Slowly he cracked his eyes open to look up at his wonderful new friend, only to notice that his paws were starting to literally sink into the Vaporeon's chest.

Suddenly Flint snapped out of it, returning to reality as he struggled to pull his paws out. It was as if they were stuck in cement, though; Flint unable to move them at all. Quickly pulling the rest of his body away from Vaporeon, the Quilava looked up at her with a panicked look in his eyes. “What're you doing to me?!” he asked urgently.

“Aw, I was hoping you would go quietly. I like you...” Vaporeon sighed.

“I'm not going anywhere! Let me g—” Flint suddenly found himself cut off, his voice completely muffled by a watery tentacle that thrust out of Vaporeon's chest and wrapped around his head. He tried to scream but nothing came out. Somehow he could still breathe, but even that seemed to be under the Vaporeon's control and not his any longer. Frantically he tried to break free, however more tentacles emerged from Vaporeon's shimmering body and wrapped around his own, almost completely immobilizing him.

Flint was helpless to do anything as the tentacles drew him in to Vaporeon's body. His already stuck paws were just drawn in farther as Flint felt his muzzle press against her chest, easily slipping through it. It didn't take long for Vaporeon to draw most of the Quilava's body into hers, the restraining tentacles merging with her liquid body along with her prey. Tears ran down Flint's eyes as his head was completely sucked into Vaporeon, along with his paws and most of his chest. All that remained of the Quilava outside of the Vaporeon now was his furred back. Despite the paralysis Vaporeon's body seemed to induce in Flint, he almost shivered when he felt her stroking that final exposed portion of his back before it slipped into her shimmering body.

As soon as Flint the rest of his body get pulled into the Vaporeon. The hold that kept him from moving broke, and he begain to srtuggle for dear life. From the outside, Flint looked like he was in a small snow globe without the powdered flakes. The Vaporeon just laid there on the ground murring as Flint' beat against her body walls. Flint's watered down cries for help sent pleasurable vibes through the Vaporeons body as she continued to roll on the ground moinning.

The Vaporeons ears perked up, and she stopped every thing she was doing. She turned her head in the direction of the noise and saw a small buizel with a terrifide expretion on it's face, as she watched Flint thrshing around dessperately to escape. The Vaporeon just smiled.

14533221122112121222121.title: Vaporeon merely keeps Flint inside her, unharmed.

14533221122112121222122.content:
Vaporeon sat on her haunches and stroked her enlarged belly as she stared at the Quilava trapped within her, eyes wide with terror. Smiling, she began to sing in her natural language; a haunting melody which still reached Flint's ears deep within the liquid confines of her body. As if he was falling asleep he could feel his senses seeming to slip away from his body, however they weren't completely cutting off as normal. Instead, it was as if his consciousness was being transferred, merged even with that of none other than the Vaporeon.

Soon Flint found he could no longer see what his body could see, but rather what the Vaporeon was seeing. His ears no longer heard what he heard, nor were his physical feelings his own. All his senses seemed to be replaced by the Vaporeon's, all except speech or any ability to move. It was only when Vaporeon looked down at her chest again, though, at Flint's lifeless body inside did the former Quilava finally realize that his consciousness was no longer with his own body.

This proved to be a good thing however, as he couldn't help but notice that portions of his body were literally starting to disappear. Beginning with his paws, Flint mentally gasped as he saw his own body start to dissolve into liquid water, melting away within Vaporeon's chest. There was no blood, nor was it gruesome at all, but still Flint wanted to scream as he watched his former Quilava body literally dissolve until not a single tuft of fur remained.

”You are now one with me...” a voice in Flint's mind said. He knew it was the Vaporeon, speaking directly to his mind that now rested in hers. But then another voice spoke up.

”And me...”

That wasn't all though, slowly a crescendo of voices built up in Flint's mind, hundreds of individual entities trapped within Vaporeon's mind and body. Previous victims. Not a single one cried out, however; not a single voice complaining. All simply affirmed that they were there, and that Flint was now one with the collective.

Then Flint suddenly found himself able to speak again, to move and walk around in Vaporeon's body. At first he fell, not used to such long legs. Panting heavily, he held up an unfamiliar paw, staring at it as he whispered, “I... I don't want this... Please, I want my own body back...”

”One cannot recreate what has been destroyed,” one voice said.

”Your old body is useless,” another added.

”Unnecessary.”

“Please!” Flint pleaded, dropping to the ground and covering his unfamiliar eyes with his unfamiliar paws. He wasn't supposed to be a Vaporeon, he was a Quilava! “I have to get to Serene! She may be in trouble!”

”You do not need her.”

“Yes, I do!” Flint shouted. Despite being unfamiliar with his new body he instinctively began to cry and sob. “...She's all I wanted in my life...”

”Your life will be different now.”

”You will start anew, with us.”

”You do not need her.”

Flint's mind began to grow foggy, as if large portions of his memories and past experiences were being wiped out, completely destroyed. He could feel the Vaporeon work over his mind, looking at the memories before they were erased, peering deep into Flint's most private memories. Scrambling, he tried to somehow retain some of the precious memories before Vaporeon could destroy them, crying out verbally as he felt his first meeting with Serene vanish from his mind. One by one he felt those cherished memories flicker away, his mind converted to a blank slate.

Soon Flint, no longer able to even remember that name, began to wonder why he was crying. Slowing the tears, he stood up and looked around. He or she or it—he was no longer sure of what gender he really was—glanced around the empty beech. There was nothing left there. Turning around he walked towards the water's edge, softly padding along the sandy beech. When he reached the water he dipped his paws in without fear, instinctively letting his body lose its form amid the soothing liquid.

”You are one with us...” hundreds of voices cried out at once in Flint's mind as he swam away through the lake, exploring the underwater world.

”Yes... I am one with us...” Flint murmured, all memories of his past life completely lost to him. He was now part of the collective minds in the body of the Vaporeon, Flint the Quilava no longer existing.
14533221122112121222122.title: She completely absorbs Flint.

14533221122112122.content:
"Whats that?" Flint said as he watched a two bright glowing orb rose out of the water.

I don't know." Serene said as she slowed down and started heading towards it.

The two slowly made their way closer to the strange yellow orbs, hopeing to get a better look at them. Serene was know useing her tails like a trolling motor, as she came within 10 feet of the orbs and stopped.

"Serene, I have a very bad feeling about this." Flint said, begging her to turn around.

"Oh calm down, what could possibly happ..." Before Serene could finish her sentince, the two orbs made a bright flash of light, causeing Serene to jump back and sending Flint flying through the air.

Reaching into his mouth, Alpha felt out the floatation sac, grinning around his meal and arm as he sunk the claw into its rubbery surface. Serene gasped as she felt the claw poke into her ring, piercing deeper and deeper as Alpha pushed his claw into the bothersome rubber ring. Then there was a loud gush of air and a pop, Serene screaming in pain as her floatation ring burst apart. Shreds of the yellow organic rubber flew everywhere, sticking to the surfaces of Alpha's mouth and drifting to the ground outside. As Serene gasped and panted, trying to overcome the immense pain, she came to the sinking realization that now nothing was between her and ultimately being devoured by the Mightyena.

Completely unable to move or otherwise do anything to even so much as hinder Alpha's efforts, Serene could just watch sadly as Flint pounded at the ground, crying his eyes out in sorrow. Flames shout out of his fur like they were jet engines, Sneasel frowning from the heat but otherwise safe due to the careful positioning of his foot. “No!” Flint yelled. “Please, no, don't do this! Stop... Please, let her go... Please...”

Alpha merely grinned as he felt Serene's head start to slide down against his throat. While he could easily close his jaws now, he kept them open anyway, just so Serene and Flint could see their last, final glimpses of each other. As he felt the folds of his gullet slide around the sides of Serene's head, he knew that moment would be soon. The lovers knew this too, their eyes locking together for the final moments. Finally they fell quiet, no words needed to express their feelings. Then Serene felt the flesh start to creep around the sides of her head, closing in around her face and her muzzle. Just like that, her eyes slipped behind the wet folds, her vision going black. Barely able to move her own mouth, she quickly whispered out a single, “I love you...” before the tight gullet closed around the Buizel's muzzle, the last of Serene disappearing from view down Alpha's throat.

Flint's head fell to the ground, digging in to the grass and dirt as he sobbed, cried, screamed, whimpered; all somehow simultaneously. He almost didn't notice Sneasel releasing him, but he didn't care. It was pointless now. Hopeless. There was nothing he could do, even if he tried. Alpha would just knock him out in a single hit, or worse. Serene was gone, ingested, devoured by that massive, sadistic, cruel Mightyena. His single true love, never to be replaced. It had taken him all his strength and courage to come out to her, and now it was all gone, all for waste. She wasn't dead yet, but soon she would be, and this part Flint just couldn't watch.

Alpha didn't care though as he raised his head up, taking powerful gulps that sent the Buizel's body plummeting down his throat far faster than it had taken to actually ingest her in the first place. He felt Serene slip into his belly which sagged down underneath him with her weight. Just standing there, eyes closed, oblivious to the world, Alpha could feel the Buizel's brief struggles as she found herself free to move again. Then he felt the struggles heighten, increase in speed and intensity as Serene began to panic. And then, finally, the struggles stopped. Serene fell still, and Alpha slowly opened his eyes again, nodding down at Sneasel who had walked over next to him.

“Let's go. Leave that wimp to wallow in his own despair.”

Flint wasn't even aware of when the two Pokémon left, carrying their two fallen canine comrades with them, the Murkrow haven flown off on his own unnoticed a while ago. He didn't want to get up and face the realization that she was gone. All he wanted was to lay there, forever. He wanted the Earth to erode, to bury him, to wipe out his life. To end it all there, without him needing to admit to what had happened.

Sometime later, either minutes or hours he didn't know, Flint was found by a teacher wandering the grounds. They took him to the counselor. He was sent home, given vacation and scheduled therapy sessions with the counselor. He didn't tell them what had happened, not exactly. All he could say was that Serene was gone, and she wasn't coming back.
