"Flint... There is someone I would like you to meet. He is my top student in my upperclass and he is in desperate need of a good challange, but there is no one else I can think of other than you who can who can put up a good fight, so I told him about you and how good you are. I figured it would be good practice for both of you, so I told him to come here during lunch."

The coach steps to the side revealing a dog like pokemon, covered witth sharp brisly, yellow and white hair. He had a sharp look in his eye, but at the same time he had a warm, welcoming smile on his face giving him a friendly look. Flint could tell right away that he was an electrical type pokemon. He didn't look very strong, but then again, Flint looked like a toothpick and he was one of the strogest students in school. The two introduced one another and got to know one another before taking there positions on the feild.

"Okay I want a clean fight from both of you."

The two pokemon nodded to each other in agrement with the coaches words before once again taking their positions on the feild. The bell rang and the two pokemon started to circle the feild, eyeing each other, waiting for any sudden movements from the other pokemon. Flint always knew never to under estamate your opponite and to alway expect the unexpected.

Flint made the first move, unleashing hot embers towards the Jolteon hoping to get a direct hit, but as soon as the embers seemed to have made their mark the Jolteon just disappeared. Before Flint could comprehind what had just happened, the sound of needles whistled through the air behind him, and before he could react, an amince mount of pain burned against his back side causing him buckle and and collapse onto the ground. Flint got up and brushed the pain away only to get knocked back down again by the Jolteons quick attack.

The Jolteons speed was increadible and a force to be reckoned with, but he knew that if he couldn't find a way to beat him then he would never have a chance getting revenge on Alpha. Flint decided to take a defferint approch. He quickly shot more embers at the Jolteon, who in turn vanished again, but that was exactly what Flint was hoping for and in one fluied motion, spun around and unleshed a wall of fire. The needle that the Jolteon unleshed never made it through the massive wall of fire and before the Jolteon could dodge it, the wall of fire engulfed him, suvearly burning him. The Jolteon let out a cry of pain as he hit the floor. The Jolteon knew he was beat and didn't even bother to get up from the sevearity of his burns, instead he just lied there and smiled, proud to have finally found a worthy opponinent.

Both the coach and Flint ran over to the downed Jolteon. The coach pulled out a fullrestore and applied it to the Jolteon's burns and after the medicain took effect, Flint helped him up on all fours.

"You are really good... I haven't had this much fun battling since..." The jolteons voice trailed off. "Anyways... I hope we can do it again sometime."

"Me too" Flint replied with a smile

"Oh... I forgot to ask what your name was." Flint said as the two started to head to the gym exit.

"Silver" The jolteon said a little excitedly.

"Well I hope we can become Friends." Flint said still a little nervious around pokemon bigger then him, even if they weren't much bigger.

Flint just smiled, fore he hasen't had a real friend since Serene.
14533221122112212111222111112.title: Coach brought another top student who has aford...

145332211221122121112221111121.content:
After school was over, Flint headed to the tree where he and Serene expressed their love for each other. Every day he came here, vowing to kill Alpha and his gang for what they did. On the tree, Flint had scratched out a picture of Serene as best as he could. Flint sat, facing the tree and feeling the wind blow across his fur, when someone behind him spoke.
" Hey, are you okay?"
Flint turned around to see Silver, the Jolteon from earlier.
"Yeah I'm fine, just remembering" the Quilava said.
"I noticed that you come here a lot."
Flint turned to stare at the tree again. "You loved her didn't you?" Silver said
"What?" Flint said, turning around in surprise. "The Buizel on the tree, I mean"
"Yeah, too bad she couldn't live long enough for me to be truly happy." "I don't mean to be rude," Silver said, "but how did she die?"
"You don't want to know." Flint said unhappily
"Flint, I wanna be your friend, and if something bad happened, then I want to help you."
"Okay" the Quilava said. He took a deep breath, and told his new found friend everything. He told Silver the things he never told anyone, not even his own family. Tears ran down the fire pokemon's face and, every time he mentioned Alpha and his pack, the heat spots on his back would flare up slightly. Finally, after what seemed like an eternity to him, Flint finished. Then, he wiped his eyes and looked up, only to see that the Jolteon's eyes had teared up too. "How can someone be so cruel?" Silver said after a period of silence.
Then, Flint saw a spark in Silver's eyes. The electric-type stood up and spoke through his tears "Flint, I will do whatever it takes to help you get rid of that goddamned menace off the face of the world." Upon hearing that, Flint felt his eyes tear up again, but he didn't wipe them away this time.All his life he had never been so excited, not even when he evolved for the first time. And the only time he was happier was also at this spot, when he and Serene became lovers. Flint knew he was close to evolving into a Typhlosion. And with the help of his friend, they would be nearly unstoppable. "Silver," Flint said, "From now on, we will both practice every day together, so when we do come face to face with that son of a bitch Alpha, we will be ready to kill him and his followers."
"Now that's what I'm talkin about!", and Flint saw tiny sparks fly from the Jolteon's thick coat. And now that Flint knew he had a life-long friend, he smiled in happiness for the first time since the Buizel's unfortunate death. He then approached Silver, and gave him as close of a hug one four-legged pokemon can give another."Well," Silver said, breaking the silence, "since it's the weekend, why don't you come to my place tomorrow so we can practice. Oh, and don't think I'll go easy on you because we're friends." "I wouldn't expect anything less from you" Flint said, and he started laughing.
145332211221122121112221111121.title: Understanding

1453322112211221211122211111211.content:
The next morning, Flint woke, told his parents where he was going, then went to a lake that he and Silver agreed to meet at. After meeting up with him, the two began talking. "So, where do you live?" Flint asked.
"Just in a big hollow log that my great grandparents made into a house." Silver said.
"Well how much farther is it? My feet hurt." Flint joked.
"you'll know it when you see it."
When the fire-type saw the house, he knew Silver wasn't joking. A massive fallen oak that was so big it might fit a family of Gyarados!
"Mom, i'm back and i brought my friend!"
"That's wonderful honey!" Flint heard a voice say
Then he saw the owner of said voice. A small Espeon walked out. "Nice to meet you Flint." "Nice to meet you too Mrs....."
"Oh, just call me Rayne." the psychic-type said. Two more Pokemon then emerged from the house. They were a Flareon and an Umbreon. From what Flint remembered from school, the Flareon was fire-type and the Umbreon was the dark type, both of them an eevee evolution. "Oh, and this is my dad, Rotin" nodding toward the Flareon, " and my little sister Tsuki" nodding to the Umbreon. When Flint heard Tsuki's name, it sounded familiar." Do I know you?" the Quilava asked. " I don't know, you might have. We do go to the same school. You might have heard it passing in the hallway." "Maybe." but Flint knew where he had heard that name before. Serene once mentioned her name.
"Well are we gonna sit here all day or are we gonna train?"Silver said excitedly.
"Now hold on," Rayne said,"It's lunchtime. I'm sure you're hungry after walking here."

to my lover, whom i shall never speak to again, let him know that there is no sense to blame himself, rather take the fury on the one who left me in my dying state, Alpha, taker of lives and love, whose tainted heart is only matched by the brutality of his actions, let him burn in hell, and let death take him slowly, painfully. let him regret killing me and anyone else who he killed... hang his son who he does this for and let his blood drip out onto his fathers dying body. only then will i be avenged... death is at my side, and he shall take me soon... goodbye kirov

145332211221122122.content:
Sneasel grinned broadly as he lunged his claw down, Flint screaming as its razor sharp edge sliced deep into his neck. Blood splattered out from around the wound, showering both Sneasel and the dying Quilava as it coated both of their fur a dark red. Flint instinctively began to kick and thrash about as Sneasel kept pressing his claw deeper into the weasel Pokemon's neck, destroying any tissue or muscle that got in his way. Then, suddenly, Flint let out a gurgle and blood began to pour from his mouth, his eyes shooting wide as Sneasel's simply narrowed.

Finally Sneasel withdrew his claw from Flint's neck, leaning down next to his face as he whispered to the nearly dead Quilava, “Rest in peace knowing that I will do all in my power to make Serene's life a living hell for what you did to me.”

Tears streamed down Flint's cheeks, intermingling with his blood. All he could do was gurgle weakly, Sneasel having cut straight through his trachea and leaving him literally breathless. As his eyes slowly closed, the last thing he saw was Sneasel cackling manically over him.

1453322112211221222.title: No one shows up.

14533221122112212222.content:
Sneasel gave Flint's limp corpse a sharp kick to ensure he was dead, the carcass flopping over slightly but otherwise completely motionless. Nodding in approval, he bent down and wiped his bloody claw off on the Quilava's already paling fur before turning around and walking back to where the rest of the gang stood. “He's all yours,” he said while looking at Poochyena and Houndour, nodding back over his shoulder at the corpse.

Eagerly the two canines set off running to where Flint's body lay, drools dripping from their fangs as they sunk their teeth into the Quilava. Savagely they began to feast on the carcass, pulling off limbs and gulping them down whole before tearing into the still warm meat of his chest. Ripping off flesh and muscle, blood splashed over the Poochyena and Houndour as they tore open Flint's lifeless chest cavity and began feasting on the buffet of organs inside, ravaging the corpse of Serene's former lover with complete disregard for the dead.

“What now?” Murkrow asked as Sneasel tried wiping some blood off his fur using grass and leaves. He scowled, the blood proving too dried and sticky to come off easily. He'd have to fine some water to bathe in.

“We'll need to tell Alpha what happened.” Sneasel glanced over at Flint's carcass and the two canines devouring it, tilting his head curiously at the sight of the Quilava's exposed ribcage. “That we had to kill the Quilava.”

“Did we have to?” Murkrow asked.

“No,” Sneasel shook his head before grinning again. “I just wanted to. Alpha won't care either way.”

The sound of snapping bones distracted Sneasel and he turned to look back at the feast. Poochyena had clamped his jaws down on Flint's neck, twisting and pulling at it until the spine had completely snapped. Yanking at it some more, Sneasel smiled as he saw Flint's head tear away, Poochyena dropping it on the grass as he began to gnaw on the Quilava's skull, seeking to crack it open like an egg.

Murkrow wasn't so fond of looking at the mess, averting his eyes from the scene before continuing, “You don't think this will complicate things with the Buizel?”

“Fuck the Buizel. Hell if I care that Poochy never gets his girl.”

“You think that is all this is for? Ensuring Alpha's son gets the girl he wants?”

“No idea. Maybe Alpha really does care that much for his son; maybe there's more to this than there seems. It doesn't concern me.” Sneasel flexed his claws and smiled as he looked down at them, especially the one still slightly stained with Flint's blood. “So long as I can keep fighting and killing like Alpha said I could, I'm happy.”

“What about the school?” Murkrow asked. “What if they were to find out about what we're doing? On their campus, no less.”

Sneasel continued to smile as he watched cracks form along the exposed skull of Flint's head as Poochyena held it in his jaws until finally it shattered. Dropping it again, Poochyena began digging into the now exposed brain, tearing at and literally devouring Flint's mind. Meanwhile Houndour was quite content to satisfy himself with the body, which had been torn apart so badly that little now remained that could identify what the carcass had actually been.

“If someone, anyone, student or staff were to find out, rest assured that either we or Alpha would deal with them and no one would be the wiser.”

Silence passed as the canines finished their meal. When all was said and done, all that remained of Flint amid the grass was his shattered head—devoid of flesh, muscle, even the brain—and devastated body. His arms and legs were gone along with organs and muscle, the exposed ribcage and spine lying amid mere tatters of blood-stained flesh. Licking themselves off, Poochyena and Houndour walked over to Sneasel and Murkrow, the four friends and gang members nodding to each other before setting off to meet up with their leader.

1454221.content:
July had just moved to this town. Not that far mind you, just a few towns over, but she still moved and it was quite a sad time for her. She had to say good bye to all of her friends and go to a place she has never been, and just before school started to top it all off. Her family moved to a house quite close to the school so it isn't too bad of a fly for her to get there, and she had been studying her schedule the night before in her nervousness so she has that down to a tee. It should be quite an easy start to the school year for her, but this thought has done nothing to quell her nerves. You see, this is her freshman year of high school. While most pokemon have evolved at least 1 stage by now, she is still a pidgey. She is quite powerful for one, but a pidgey is a pidgey and is not powerful at all compared to second stage pokemon. She is way behind the power curve and who knows what could happen to her should another pokemon go on a power trip.

She arrives at the high school, well before the bell, trying to keep her head down and avoid other pokemon if possible. Due to the massive size of the entry doors, she is unable to open them, embarrassingly trying to pull them open before noticing a little flap she and other small pokemon can enter. July zips inside of the school and takes a look around at the empty hallway. Dark blue lockers line the hallway and the floor is covered in light blue tiles. The walls are made of cinder blocks painted white and the ceiling has drop tiles that are white as well, with a panel light every couple of yards down the hall. The hallway seems to branch off in every direction with classrooms and storage rooms everywhere. She starts to worry about getting lost, it would be quite easy to do that in a building this big. She quickly racks her memory for the classroom she has to go to first. It is E258. The way this school numbers classrooms is the letter is the wing of the building, A-F; the first number is the floor, 1-4; and the next two numbers is the room. This means she has to go to room 58 in the E wing on the second floor. Should be easy enough.

July races though the halls, hoping to get there quickly so she doesn't have to see any other pokemon until class starts. Maybe she will be able to make a friend or two during class so she doesn't have to be alone all the time. Flying up the stairs and to the E wing, she quickly finds her class. The plaque on the right side of the door says: "Room E258, Mr. Kilo"

What class does Mr. Kilo teach?

145431.content:
In the night of the big city, when everyone is on their way home under the moonlight. There’s a Noivern, whose name is Zac, sitting on the chair in front of his desk, preparing the first day of his new high school life.
“…After months investigation, police has ended the investigate due to lack of clues and evidences. The reason of the accident that burnt down the school has become a mystery…”
He closes the TV and sighs, despite how long it’s been, he still couldn't wipe the horrible memory away from his mind.
He’s one of the survivors of that accident, where thousands died and few survived. Most of his friends passed away because of it, but he luckily survived, a close one, to be honest. He was flying outside of the school when it happened, giving him enough time to react and escape…
He sighs again, tries to sweep all those memories away and focus on the work he’s doing now. He checks the files again and again, makes sure he put everything he needed in it, after that, he puts it into his bag and lay on the bed lazily. Time to get some rest… Tomorrow is going to be a long day…

---------------------------------------------------------------------------- -------------------------------------------------------------------------------- -

Zac soon arrived the school. He lands in front of the front door and looks around, silence and quite is all it is. Maybe it’s because he arrived too early? He doesn't know, not like he really care. But since it’s still early, maybe he should go around and take a look at his new school before class start.

1521.content:
The school was enormous! Blitz had never seen so many Pokemon in one place before! Every type of Pokemon imaginable could be found lounging in the lobby, reading in the library, or talking in the halls. But one thing Blitz didn't see was any other Jolteon. Oh, sure, there were other eeveelutions, but none of them were electric types. In fact, most of them were Vaporeon, water types who wouldn't accept or understand him. There were other electric Pokemon too, but Blitz was nervous about introducing himself.

It wasn't that he was scared, far from it actually. Blitz had been a running back on the football team at his old school and had had no problems being the jock he was. But this place was bigger and there were already established cliques. He knew they wouldn't accept him readily. There also stood the fact that Blitz was a bit...different. 15422.content:
The familiar feeling of worn, cold stone pressed against the large Umbreon's paws as she made her way towards the enormous school where she studied, many smells both familiar and not, wafting past her as she weaved through fellow students. Already the stares came, baring down on her firm, agile, yet subtly curved figure that swayed with each step she took, her bright blue rings capturing the unwanted attention of potential predator who could not help but eye her form.

Filthy animals...not even trying to hide their intentions...

Already on full alert as one should be when attending this particular school, she made her way up the step and through the doors of the campus building, her eyes continuing to scan all who posed a potential threat to her well being.

This school, if one could even call it that, was notorious among the populace for being one of the most dangerous places around very much like the wilds if not worse. With so many coming and going each in every day, many smaller pokemon often go missing, kidnapped and eaten by the much larger predators of the school and often without anyone noticing or seemingly caring. Graduating this school truly was feat to behold, only the strongest and most dangerous of individuals capable of doing such, earning the utmost respect from peers wither that be from admiration or pure fear. It was not unheard of for some graduates to stay behind and form gangs, some of which have grown far to strong to be reasonably dealt with.

Nobody truly knows why this school seems to remain such a lawless land, but many speculate that part of the problem was due to the lack of authoritarian figures to run the school. Due to the nature of the place, finding teachers for hire became difficult, only the most desperate or dedicated scholars being up for the task in the first place.

"Hey Rhyas!"

The Umbreon stopped in her tracks upon hearing a familiar voice shout her name over the constant bustle of daily commute. The Umbreon looked around towards the sound with little success.

"Up here silly~!"

Rhyes panned her head up to spot the source of her name call. Fluttering approximately 15 feet above the crowed was a familiar face, a fairly large Flygon beaming down at her with utmost joy before slowly making its way down towards her.

"Oh... hey Reeve," Rhyas smiled seeing the familiar face of a long time friend and partner in crime so to speak, "you're here awfully early in the morning, did you get called out for being late again?" The air around the dark type begain to swirl as dust others have tracked in was stired up forcing the Umbreon to squent a bit before the Flygon landed firmly before her with a thud. Before her now stood a massive Flygon who smiled as he crained his neck down to speak to her at eye level.

"But of course... you know how I don't like being yelled at by that crazy Floatzel! She so scary when she is angry!"

Rhyas could hold back a snicker,

"What are you laughing at! You know I'm right..." Reeves pouted looking away arms crossed, not very fond of being teased.

"You're right~" The Umbreon leaned against her friend as if to apologies with a simple act of affection, "it's just funny seeing someone as big as you afraid of someone so small~."

"Mmmmm shush you..." he retaliated "you're lucky I love you..."

"I know~!" The Umbreon chimed. She loved teasing the Flygon, he made it way too easy for her after all, but she knew deep down he liked it. "Soooo what did you need big guy~"
15422.title: Rhyas

1543.content:
The doors to his new school open, letting all of the sounds from the pokemon inside greet his ears. The nervous Umbreon stepped into the school, intimidated by the noises that surround him from all sides, but his intimidation was not caused from being a new student, but it was caused by being in public. He was a very emotional shy, antisocial pokemon who rarely spoke to anybody in fear that something he might say may be thought of as weird, causing others to think little of him. He would often walk by others with his head down, blocking out their voices in hope that they are not trying to talk to him even though deep down all he really ever wanted was someone he could talk to freely without being thought of as strange. Not very many have heard him speak, some even think he is mute. On the bright side, because of his helpless looking disposition many pokemon easily under estimate his strength and keen senses.

He takes a left at the entrance to the school and heads into what he thinks looks to be the front office. There he sees a rather young looking Ninetails, using her tails and her phycic abilities to sort through papers. She looked up at the new student as he approached the front desk.

Well hello there!" the Ninetails said with a warm welcoming smile "You must be Gessyoku are new exchange!" (just say Syoku for short) Syoku nodded.
"Here is your new schedule!" The Ninetails says using her mind powers to suspend it in front of Syoku's face to read, then sticking it in his bag that he had hanging around his neck. He nodded with a smile as if saying thanks then turned around letting the smile on his face go blank once again as he headed through the doors leading him to the main part of the pokemon school to once again be greeted with the loud noises that echo through the school. Syoku couldn't help getting a bad feeling about this place.
1543.title: You choose

15431.content:
The sights… the sounds… every pokemon in the room no matter what size they were, these were all things that seemed hard to get use to even after being around this kind of atmosphere all his life. To Syoku, getting over his quiet and shy nature seemed near impossible for him to do.

Syoku proceeded into the main room which appeared to be the lunch room at first glance, but his thoughts were not focused on the room at the moment, but on the floor he walked. He kept his head down just enough to see his path while still avoiding the other pokemons eyes that he knew were bearing down on him as he walked. To Syoku’s relief, he spotted a mat were four feral pokemon could sit. He quickly headed towards it and set the book bag hanging around his neck down beside him. Using his mouth, he pulled out his schedule, spreading the rolled up piece of paper out in front of him to read.

Yes! I have a battling class second period! He thought to him self, wagging his tail.

Battling was the one thing Syoku loved to do. When he is about to enter a battle, all of his worry seem to go away and the pressure of being around others and what they thought about him seem to go away, or at least till the battle is over.

Syoku ears twitched as the bell sounded for first period. He took his paws off of his schedule and watched as the piece of paper rolled itself back up. He then proceeded to put it back into his bag, which he then slipped back over his head.

Note: He is still shy and quiet during battle.
15431.title: Main School Room

154312.content:
Approaching the door to his first lesson, Syoku took a deep breath with his head sinking down, mentally preparing himself for the stares that were about to fall on him. The time he wasted trying to find the room hadn’t made him late, but it didn’t make him early. The crowds in the wide hallways had thinned out, hall monitors were beginning their patrol and the mumbles of moving students had gotten much quieter. He was sure to be greeted by a collection of curious eyes and a teacher who is overly eager to introduce him at the front of them all.

He took another long breath, making it as long as possible to delay himself, twiddling his sweaty toes, feeling the air flow into his nostrils and out of-

“Shit, guess he was right.”

The door whacked Syoku on the nose, the the force slightly pushing him back but making sure to hop away from the full impact of it. Instinctively, the Umbreon lowered his back close to the floor, his eyes glaring forward and his feet ready to pounce or jump away from an attack...but all that stood before him was a yawning Zangoose scratching the mane of fur around his neck.

He, and from his current view there was no mistaking it was a he, was large to be sure. Syoku’s eyes were only level to about the navel of his thick gut. His legs were stumpy but his body was big nonetheless, even his ears seemed a bit longer and sharper than what Syoku expected of a Zangoose. He was intimidating, but that said, the fox didn’t feel as if he had meant any ill will; he was just in the way.

“Who’re you?” The Zangoose’s words struck him, he wasn’t expecting a direct question so quickly. His voice had...presence. It was as if Syoku’s limbs shook at the sound of them, although it had also been quite some time since he had to engage with someone in a conversation. Four seconds passed and he still couldn’t even mutter an answer, but to Syoku it felt like twenty. “...Huh, alright... I’m guessing you’re here for Chemistry?”

"Chemistry? Uh, he’s asking for what lesson I’m here for…" Syoku’s mind was blank for a second, his head scrambling for the schedule in his bag for a second until an answer quickly came to mind. "The lesson on the door's label, of course. The one I was trying to find!"

The Umbreon hastily nodded, cursing himself in his thoughts despite the Zangoose’s indifference.

“Apparently we’re getting an assembly first, then we skip to the second lesson.” The Zangoose rolled his eyes and forced a heavy sigh. “If you don’t know where that is feel free to tag along, I have a pretty good idea going by what I saw on the tour day.”

Syoku looked at his eerie gaze with a shiver, then stared at the empty classroom passed the open door. His ears slowly folded down as his eyes repeated the same process. The Zangoose seemed to pick up on it, rolling his eyes again.

“My name is Zanuff, if that helps. What’s yours?” Again, the Umbreon didn’t reply, and this time the Zangoose was much less patient. “Look, if trying to open your mouth means you can’t start walking, then I’d prefer if you’d just follow me already.”

“Gessyo-uh, mine’s Syoku,” the Umbreon finally managed to stammer out. Zanuff’s gaze fixed on the Umbreon who had broken his eye contact as the Zangoose lowered his upper body to look down at him. As he timidly avoided the large mongoose's gaze, the Umbreon could see the gluttonous Pokemon’s giant shadow on the floor. Needless to say, it didn't make him any more comfortable.

“Weird name… You foreign? Is that why you’re quiet?”

"Your name’s weirder than mine!" he thought, but kept his words to himself. His face betrayed his intentions, however, and a surprised brow raised towards Zanuff as he chuckled at the reaction. Could he trust him? He didn’t exactly look harmless, but what else was there to do? If he was lying, there would be a classroom full of students behind him.
154312.title: Goes to first period.

1543122.content:
Reserved

Syoku ducked his head passed the arm that kept the door open and sat at one of the desks for quadruped Pokémon. The Zangoose merely looked at him, his head tilting with confusion at first before he’d angrily blow a gust from his powerful nostrils. “What the fuck's your damage?”

“O-oh I just don’t want to… I mean, in case they come back-”

“So you’d rather sit alone while no one’s in the halls? You’re not bright, are you?” Zanuff scoffed. He attempted laughing off Syoku's actions but his annoyance was clear through his tone. He shrugged his shoulders though and turned around, giving a short wave and a sarcastic sounding “bye” before taking off.

The Umbreon sighed, slumping his head down onto his desk.

“What a way to start the year...”

He felt like an idiot. He felt like he had lost an early chance to have company, even a friend, and one who seemed like he could protect himself no less. Questions taunted his mind over and over. He wished he hadn't been awkward. He wished he could talk normally, or talk at all.

...But his head rose back up in surprise as the door slammed shut. The Zangoose had returned, his paw firmly turning the handle and shifting the knob under it until the hard metal sound of the lock clicked.

“Well if you’re so eager to make someone’s day, I suppose I should use you for myself,” the Zangoose chuckled, his paw going down to scratch his fat, hanging sack as he turned around to him. He tugged and squeezed his balls in front of the Umbreon, walking closer while taunting the black fox with his steadily growing length.

A tint of red burned up on Syoku’s cheeks, his mouth slowly opening and his heart punching at him, but he quickly closed his jaws, placed one forefoot in front of the other and lowered his back. Battling was what he did best. The Zangoose was far larger than he was, but that hasn’t stopped him before; no beast could ever intimidate him in battle. The way he was being intimidated was more...forward than he was used to, but nothing had changed.

“Just keep a cool head and take the battle!” Syoku told himself, slightly hurting his neck while looking up at his foe directly in the eyes.
1543122.title: Wait in the classroom

15431221.content:
Syoku’s toes curled nervously as they stared each other down, the Zangoose merely smirking without another hint of movement. Despite appearances, the Umbreon was bulky. He could take far more hits than his figure implied, and by the looks of the Zangoose’s massive form, he probably could land a powerful hit then dash away. Syoku lightly grinded his teeth, a drop of sweat sliding against his head of fur at the thought, but as the faster Pokémon his best bet was to utilise his speed and make the first move.

Without wasting another moment, the Umbreon began to sprint and bounce, watching how quickly the Zangoose’s eyes could track him.
